loans.name: Jumdaya

texts.en:
Jumdaya is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetable business.

Jumdaya has been in this business for 4 years. Jumdaya earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынаре 59 лет, замужем, мать 7 детей, дети взрослые и самостоятельные, живут отдельно, У Чынары - среднее образование, с 1981 года занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день у Чынары имеется 2 лошади, 2 дойные коровы и 10 овец. Дополнительным источником дохода также служит продажа картофеля оптовым покупателям. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коровы. Чынара намерена вложить доходы от кредита в приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на постройку нового дома.
texts.en:
Chynara is 59 and married with seven children, all of whom are grown up and live on their own. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry since 1981. She now has two horses, two milking cows and 10 sheep, and sells potatoes to wholesalers as an additional source of revenue, with a total average monthly income of 10,000 KGS. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Chynara has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase a cow. She intends to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her number of livestock and plans to save toward building a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda is 64 years old and married with three children.

Nelinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nelinda has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Nelinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kimly's Group

texts.en:
Kimly is 44 years old and a married mother blessed with four children. For the sake of her family, rice cropping and pig-raising are the main sources of income; these are the businesses that she has had for several years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Kimly is in her eighth loan cycle, and her joint borrowers are in their seventh loan cycle. She has repaid her past loan completely, and it enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. 

For this cycle, she is a leader requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR (Cambodian riels), and her fellow group members are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a pigpen. She hopes that she can build her pigpen on time so that she can prevent illness in her pigs.

loans.use: To build a pigpen

loans.name: Siyet

texts.en:
Siyet (in photo) is 51 years old and lives about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, capital city of Cambodia. She has two sons and four daughters. Two of her children sell grocery items, one is a garment factory worker, and the other three are in school. Her husband is a boat driver.

Before, Siyet had a grocery inventory and space in a local market. But, she transferred that inventory to her children and she now sells grocery items from home. 

Siyet wants to expand her grocery store by buying additional grocery items to sell. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan and she will also use a part of the loan to a build a proper grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell and to build a proper grocery shop.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Remy works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Remy is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Remy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
Lutgarda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, eggs, vegetables, etc., for her restaurant business.

Lutgarda has been in this business for 20 years. Lutgarda earns more income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now, she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, eggs, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Julieta works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell rice. 

Julieta is borrowing PHP 28,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks to sell through her general store business, like candies, chips, bread, and canned goods.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell, like candies, chips, bread, and canned goods.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 42 years old and married, with seven children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Elsie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mat's Group

texts.en:
Mat is 40 years old and a married mother, blessed with five children, three school children and two under-aged school children. Her big family solely counts on a single agribusiness, rice farming, which she has occupied for 20 years, earning about KHR 35,000 per day. 

Mat, a fourth-cycled borrower, joins a group of three, with two first-time borrowers with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). Mat has repaid her past loan with success and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. 

Now, Mat applies for a loan in the amount of KHR 1,400,000, whereas her two joint-borrowers are seeking KHR 1,000,000 each. 

As the leader, Mat will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her crops. She strongly believes that she can gain a good yield, with high income in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her crops.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a repeat borrower, in good standing with the Intersect Fund, and she runs E&L Deli Grocery in Paterson, New Jersey. She has been in business for five years, and has used her past loan to pay for store merchandise, camera equipment, and a freezer. After successful winter and spring seasons, she is looking for more funds to restock for the summer.

loans.use: to purchase store merchandise.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is 53 years old and widowed. She was gifted with four children and they live happily in a rural community. To have a source of income, she engages in the tailoring business. She aims to make her business profitable in order to sustain the necessities of her family. She wants to access a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fabric, thread, needles, hooks and eyes and other materials she needs in her tailoring  shop. Being a kind and industrious mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, hooks and eyes and other materials needed

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn helps her husband earn an income with her manufacturing business, making and selling polvoron in town. She also offers it in the school canteen for sale. She has been doing this for more than three years and has been able to supplement their daily income. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for raw ingredients. She had many customers, as it tastes good. She wants to buy more raw ingredients for making polvoron  to cater for orders and demand. She is hopeful and determined to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients for making polvoron (a common Filipino dessert)

loans.name: Judith Jiovanna

texts.es:
Judith tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su madre y hermanos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región, Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, sus clientes en la mayoría son mujeres, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cosméticos, cremas de belleza, perfumes entre otros productos de belleza y hacer crecer su negocio para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Judith is 23 years old. She lives with her mother and siblings in the district of Cayalti, a community whose residents work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Perú's northern coast.

She makes a living by selling beauty products. Her business is located in her home and most of her customers are women. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase cosmetics, beauty creams, perfume, and other beauty products so that she can grow her business and offer more to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, beauty creams, perfume, and other beauty products.

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es:
Aura Estela tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad alejada y rural del distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, bebidas y alimentos preparados por ella misma en el interior del colegio de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de golosinas y insumos para la preparación de alimentos y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Aura Estela is 58 years old. She lives with her husband in a rural, remote community in the district of Cayalti. Residents of this area work in agriculture, commerce, and raise cattle. It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region, on Perú's northern coast.

She makes a living by selling snacks, beverages, and prepared food inside of the district's high school. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 nuevos soles so that she can purchase a variety of snacks and supplies for food preparation to offer them to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of snacks and supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Sam Ang

texts.en:
Sam Ang and her husband are construction workers. She lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh and she has three young children: one son and two daughters. 

Sam Ang wants to buy a motorbike for commuting. It’s difficult for her because she needs to take motor taxi or ask her neighbor to drive her very often.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Ever

texts.en:
Ever is 52 years old, with five children and married to a farmer. Her husband is also the one who drives the motorcycle for the community. She helps her husband manage the business. She is a very hard-working mother. She also loves to cook food for her family. 

Ever is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for her motorcycle, so that they serve their clients well.

In the future, Ever hopes that she can meet all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for seven years. Marilyn earns more income from her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy an oven, chairs, tables and ingredients to make pizzas.

loans.name: Sayoeurm's Group

texts.en:
Sayoeurm, 57, is a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She struggles for a living via rice farming as her single source of income. She has been involved in her current business for several years. Sayoeurm has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for a long time and has repaid her past six loans  successfully. Now, her living conditions are getting better than before. She is now applying for 1,300,000 KHR whereas her joint borrower is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. 

Sayoeurm is the group leader and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She truly believes that she can earn a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay laborers to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn is 50 years old and a resident from Battambang province, Moung Russey district. She is married and has five children. She grows rice as the main income. It is the business that she has been involved with for 25 years. 

This is the sixth loan for Sorn and fifth loan for her joint borrower in a group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loans has helped Sorn to uplift her lifestyle progressively. Sorn is a group leader for this cycle and 1,400,000 KHR is the loan portion for her and it is the same loan amount for her co-borrower. Sorn will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop, and to buy rice seed and insecticide. She highly hopes that she can gain high income to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop, and to buy rice seed and insecticide

loans.name: Eva Daysi

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 39 años de edad tiene dos hijos y es casada, su esposo se dedica a la carpintería, desde hace más de diez años.
 Ella estudio solamente hasta sexto grado ya que la escuela le quedaba muy lejos, sus hijos dependen de ella, la señora es costurera, ella también se dedica a la crianza de ganado criollo desde hace más de diez años.
Con el crédito comprara una ternera y una vaca lechera, con lo cual le generara mayores ingresos para su familia, ya que sus hijos dependen de ella sus planes a futuro son seguir trabajando fuertemente para que sus hijos estudien hasta donde ella pueda ayudarles, también sueña en poder remodelar la casa, hacerla más grande para que sus hijos vivan bien.
texts.en:
Eva is a hard working woman; she is 39 years old, has 2 children and is married. For over 10 years her husband has worked as a carpenter. She only studied up to the 6th grade because her school was too far. Her children depend on her, she is a seamstress and she has also been raising Criollo cattle for more than 10 years. 

With the loan she will buy a calf and a dairy cow, with which she be able to generate greater earnings for her family since her children depend on her. Her plans for the future are to continue working hard so that her children can continue studying for as long as she can help them. She also hopes to renovate her house, making it bigger so that her children can live well.

loans.use: buy a calf and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hoss' Group

texts.en:
Aged 35 and a resident of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Hoss has three children. Currently, she needs to support only two kids; one is under-school age and one is in school. For her family, growing rice cropping and paid working jobs are the main source of income. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she and her joint borrower are in their second cycle with a successful repayment of the past loan. 

Now, Hoss's living conditions are getting better than before. For this cycle, she is applying for 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower is seeking 1,600,000 KHR. Hoss is the leader and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She really hopes that she can gain triple income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Chamrourn

texts.en:
Chamrourn , age 27, is a garment factory worker. He lives in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh city and just has one young daughter. His wife is also a garment factory worker along side him.   

Chamrourn commutes to work by driving his own motorcycle, but the motorbike is old and uses a lot of gasoline so that’s  why he plans to sell it.

He is applying for a loan to add to the money from selling his old motorbike in order to buy a new one.

loans.use: To add to his own money to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Ren is 35 years old and comes from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married and has two children. For her family, two hectares of rice farming is the single source of income which generates about 33,000 KHR. This is the first microloan for Ren and her co-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and they are requesting a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Ren is the leader and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for labor costs. She truly believes that she can boost her crop yield in a  timely manner so that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheets, wood and nails to repair the roof of her dwelling.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 56 years old and married, with four school-aged children. Dina has requested a loan to purchase more kilos of dried fish to sell. She has had this business for about five years. She also has a meat grinder and sells vegetables in her store at the market.

Dina will use her profit to expand her business and to save for her children's studies. And she hopes that Paglaum MPC will continue to support her with her financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Evelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines and other groceries.

Evelyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 59 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Lapasan Clarin. She operates a general store, which she has been doing for six years.
 
Corazon requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to purchase a meat grinder. This is a new business venture where she can provide grinding services at her stall at the market. Corazon plans to use her profit to expand her business and save for her other business.

loans.use: to purchase a meat grinder

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a 54-year-old married mother of seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Luzviminda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Luzviminda has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Juanita is 50 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Juanita has a fish and sea foods vending business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and sea foods to sell to her customers.

Juanita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and sea foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Lorna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 63 years old and married with six children.

Dolores works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for nine years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Dolores aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 49 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Luzviminda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es:
Silvino es muy trabajador se dedica a la agricultura y principalmente del cultivo de la caña de azúcar, su nivel académico es muy bajo ya que en ese tiempo la escuela le quedaba  muy lejos y sus padres no disponían de dinero para gastos educativos y además que esa no era una prioridad.

 Él está casado su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, de sus  hijos ya solo uno vive con ellos;  porque los otros ya formaron hogar. Silvino,  toda sus vida se ha dedica do a la agricultura como también a la cañicultura eso se lo enseño su podrá  ya que en la zona es una actividad rentable todos los días sale a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas hasta el atardecer. 

El crédito lo necesita para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como abono, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas, para la siembra de maíz y mantenimiento del cañal los cuales vera el beneficio, ya que siempre tendrán producción muy buena que le permita crecimiento económico y poder darle un mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 

Sus sueños son el seguir trabajando para mejorar su vivienda y que por tradición sus hijos también se involucren en la producción de caña de azúcar y que vuelva un patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
Silvino is a very hard worker. He works in agriculture, mostly cultivating sugar cane. His level of education is very low since, at that time, the school was located very far away, his parents did not have the money for education expenses, and it was not a priority.

He is married and his wife takes care of the household duties. Out of all of his children, only one of them currently lives with them since the others now have their own households. For his whole life, Silvino has worked in agriculture and grown sugar cane. His father taught him this business since it is a very profitable business in the are. He leaves very early in the morning to work and works until it gets dark.

He needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies like manure, seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides for his corn crops and to maintain his sugar cane crops. This will be beneficial because he will be able to have a very good production that will allow him go grow economically and provide his family with a better quality of life.

His dreams are to continue working to improve his home and that his children will become involved in the tradition of sugar cane production and return to the family home.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides for his corn crops and to maintain his sugar cane crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure and some fertilizers for his corn, bean, and sorghum crops.

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en: A resident from Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Long is married and blessed with four schoolchildren. In struggling for a living, she grows rice on three hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has not been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before.  Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs. She strongly believes that she can earn more income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Channut

texts.en:
Aged 23 years, Channut is married and lives in the Koh Krolor district of Battambang province. She is a rice farmer who has been growing rice for several years.
  
This is the first loan for Channut with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en: Residing in Bovel district of Battambang province, Han is 49 years old and has one child. To strive for a living, she grows rice on two hectares of rice crop land and works for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Han, a second-time borrower, has teamed up in a group consisting of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and it has improved her life at a gradual pace. For this cycle, she is applying for 1,400,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 200,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, rice seed, and fertilizer for her crop. She highly hopes that she will get more income so as she can keep improving her living condition.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, rice seed, and fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Koh Krolor district, Ren is aged 65 years and married. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for 10 years. This business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Ren has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the loan. Now she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Residing in the Bovel district of Battambang province, Han is 49 years old and has one child. To strive for a living, she grows rice on two hectares of rice fields and works for others for a fee. She has been involved in her current business for 13 years. Han, a second-time borrower, has formed a group of two borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and it has improved her livelihood at a gradual pace. 

For this cycle, she is applying for 1,500,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, rice seed, and fertilizer for her crop. She highly hopes that she will get more income so she can keep improving her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees, rice seed, and fertilizer

loans.name: Carol Mae

texts.en: Carol Mae earns a living by selling goods in her retail store while her husband does farming. For five years, Carol Mae has earned well and sustained the business. It adds to her husband's income from working as a laborer. To add inventory capital, she has borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to have higher profits in order to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mbogo Group

texts.en:
Cleophas is a new member of the Mbogo Group. He has been managing a photography business for six years now, since 2008. He is a married man in his early forties, with two children in school. From the beginning of his business, he has offered his services by walking door to door. He runs his service from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. every working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

Cleophas now wants to rent a place where people can find him specifically to get a service. He think that by having a physical address, it will be easier to mobilize more customers and to create other opportunities, like selling photo frames and camera accessories and taking videos for different functions, because customers will know where to find him. 

This is Cleophas' first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, as Kiva's partner, which he will use to rent a room for his photography service. He dreams of managing a company and employing youth who are jobless. He will share this loan with his loan group, Mbogo, which has three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to rent a room for his photography service.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. Analiza successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. NWTF is re-listing Analiza's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ma. Salve

texts.en: Ma. Salve is 38 years old and married with four children, all of whom are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Ma. Salve has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell. In the future, Ma. Salve would like to save enough money so she can continue to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 43 years old and single with nine children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Brenda's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to help her rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Brenda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Marieta requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marieta has been in this business for 27 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 56 years old and married with eight children.

Merlina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock items like soft drinks, beer, snack foods, toothpaste and shampoo to sell.

Merlina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from fishing.

Merlina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks items like soft drinks, beer, snack foods, toothpaste and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha is 32 years old and lives with her family in a rural village located in the Koh Krolor district of Battambang province. She is married and has one child. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 10 years. The current business earns her about 29,000 KHR per day.
 
Pha has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. She is now requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price and improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a supply of household staples and shelving in order to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food for her small herd of cattle in summer; concentrate, vitamins, and de-worming medication.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, comenta que con el crédito anterior tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir materiales necesarios para mejorar el negocio, la producción de miel ha sido satisfactoria, sus ventas e ingresos son más estables, su  familia vive en mejores circunstancias y le brindan su colaboración en el negocio.
Por los beneficios que obtiene al invertir créditos en el negocio se decidió por un nuevo crédito que utilizara para comprar azúcar, marcos, tapaderas, fondos, cajas y envases,  con lo que alimentara el apiario por un largo tiempo y tendrá a todo listo para envasar la miel que luego venderá.
texts.en:
José says that with his previous loan he had the opportunity to procure necessary materials to improve his honey production business. It has been satisfactory, his sales and earnings are more stable and his family have better living conditions and they offer their help with the business.

He decided to request a new loan because of the profits he received from using the previous loan to invest in his business. He will use this loan to purchase sugar, frames, lids, bottoms, boxes and containers, to feed the apiary for a long time and have everything ready to pack honey then sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, frames, lids, bottoms, boxes and containers.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 40 years old and has three children, one of whom is in school. She is single.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. Rosalina is taking out a housing loan for 8,000 PHP to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Rosalina has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. With your help, Rosalina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Oun, age 40, is a villager from Bovel district of Battambang province. She is married and blessed with five children. For her family, rice cropping and soybean planting are the main sources of income. This is Oun's second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her first loan completely, and it improved her living condition progressively. Now, she has teamed up with a group to get a new loan. The total amount of her entire group loan is 3,800,000 KHR. 1,200,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy good seed. She hopes that she can gradually triple her income.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and to buy good seed

loans.name: Hoey

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Koh Krolor district, Hoey is a 36-year-old mother of one child. To support her child, Hoey has been farming rice for 10 years. Together, they can earn about 45,000 KHR per day.

Hoey is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is seeking a loan. She wants to use her loan to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice and sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Ngoeurm's Group

texts.en:
Ngoeurm is 40 years old and a mother of eight children. For her family, rice farming is the single source of her income and generates about 35,000 KHR per day for them. 

Now, Ngoeurm leads a new microloan group of two to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a good income, better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Kimoun's Group

texts.en:
Kimoun, 28, is a mother of two children who are under school age. She earns a living by rice cropping and soybean farming. This is her main source of income. She can supplement her income via her paid-work job. She has been involved in her current business for eight years, earning almost 39,000 KHR per day. 

Including this loan, she and her joint borrower are fourth-cycle borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Kimoun has repaid her past loan completely, and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle progressively. For this cycle, she is the leader of her group. She and her co-borrower are seeking 1,800,000 KHR each. Kimoun will spend her entire loan portion to pay for rice seed, fertilizer, plowing fees and labor costs. She strongly believes that she can gain a triple yield so she can earn greater income.

loans.use: To pay for rice seed, fertilizer, plowing fees and labor costs

loans.name: Sovy

texts.en:
Aged 60 years, Sovy lives in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Kos Krolo district, Cambodia. She is a married mother of three children. For the last twenty years, Sovy has been farming rice to make a living. Together, the family can earn about KHR 30,000 per day from their current business. 

This is the first loan for Sovy with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers. She will also spend a portion of it on plowing the field. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is 43 years old and married with seven children.

Regie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Regie has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling scrap materials.

Regie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 29 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Vilma has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family's home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Vilma is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ana Josabet

texts.es:
Ana, ha tenido muy buenos resultados con las inversiones que ha realizado en su negocio, la situación económica que hoy en día posee es más estable a cancelado su deuda y ofrece a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de dos novillas de repasto, fortalecerá el negocio y a futuro aumentara la producción de lácteos que utilizara para mejorar la alimentación de su familia y comercializarlos.
texts.en: Ana has had good results from the investments she has made in her business. Her economic situation is more stable now, she has paid off her debts and can provide her family with a better live style. At this time she is requesting a new loan to invest in buying two calves strengthening her business and in the future increasing her production of milk which she will use to feed her family and to sell.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: En un barrio popular del sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla, habita Ana, mujer casada y madre de 4 hijos en edades adultas. Allí en su propia casa tiene una miscelánea donde vende útiles escolares variedades, ropa, artículos de tocados, además de ofrecer servicios de internet fotocopiajes y hasta venta de helados. Su negocio inició desde le año 2011, cuando su esposo se persuadió de que habían quedado solos después de ver crecer a sus hijos, En acuerdo con Ana iniciaron vendiendo refrescos como gaseosas, jugos, agua y poco a poco integraron otros servicios, comprando computadores para que la población accediera al servicio de internet, compraron también vitrinas y las provisionaron de artículos de papelería, por eso  gradualmente su negocio ha crecido con la ayuda de su esposo. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y compra de contado en librerías y papelerías de gran tamaño y a revistas. En la actualidad su meta es ampliar su negocio aumentando el volumen de mercancía para ofrecer y seguir ayudando a sus nietos para que aprovechen oportunidades. Su mayor desafío es lograr una clientela cumplida en sus pagos. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará camisas bermudas, suéteres para damas y una nueva vitrina, con esto planea aumentar sus utilidades y aumentar su bienestar.
texts.en:
Ana lives in a low income neighborhood in the south of the city of Barranquilla. She is married and the mother of 4 adult children. In her house she has a small variety store where she sells school supplies, clothing, accessories for hair besides selling internet and photocopying services and even ice-cream.

She started her business in 2011 when her husband persuaded her that they were alone after having seen their children grow up. According to Ana, she started to sell drinks like pop, juices and water and little by little added the other services, buying computers so that the public could access the internet. She also bought display cases and filled them with stationary supplies. Gradually her store grew with the help of her husband. She makes her sales in cash and credit every day from 7 in the morning until 9 at night. She buys her supplies at large bookstores, stationary stores and magazines in cash.

Today her goal is to expand her business increasing the volume of merchandise she offers and continue to support her grandchildren who that they have opportunities. Her main challenge is to have her clients make their payments. She is requesting a loan from Kiva, her first loan through la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy shirts, shorts, and sweaters for women and a new display case. She plans to increase her profits and her well-being with these.

loans.use: to buy shirts, Bermuda shorts and sweaters for women and a new display case.

loans.name: Efrain Galileo

texts.es:
Efraín, es electricista y repara artículos eléctricos trabaja de manera independiente desde hace 10 años, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos los cuales están estudiando, su compañera de vida trabaja en un laboratorio clínico.
El capital lo invertirá en la compra de cables, fusibles, desatornilladores, cajas, entre otros repuestos que necesita para finalizar trabajos pendientes, espera recuperar lo invertido con buenas ganancias y resarcir la deuda.
Su sueño es modernizar sus herramientas, construir su casa propia y cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en: Efraín is an electrician and repairs electronic items. He has been working independently for 10 years. He lives with this life partner and two children, both of which are studying. His life partner works at a clinical laboratory. He will invest the capital in the purchase of cables, fuses, screwdrivers, and boxes among other spare parts which he needs to finish pending jobs. He hopes to recover his investment with good profit and repay the debt. His dream is to  modernize his tools, build his own home and cover his family's necessities.

loans.use: Purchase cables, fuses, screwdrivers, boxes and other spare parts

loans.name: Adalis Elizabeth

texts.es:
Adalis Elizabeth es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Adalis Elizabeth, tengo 27 años de edad y vivo con mis padres y dos hermanas menores que yo en el barrio las flores de san pedro de Macorís. 
Estudio medicina porque desde que tuve uso de razón siempre me ha gustado esa carrera para ayudar a las demás personas en cuanto se me sea posible. 
Mi madre trabaja en un colegio Evangélico de conserje y mi padre en un centro comercial de conserje también. Le doy siempre las gracias a Dios porque a pesar de ese humilde trabajo que ellos tienen  cuento con su apoyo para culminar mi carrera que tuve que parar en el 6to cuatrimestre debido al alto costo de la Universidad. 
Mi misión es estudiar y dar lo mejor de mí con el apoyo de Dios, mis padres y la ayuda que me pueden ofrecer a través de este préstamo.
Mi visión es ser una gran profesional y ayudar a las personas necesitadas.
texts.en:
Adalis Elizabeth is a young medical student. She is applying for a loan to cover her educational expenses. This is her story: 
 
“My name is Adalis Elizabeth.  I am 27 years old and live with my parents and two sisters younger than I in the Las Flores neighborhood of San Pedro de Macorís.  I am studying medicine because, ever since I had the use of reason, I have always liked that career so that I can help other people to the extent it is possible for me to do so.

My mother works as a janitor at an Evangelical school and my father is also a janitor at a shopping center.  I always thank God because, despite the humble jobs they have, I can rely on their support in order to finish my degree, which I had to stop pursuing in the sixth semester due to the high cost of the University.

My mission is to study and give the best of myself, with the support of God, my parents and the help you can offer me through this loan.  My vision is to be a great professional and help people in need.”

loans.use: to cover higher education costs.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado abandono sus estudios ya que sus padres no podían darle los estudios como él quería, se dedicó a trabajar cuidando el ganado de un familiar y a la agricultura. Él  está casado desde hace 13 años pero antes de casarse vivió durante 20 años con su actual esposa con ella ha procreado 3 hijos de los cuales solo estudiaron hasta 9° grado todos, debido a que él ya no podía darles más estudio que ese ya que no contaba con los ingresos necesarios para hacerle frente a los gastos del hogar y estudio para ellos, todos trabajan la agricultura en familia para llevar el sustento a el hogar.
	
Él se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez, ya que sus padres le enseñaron este oficio, debido a que ellos a esto se dedicaban,  también se dedica al cuido de ganado ya que cuando era niño en la temporada que no podía cultivar la tierra con su padre él se dedicaba a cuidarle el ganado a un vecino de ahí aprendió mucho, él se dedicó a la agricultura ya que el vio que este rubro le daba los ingresos necesarios para darle el sustento a su familia, su trabajo le queda a 30 minutos a pie desde su casa que es el terreno donde el cultiva el maíz y frijol los cuales le sirven para que su familia tenga el alimento a tiempo todos los días.

Con el crédito el comprara el abono y los herbicidas para sus cultivos y pagara mano de obra de las personas que le ayudan a cultivar, para tener el grano a tiempo en su hogar, tendrá un margen de ganancia ya que comprando todo de una sola vez le saldrá más barato y el traslado a su vivienda será más barato debido a que tiene que cancelar un vehículo que se lo traslade desde la ciudad hasta su casa y comprándolo por partes le sale más caro, teniendo el producto en su casa él podrá cultivar y aplicar los fertilizantes a tiempo a su cultivo y así tener una buena producción de granos que le servirán a su familia en la temporada de verano para el consumo.

Él quiere para su futuro reconstruir su vivienda para darle a su familia una mejor condición de vida, desea que sus hijos puedan formar sus propias familias y que sean muy unidas así como lo es él con ellos, desea tener una producción de maíz y frijol muy buena y así darles a su familia los granos para su consumo, además él de su cosecha  desea vender una parte para ir realizando sus sueños poco a poco.
texts.en:
Victoriano, 51, studied up to the third grade, but abandoned his studies because his parents were not able to provide studies as he would have liked. He started working tending to a family member's cattle and farming. He has been married for 13 years, but, before marrying, lived for 20 years with his current wife. Together they gave birth to 3 children all of which studied only up to the 9th grade because he was not able to provide them more studies because he did not have the necessary income to cover the home's expenses as well as studies for them. They all work in farming as a family to sustain the home. 
	
He has been farming since his childhood, his parents taught him this job because they were also farmers. He also tends cattle because as a boy he would take care of a neighbor's cattle in the off-season, when he could not farm the land with his father, and learned a lot. He started farming seeing that this field of work provided the necessary income to sustain his family. His work is a 30 minute walk from his house and is a plot of land where he farms corn and beans which he uses to feed his family on time every day. 

With the loan he will purchase the fertilizer and herbicides for his crops and will pay for the labor of the people who help him farm. In this way he will have the grain on time at home, he will see a small margin of savings because buying everything all at once will make it cheaper and the transportation to his residence will be cheaper because he has to hire a vehicle to transport everything from the city to his home and paying for it separately is more expensive. With the product at home he will be able to farm and apply the fertilizers to his crops on time and be able to have a good production of grains which his family will use during the summer season for consumption.

In the future, he wants to reconstruct his residence to give his family better living conditions. He hopes his children are able to form their own families and they are close as he is with them. He also hopes to have a really successful production of corn and beans and in that way give his family the grains for consumption and also from his harvest sell a portion in order to start realizing his dreams little by little.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and herbicides for his crops and pay for the labor of people who help him farm.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is 50 years old.  He is a widower and has been blessed with one child. Jesus provides transportation services in his community, and he earns well from this. It is his main source of income. He has been running this business for more than three years. He also has a farm, and he now delegates his tenants to oversee the fields where he has his crops. When he finishes his work, he comes to help them on the farm.

Jesus is requesting this loan from GDMPC to buy new tires for the vehicle and to pay for maintenance costs. In the future, he wants to give his child a better future.

loans.use: to buy new tires for the vehicle and to pay for maintenance costs.

loans.name: Daysi Marilu

texts.es:
Daysi, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos en edades de 14, 10 y 6 años, la casa en la que habitan es propia, su negocio es la venta de verduras, cultiva maíz y pipián, ya tiene 15 años haciéndolo, todos los miembros de su familia le colaboran, su horario es de cuatro y media de la mañana a ocho de la noche, lo aprendió siendo una jovencita en su familia.
Utilizara el crédito para comprar insecticidas, abono, plaguicidas y semilla, preparara el terreno de la forma adecuada para que el cultivo de maíz y pipián tengan un buen desarrollo, espera que la cosecha sea abundante y abastecer a todos sus clientes.
Su visión es mantenerse trabajando para tener ingresos que le servirán para cancelar sus deudas y apoyar en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Daysi lives together with her husband and 3 children, aged 6, 10 and 14 in their own house. She sells vegetables and grows corn and squash. She has been doing this for 15 years and all the members of the family help her. She works from 4:30 in the morning until 8 at night. She learned her trade as a youngster in her family.

She will use the loan to buy insecticides, fertilizer, pesticides and seeds to prepare the land properly so that her seeding of corn and squash develop well. She is hoping for an abundant harvest to supply all her clients. Her idea is to continue to work in order to have the income which helps her to pay off her loans and supports the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rowena works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rowena is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Visitacion is 51 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Visitacion has a fishing business in the Philippines. Visitacion requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her fishing business.

Visitacion has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Visitacion would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her fishing business

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, sugar and salt for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, sugar and salt for her business.

loans.name: Santana Anidia

texts.es:
Santana tiene 51 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado tuvo que abandonar sus estudios debido a la falta de recursos económicos que tenían sus padres,  ya no pudo culminar o tener un estudio más avanzados, estuvo acompañada pero actualmente tiene más de 15 años de estar soltera, su esposo la abandono y la dejo cuidando a sus hijos hasta cierto tiempo ella tubo de su ayuda, sus hijos han estudio hasta bachillerato con el esfuerzo que ella ha podido darles este estudio, el mayor trabaja la agricultura y está acompañado pero vive con ella y la hija se dedica a la elaboración de artículos de artesanías.  
	
Santana se dedica a realizar los oficios del hogar, así como a la elaboración de hamacas y matates ella aprendió este oficio de sus padres quienes al no poderle dar el estudio que ella merecía se dedicaron a enseñarles un oficio con el cual ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos en los estudios y los gastos del hogar, ella también ha trabajado como doméstica en varios lugares este le ha dado la oportunidad de conocer muchas personas de quienes ella siempre tiene una mano amiga, en la agricultura es ayudada por su hijo y en la jarcia por la hija, el horario de trabajo es variado a diario.

Con el crédito ella comprara abono, herbicidas y cancelara la mano de obra con la cual ella cultivara 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y frijol, teniendo el dinero a  tiempo ella podrá comprar todo de una sola vez y a un precio más cómodo que si lo comprara en partes, al acercarse la temporada de siembra ella tendrá todos los insumos necesarios para sembrar a tiempo los granos básicos.

Ella desea que en un futuro poder hacer arreglos a su casa, ya que su familia está aumentando, también desea tener una buena cosecha y que los esfuerzos que está realizando ahorita sean bien recompensados con una buena producción con la cual ella tendrá lo suficiente para la temporada seca en la que no se puede cultivar.
texts.en:
Santana is 51, she studied up to 3rd grade but had to abandon her studies due to her parent's lack of economic resources and was unable to finish or obtain more advance studies. She was accompanied, but has been single for 15 years. Her husband abandoned her and left her to care for her children having his help only for a certain time. Her children have studied up to high school thanks to her efforts which have allowed her to give them this level of study. The oldest works in farming and is accompanied, but lives with her. The daughter works in the production of handicrafts. 
	
Santana takes care of the chores at home and works in the production of hammocks and canvas bags. She learned this trade from her parents who, seeing as they could not give her the studies she deserved, made sure to teach her a job with which she could provide for her children's studies and the home's expenses. She has also worked as a housekeeper in various places which has given her the opportunity to met many people who always lend her a helping hand. In farming she is helped by her son and in the weaving by her daughter. The daily work schedule varies. 

With the loan she will purchase fertilizer, herbicides and pay off the manpower she uses to farm 3,500 square meters of corn and beans. If she can have all the money on time she will be able to purchase everything at once and at a more affordable price than if she were to purchase separately. As the planting season nears she will have all the necessary supplies to plant the basic grains on time. 

She hopes to make some repairs to her home in the future as her family is growing. She also hopes to have a good harvest and that the effort she is putting in right now will be rewarded with a good output which will allow her to have enough for the dry season during which no farming can be done.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer, herbicides and pay off the manpower she uses to farm 3,500 square meters of corn and beans

loans.name: Hoey

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Koh Krolor district, Hoey is 53 years old and married with two children. For the last 12 years, he has been farming rice to make a living. 

Hoey has been with VisionFund for one cycle and now he is applying for a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Sopha is 29 years old and married. Her family lives in a rural area of the Koh Krorlor district of the Battambang province. To make a living, she has been farming rice for eight years. The current business earns her about 26,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sopha is new to VisionFund this cycle. She is applying for a loan of 800,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She will also spend a portion of the loan on gasoline for her water pump. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Francisco Miguel

texts.es:
Francisco es un cultivador de plátano residente en Valencia, Córdoba.
Todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para iniciar sus tediosas labores de campo y así contribuir con la economía familiar, su esposa le ayuda en ocasiones y juntos sacan adelante a su hija de 20 años.
El desea comprar una hectárea de tierra que le están vendiendo a precio muy económico y quiere aprovechar la oportunidad ya que así puede aumentar el patrimonio familiar y puede tener más espacio para sembrar más plátanos.
El sueña con tener una gran parcela en la que pueda tener diferentes tipos de cultivos y posteriormente venderlos en las veredas y municipios cercanos.
Su mayor desafío es el clima que en ocasiones provoca pérdidas de cultivos.
texts.en:
Francisco is a plantain grower who lives in Valencia, Córdoba. Every day he gets up early to start his tedious labor in the fields and contribute to the family economy. His wife helps him at times and together they support their 20 year old son.

Francisco wants to buy a hectare of land that is for sale at a very good price. He wants to take advantage of this opportunity to increase the family inheritance and have more room to grow plantains. His dream is to have a large parcel of land where he can have different types of crops to sell in the neighboring villages and municipalities. His major challenge is the climate which has caused crop losses in the past.

loans.use: to buy a hectare of land to grow plantains.

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s Koh Krolor district, Ren is 50 years old, married, and has four dependent children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 15 years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Ren has been with VisionFund for one cycle and fully repaid the loan. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell her crops for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is 42 years old and has four children, one of whom attends school. She is a resident of Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. She deals with her daily cost of living through rice and cassava farming, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. She earns additional income working for others for a fee.  

Mom is the leader of a group requesting a loan from VisionFund for 2,000,000 KHR, which is 1,000,000 KHR per group member. Mom will use her loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay the plowing fee for her cash crops. She believes that she can get a good yield so that she can improve her livelihood at a gradual pace.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Merlynda

texts.en: Merlynda is 59 years old and lives in 50th brgy. Ozamiz City. She is married with two adult–aged children. Merlynda buys and sells wood for building houses. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan to purchase stocks of wood to resell.  Merlynda has been a member of PMPC for four years, In the future Merlynda hopes to improve her living conditions and cover their cost of living.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of wood for her wood-selling business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 44 years old and lives in Tabid, Ozamiz City. She is married with three adult–aged children. Marilyn does buy & sell of Ready-To-Wear and dry goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to purchase stock for her buy & sell business like T-shirts, blouses and shorts .  Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her living conditions and continue managing to supply their needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her buy & sell business

loans.name: Nedilen

texts.en:
Nedilen has been selling seafood in their village to make a living. Her husband is a fisherman, while Nedilen sells fish to support her husband in earning money. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for buying seafood to sell. To improve her fishing business, she has taken a new loan to purchase new fishing nets.

Nedilen wants to generate more revenue this year in order to have additional working capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland has been providing transportation services to support the needs of his three children. For ten years, this is one way of providing for his family and he has been able to sustain it. His previous loan used for repair and maintenance was successfully repaid. To improve the services and make them safer, he took  a new loan to buy new tires. His plan in the future is to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married, with five children. She manages her own food production business while her husband works as a cook to earn a living. 

For three years, Gina has been selling sweetened and ready-to-cook cassava chips in their village. It helps a lot to support her husband’s income for the family. She also sells some of this in town and she earns a higher amount from it. She had sustained her business and was able to give allowances to her children going to school. 

Recently, Gina joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and borrowed a loan to buy more cassava, to prepare cassava chips. In the future, Gina wants to expand her business, to improve their income for the family’s better future.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, to prepare cassava chips.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 36 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marilou has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marilou has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to rebuild her family home. She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marilou is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to better secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine  works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is 34 years old and married with two children who are in school. Almira works very hard to provide for them.

Almira's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Almira has taken a PHP 6,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Almira is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. Eventually, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Fedilita

texts.en: Fedilita is 46 years old, married and the mother of seven children, four of whom attend school. She and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and home were both wiped out. Fedilita  is taking out a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy building materials and pay for labor to build a replacement house for her family. She has been a member of NWTF since 2011, and with your help can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Haiyan. In the future, she  would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over four years, Zawadi has operated a fruit and vegetable stall, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es: Wendy tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de de 4 años de edad quien es su principal fuente de motivación para seguir luchando por mejores condiciones de vida. Wendy se gana la vida mediante la prestación de servicios  domésticos desde hace cinco años y es así como junto a su compañero de vida quien trabaja como vendedor en una empresa cercana a su localidad mantienen la economía del hogar. Wendy solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea enladrillar el piso de su vivienda el cual actualmente es de cemento y  en tiempo de invierno se humedece dado que nace agua y desea solucionar este problema lo antes posible y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Wendy is 23 years old and lives in her own house along with her life partner and their 4-year-old daughter. Her daughter is her principal motivation to continue fighting for a better quality of life. Wendy makes a living as a domestic servant and has done so for the last 5 years. Her partner works as a salesman in a local business. Together they maintain their household finances. 

Wendy is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can lay brick for the floor of her home. Currently, it is made of cement, which collects a lot of water during the winter season. Wendy wishes to resolve this problem as soon as possible so that her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and sand in order to lay bricks for the floor of her home.

loans.name: Mindard

texts.en:
Mindard is a married male Ugandan who lives in Masindi. He has been selling produce such as posho, beans and groundnuts for four years. He hopes to educate his children through university, though his business is challenged by price fluctuations and seasonal changes.

Mindard is thankful to the lenders and is requesting a loan to buy beans, posho and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, posho and groundnuts.

loans.name: Florsitas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias exitosa, coordinado por la señora Flor, 60 años de edad y soltera, es propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio desde hace 15 años, tiene bajo su responsabilidad el cuidado de su papá, y solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de telas, broches, hilos, adornos, etc. Otro socio del grupo es el señor Ricardo de 34 años de edad  dedicado a la vender pescados en  el mercado de su municipalidad y la señora Petronila  de 53 años ofrece el servicio de alquiler de sillas a domicilio.
texts.en:
The solidarity group consists of three successful members, coordinated by Flor,  who is 60 years old and not married.  For fifteen years, Flor has been the owner of a home workshop for sewing.  She is responsible for caring for her father, and wants a loan to invest in purchase of fabric,pins, thread, decorations, etc.

Richard, 34 years old, is another member of the group and works selling fish in the city market.  Petronila, 53 years old, offers chair rental services.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as fabric, pins, thread, decorations, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay laborers to cultivate her coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Alicia Maria

texts.es:
La Joven Alicia Maria, es madre de una  hija de siete años de edad  y se dedica al comercio desde hace 15 años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de Cosadehorno en un mercado de la ciudad de León además tiene un mini pulpería en su casa, que se la atiende  su Mamá, ella realiza estas labores para  ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y así tener un mejor nivel junto a su pequeña hija.     

La Joven Alicia Maria   solicito  a Ceprodel un crédito el que utilizo  para  incrementar su inventario  con variedad de productos en la mini pulpería para lograr obtener mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Alicia Maria is mother to a seven year old daughter and has been working for the last 15 years. Her current business is selling Cosa de Horno (corn cake) in a market in the city of Leon. She also has a small grocery in her house which her mother looks after. Alicia Maria works these jobs to help her husband with the household costs and help increase the standard of living for her family.

Alicia Maria is requesting a loan from Ceprodel that she will use to increase her inventory with a variety of products for her mini grocery in order to obtain higher sales.

loans.use: to buy basics like rice, beans, sugar and also various products like soft drinks, oil, and other things

loans.name: Alejandro Ricardo

texts.es: Alejandro Ruiz es un pequeño agricultor que habita en la comarca Chalmeca Debajo de la RAAS, actualmeente cumple el sueño de trabajar la tierra de forma sostenible como lo hace su familia. Él tiene buenas expectativas con la producción y comercialización del cacao para este y los próximos años, ya que según la experiencia adquirida en este rubro es un cultivo de mucho valor económico. Alejandro trabaja a lado de su esposa que se dedica a las labores de la finca, cuido de sus dos hijos que estudian primaria y el manejo administrativo del personal, juntos esperan cumplir con los objetivos y metas planteadas y poder garantizar el patrimonio para sus hijos en un futuro. Él solicita el crédito con el cual dará mejores condiciones a su parcela de cacao, la cual necesita de inversión en fertilizantes orgánicos, manejo de plagas con trampas y limpieza manual de una parcela de cacao.
texts.en: Alejandro Ruiz is a small farmer who lives in the Chalmeca in the south Atlantic Autonomous Region. Right now, he is living his dream of working the land in a sustainable way like his family does. He has good expectations for the production and sale of the cacao for this year and the next few years. According to the experience he has acquired in this area, it is a very valuable crop. Alejandro works at his wife's side doing farm work and caring for his two children, who are in primary school, and managing the workers. together they hope to meet their goals and generate assets for their children in the future. he is asking for a loan to make improvements on his parcel of cacao. He needs to invest in organic fertilizer, pest management with tramps, and manual clearing of the land.

loans.use: to improve his parcel of cacao, which needs organic fertilizer. Also, to do pest management with traps as well as manual clearing.

loans.name: La Poma Group
