Su meta mas adelante, es tener su propio local y lograr educar a sus dos pequeños hijos, que se encuentran en las edades de 8 y 5 años, aunque siempre está atento a resolver su mayor desafío, que es la competencia, la que día a día afronta con sabiduría.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 37 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias. The city has maintained its colonial architecture and is known for its beautiful and strong walls that remind us of the many pirate attacks that have occurred during a great part of Colombia's history. 

Here Wilmer started his own entrepreneurial adventure in retail eight years ago. Before starting, he had already been familiar with this activity. His work involves selling all types of movies and music at a locale in his neighborhood. He makes his sales every day from eight in the morning to eight in the evening. His main customers are passerbys of the area. 

Wilmer needs to attract more customers with new investments and this is exactly what motivated him to request his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan he will buy movies and a television to project movies for his customers. His goal is to get ahead, own his own locale, and send his two young children to school, who are 5 and 8 years old. He is always attentive to resolving his greatest challenge, the competition, and does so each day with his own wisdom.

loans.use: to buy movies and a television.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, para esta nueva temporada de siembra requiere de un nuevo crédito con el que comprara insumos agrícolas, pago de mano de obra y concentrado para ganado, de esta manera podrá preparar el terreno para el cultivo de granos básicos.
El capital que se le otorgo anteriormente le dio resultados positivos, su ganado está en mejores condiciones no le afecto la época seca, su rentabilidad es mejor, su familia tiene nuevas oportunidades de un buen desarrollo y su buen record crediticio respalda el pago de la nueva deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
For this coming planting season, Martin needs a new loan. He will buy farming supplies and animal feed and pay for day labor so that he can prepare his land for the harvest of basic grains. 

The capital that was provided to him previously gave him positive results. His livestock are in better conditions, he was not affected by the dry season, and his profits are better. His family now has new opportunities to develop and his good credit history supports his ability to pay this newly acquired debt.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and animal feed, and to pay for the day labor.

loans.name: Salva Group

texts.es:
Elias Arturo: Es un hombre amable, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 32 años de edad, está casado, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 6 años cursa su primer grado de primaria y un pequeño de 3 años. Su esposa, trabaja de manera informal, vende frito. Desde hace 6 meses estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de enchiladas de manera ambulante. Aún recuerda que inicio vendiendo 40 enchiladas diariamente. Sus productos en un fogón en el patio de su casa de tambo de madera, actualmente elabora diariamente 120 enchiladas. Su jornada laboral inicia desde las 3:30am – 12:00pm. Este grupo solidario está conformado por 2 mujeres muy trabajadoras y un varón emprendedor que tienen deseos de superación. Este primer crédito lo está solicitando para comprar mercadería para su negocio: aceite, masa, arroz, condimentos, carne molida, leña, cebolla. Su sueño es tener un triciclo para incrementar su volumen y cobertura de ruta de venta de enchiladas.

Yaoska: Desde hace un año estableció su pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es diversificar sus productos, vender granos básicos, carne molida, pollo, mortadela, gaseosas y productos lácteos.

Emelisa: Desde hace 2 años estableció su pequeña pulpería. Solicita su primer crédito para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio. Su sueño es que su negocio prospere
texts.en:
Elias Arturo is a kind man and a native of Puerto Cabezas. He is 32 years old, married and has two children. The eldest is six years old and enrolled in the first grade and the youngest is three years old. His wife works informally selling fried foods. Six months ago, he established his small business selling enchiladas as a street vendor. He still remembers when he began by selling 40 enchiladas every day. He prepares his products using a wood stove on the patio of his home and currently makes 120 enchiladas daily. His work schedule runs from 3:30am - 12:00pm. 

This solidarity group is comprised of two hardworking women and one entrepreneurial man who have dreams of getting ahead. The first loan they are applying for is to buy merchandise for his business including oil, dough, rice, condiments, ground beef, firewood, and onions. His dream is to have a tricycle to increase his volume and range in the route where he sells enchiladas.  

Yaoska established a small grocery store in her house one year ago. She seeks her first loan to buy merchandise. Her dream is to diversify her products and buy basic grains, ground meat, chicken, mortadella, soft drinks, and dairy items.

Emelisa: Two years ago, she established a small grocery store. She seeks her first loan to increase the merchandise of her store. Her dream is that her business prospers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business including oil, dough, rice, condiments, ground beef, firewood, and onion.

loans.name: Ana Obdulia

texts.es:
Ana, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que tiene al invertir créditos en su negocio, pues entre los beneficios que ha tenido y continua disfrutando están ofrece a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y ha remodelado un poco su vivienda.
En esta oportunidad Ana manifiesta que el capital lo utilizara para comprar maíz, variedad de ropa, papas, carnes, pollo, condimentos, gas propano, leña, etc., servirán para elaborar la venta de tamales, tortillas, algunos antojitos y fortalecer con nuevas prendas la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Ana is thankful for the opportunity she has to  invest loans in her business and for the benefits she has had and continues enjoying. These provide her family with better nourishment, clothing and she has slightly remodeled her home.

Ana says that with this opportunity she will utilize the capital to buy corn, a variety of clothing, potatoes, meats, chicken, seasoning, propane gas, firewood, etc. These will serve in developing the sale of tamales, tortillas, some snack foods and to improve clothing sales with new garments.

loans.use: to buy corn, a variety of clothing, potatoes, meats, chicken, seasoning, propane gas, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en: Age 36 and a villager from Battambang province’s Bovel district, Lai is married and has six children. Four of her children are in school and two are under-age for schooling. To secure their daily basic needs, she grows rice and cassava on two hectares each. This is not the first loan for Lai with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She successfully repaid her past loan. Currently, her living conditions are getting better. Now, in a group of three, she is a leader. She and one of her joint borrowers are applying for 1,800,000 KHR each and the remaining borrower is seeking 800,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and to buy rice seed for her crop. She strongly hopes that she can improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace so that she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fees and rice seed

loans.name: Nheng

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Koh Krolor district of Battambang province, Nheng is 61 years old and married with one kid. To support her family, she has been farming rice for 10 years. From the current business, she can earn about 50,000 KHR per day. 

Nheng is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her paddy rice.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en: It was 32 years ago that Mahfuza began her business. She lives in an agricultural region so she has been running an agriculture business for 32 years. She grows potatoes in 0.10 hectare, crops in 1 hectare and animal feed in 1 hectare of land. She also feeds cattle. She feeds mainly cows. Mahfuza is widowed and has a son. Her son is an adult and married. Mahfuza’s son and daughter-in-law help her to manage the business. Mahfuza’s business is the family's main income. This income is not enough to improve their living conditions. Mahfuza is going to repair her house because her house is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paints for repairing her house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cement, wood, and paints to repair her house

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en: Vanessa earns a living by selling perfumes, lotion and other cosmetics while her husband works as a private employee. For three years, Vanessa has been earning well and sustaining her business. She has many customers in her village and she collects their payments personally on a weekly and monthly basis. To cater to her customers, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more cosmetic products to resell. She hopes to have more income for the purpose of improving the general living situation of her entire family.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en: Teresiah is a married woman. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk for selling. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to own a big business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will live a good life. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of fabric and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en: Harrison is a 29-year-old married man and has one child. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells livestock medicine. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. Harrison will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more animal medicine. His business goal is to open other branches in other areas within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have an improved life. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy more animal medicine

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 67 years old and widowed with five children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Cresencia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cresencia has been in pig fattening for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Di-An

texts.en:
Di-An is 35 years old and married with three children, are in school.

Di-An works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like snack foods, rice, and canned goods.

Di-An has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fishing.

Di-An aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like snack foods, rice, and canned goods.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
On November 8, 2013, Marilyn’s business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 7,550 PHP housing loan through NWTF to buy construction supplies and pay for labor to help rebuild her family’s house. She is working on building up her savings to benefit her business.

With your help Marilyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and pay for labor

loans.name: Jetrude

texts.en: Jetrude is a 38-year-old married female with six schoolgoing children. She has been selling fresh food for three years in the market. Jetrude hopes to increase her profits, however, lack of enough capital and seasonal changes affect her business. Jetrude needs a loan to buy more tomatoes and beans for selling.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and beans for selling.

loans.name: Nyamweya

texts.en:
Meet Nyamweya, a mother of four children who lives in the Nyamira area of Kisii in South Nyanza, Kenya, a popular banana-growing area. She is a very well established farmer, in business for the past 34 years. His primary sources of income are milk, eggs, tea, bananas, and a retail business. In farming, her biggest challenge is lack of enough capital for doing her farm projects.
Nyamweya chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because it offers financial support to small-holder farmers. She will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow which will help her generate income with a larger supply of milk for selling and also for family consumption. The increase of income will help improve her family’s livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Karege

texts.en: Karege sells clothes; she also has a stall from which she sells food. She greatly appreciates Kiva lenders’ financial support she received through her previous loan facilitated through Yehu. She is now applying for a 40,000 KES loan to buy more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 29-year-old single man from Deir Elbalah city. He lives with his family in an old house in the city. Hasan started his own business one year ago transferring goods to the local traders using his rickshaw. He buys goods from the wholesalers at lower prices and resells them. It is a good business and earns a good income 
Hasan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products to resell in the local market. By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to improve his business and increase sales. 
Hasan appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products to resell in the local market

loans.name: Apocalipsis 4.35 Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por  tres socios exitosos y coordinado por el señor Diederich de 21 años, acompañado y padre de un hijo es propietario de un taller de zapatería en su domicilio, por medio de los créditos otorgados en esta institución el socio logró poner en marcha su meta de tener un taller de zapatería, ya que antes el compraba zapatos elaborados y los vendía en el mercado de su municipalidad, en la actualidad el socio elabora los zapatos y los distribuye en los mercados de Masaya y Tipitapa, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de materiales de zapatería como es cuero sintético, pega amarilla, pega blanca, hilo, suelas y mantenimiento a la maquinaria con la que trabaja. Otro socio es la señora Hipólita de 58 años  comerciante de frutas en su comunidad y domicilio, y la señora Rosa de 21 años propietaria de un taller de zapatería.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is composed of three successful partners and is coordinated by señor. Diederich, 21, who is married and has a son. He owns a shoe repair shop run from his home. Through loans from this institution, he managed to get his shoe repair shop off the ground. Before this he would buy shoes and sell them in his municipality’s market, but now he makes the shoes and distributes them in the markets of Masaya and Tipitapa. 

He is requesting the current loan to purchase shoe materials such as synthetic leather, yellow glue, white glue, thread, soles and to invest in maintaining the machinery he works with. 

Other partners of the solidarity group are señora Hipólita who is 58 years old and sells fruit in her community and from her home, and señora Rosa who is 21 and also owns a shoe repair shop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as synthetic leather, yellow glue, white glue, thread, soles, etc.

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en: Richelle is 35 years old, single with one child and lives in Misamis Occidental. Being a single mom, she solely provides for the needs of her child. To cover the costs of motorcycle maintenance, she borrowed from GDMPC micro credit where she had joined recently. She hopes to gain more clients to send her child to school and be able to provide for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Marpe

texts.en: Marpe, a young, married entrepreneur, runs a motorcycle transportation services in his village to make a living. For more than ten years, he has earned well, with the help and support of his wife, to provide the family.  He needs to repair his motor cab in order to improve the services and maintain safety of the services. With the micro finance loan of GDMPC, his plan will be realized. In the future, he wants to acquire a new unit of motorcycle to be used for business expansion. He wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to repair his motor cab.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina, 31, is a married woman with two children in school. For the past three years she has worked hard at her frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Divina is applying for a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell. She is saving her money and working hard to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children, all but one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Shirley has a fishing business in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Shirley has been in this business for three years. In the future, Shirley would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is 59 years old and widowed with six children, one in school, Geronima works very hard to provide for them.

Geronima's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Geronima has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 8,795 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Geronima is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional videoke machine for her business.

Elvie has been in this business for 10 years. Elvie also earns income from baking.

Elvie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional videoke machine for her business

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 35 years old and has one child. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Elvie is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elvie has been in pig-fattening for four years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Elvie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Tita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Tita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Tita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

In her charcoal selling business, Riziki also sells vegetables. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more charcoal and vegetables for her business. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Dimas

texts.es:
Rosa es un hombre de 64 años de edad, estudio hasta 5º grado, está acompañado y su pareja tiene un pequeño negocio de tortillería, tiene 3 hijos y la última hija vive con ellos y estudia 2º año de bachillerato. Nadie más vive con ella. 

El cliente toda la vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura  y aprendió el oficio de su padre. Siembra en época de invierno 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y hortalizas. El terreno donde siembra está a unos 5 metros de  su vivienda y se va caminando. 

Tiene la necesidad del crédito para comprar exclusivamente insumos agrícolas, como fertilizantes y herbicidas para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. 

Él sueña con tener una pequeña granja de gallinas para tener a la venta, y esperar que le  vaya bien en el cultivo para obtener ganancias y poder seguir manteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 64 years old and studied up to fifth grade at school. He has a partner, who has a small business selling tortillas. The couple has three children; the youngest daughter is in second year of secondary school, and is the only person who lives with Rosa and his wife.

Rosa has spent all of his life working in farming, having learned the trade from his father. In winter he sows corn and vegetables on 7,000 square metres of land. The land is some five kilometres from Rosa's house; he arrives there on foot.

Rosa needs this loan to buy farming supplies - such as fertilisers and weed-killers - to sow corn on 7,000 square metres of land.

Rosa dreams of having a small farm raising hens to sell. He hopes that his crops turn out well so that he can earn a profit and support his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies - such as fertilisers and weed-killers - to sow corn on 7,000 square metres of land.

loans.name: Santiago De La Cruz

texts.es:
Santiago de 32 años de edad, solo ha estudiado 6º grado,  es una persona casado, tiene tres, también manifestó que les está ayudando a seguir con los estudios,  la esposa trabaja de secretaria municipal en la alcaldía.

Santiago es albañil trabaja en construcciones de casas y por lo tanto esa es la actividad que realiza, además de desempeñar la agricultura,  viaja en bus a donde se le toca ir a trabajar.

El crédito que está solicitando, es para comprar semilla de maíz, abonos, foliares, pesticidas, herbicidas, para invertirlo en la agricultura para tener cosecha y darles el pan de cada día a sus hijos y así vivir con una mejor calidad de vida para mi familia.


Su sueño para un futuro es que su familia tenga condiciones de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santiago is 32 years old and has only studied up to the 6th grade. He is married with three children, and is helping them continue their studies. His wife works as a municipal secretary in the town hall.

Santiago is a construction worker who works building houses, which he does as well as farming. He travels to his work sites by bus. 

The loan he is requesting is to buy maize seed, fertilizer, foliar sray, pesticides, and herbicides to invest in his farm to have a harvest and be able to feed his children and give his family a better life. 

His dream for the future is for his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy maize seed, fertilizer, foliar sray, pesticides, and herbicides to invest in his farm to have a harvest.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina has three children. She is an ambitious woman who has grown tomatoes, carrots and other vegetables for the past five years. She sells her produce in an advantageous spot, catering to individual customers. A lack of capital hinders her from getting ahead.

This will be Regina’s second loan with SMEP; her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs to help her cultivate more land. She would like to be a large-scale farmer within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to help her cultivate more land.

loans.name: Ronelita

texts.en:
Ronelita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell through her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Ronelita has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell crabs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Ronelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en: Julian is a twenty-five-year-old married female with three children, of which two go to school. She sells fresh foods in the market, as it is her main source of income. Julian hopes to expand her business, in spite of lack of enough capital and poor storage facilities. Julian is asking for a loan to buy tomatoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy  tomatoes for selling.

loans.name: Masingu

texts.en:
Masingu is a married woman who has been blessed with four children, two of whom are in school and two adults. She lives at a rental house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

Masingu has operated a charcoal and paraffin selling business for the last four years, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal and gallons of paraffin for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and gallons of paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Roun's Group

texts.en: Roun is 24 years old and a resident of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She has one kid who is under-aged for schooling. To sustain her family, she grows rice and cassava as the main source of income. She has been involved in her current business for seven years. With this new loan, she is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and she is able to upgrade her lifestyle at a good pace. For this cycle, she is applying for 1,200,000 KHR while her joint borrower is taking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She highly hopes that she can gain a good yield from her cash-crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop

loans.name: Amelia Damarys

texts.es: Amelia tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 3 meses de edad. Amelia es muy conocida en su comunidad como una mujer emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y antojitos típicos desde hace tres años lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y junto a su esposo quien presta servicios de transporte mantienen la economía del hogar. Amelia desea reparar el techo de su vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado y es por esta razón que se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar este crédito que le permita comprar los materiales como: lamina galvanizada, madera y clavos para dar inicio a la mejora del techo antes que el invierno comience.
texts.en:
Amelia is 22 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and 3-month-old baby. Amelia is well known in her community as an entrepreneurial woman who sells clothes and typical snacks. She has done this for three years which has enabled her, along with her husband who works in transportation, to provide for the family.

Amelia wants to repair the roof of her home, as it is deteriorated. This is why she came to FUSAI to request a loan to buy materials such as: galvanized steel, wood, and nails to begin repairing her roof before the winter begins.

loans.use: to buy galvanized steel, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: Marhabo is careful mother of four children. She is the only feeder and keeper of her children because she is divorced and her former husband doesn’t help her with providing for the children. She began her new business with selling women's clothes and shoes five months ago. Marhabo has a selling place in a local market. Now, she wants to develop a new business and maximize profit. With this aim, she took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ for women's organizations and got a certificate. Marhabo is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy women clothes for increasing working capital of new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women clothes for increasing working capital of new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a TV set for her household.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is 49 years old and widowed. She lives in a rural community with her two children. Despite the hardship of living, she aspires to become successful in the future. She runs a small retail store to have an additional source of income. She aims to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers demand, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is requesting for a loan of PHP 35,000.00 to purchase additional stock of grocery items, soft drinks and frozen foods to sell. Being a hard working mother, she believes that she will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of grocery items, soft drinks and frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. 

Evelyn is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc., for her general store business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, such as soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Angeles works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from boarding house rental.  Angeles is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy more ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc., for her restaurant business.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 39 years old and her three children are in school.

Gina has a peanut butter vending business in the Philippines. Gina requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more ingredients like peanuts, sugar, butter, etc., for her business.

Gina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like peanuts, sugar, butter, etc., for her business

loans.name: Pouk's Group

texts.en:
For the past eleven years Pouk, 43, has supported her family by farming rice on two hectares of land and raising chickens. She is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and a mother of five children. Two of the children are in school while one is still too young to attend. The other two are working at home as well as doing household chores.

Pouk is a four-time borrower with VisionFund, one of Kiva’s partners. She repaid her past loans successfully. These loans have enabled her to lift her lifestyle at a gradual pace.

Now Pouk is applying for a 3,400,000 KHR loan as the leader of her group’s three members. Her two co-borrowers will each receive 1,000,000 KHR of the loan. She will spend her loan disbursement on fertilizer, rice seed and insecticides for her farmland as well as more chickens. She hopes to see her lifestyle continue to improve.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and insecticides for her farmland as well as more chickens.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong, 31, is a resident of Kampong Cham province where his rice crop is grown. Besides his agribusiness, he is also a cow trader.

Both these businesses earn him about 40,000 KHR per day after his 13 years of involvement in his current businesses. His income is used to cover the necessary expenses in his household and to support his two children who are in school.

Kong is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy seed and to pay for a plowing fee. He hopes that he can double his yield with a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy seed and pay for plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Los Sequeira Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por cinco socios exitosos en su vida laboral, coordinado por la señora María de 46 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres  hijos, es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, pan, chiverías, jabón Palmolive, jabón xtra, jabón para lavar trastos, desinfectantes y más. Otra de las socias es la señora María de 42 años dedicada a la compra-venta de cosechas, la señora Lisbeth de 29 años comerciante de tamales en el mercado más populoso de la capital, el señor José de 53 años propietario de una pulpería en su domicilio y el señor José Luis de 34años comerciante dedicado a la compra-venta de cosechas.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is composed of five successful professional members, coordinated by María who is 46 years old, and married with three children. She owns a small convenience store in her home and is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, bread, snacks, Palmolive brand soap, Xtra brand soap, dish soap, disinfectants and more. 

The other members are: María, who is 42, and buys and sells harvests, Lisbeth, who is 29 and sells tamales in the busiest market in the capital, José, who is 52 and owns a convenience store in his home, and José Luis, who is 34 and buys and sells harvests.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, bread, snacks, Palmolive brand soap, Xtra brand soap, dish soap, disinfectants and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase palm nuts and corn

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 51-year-old mother from Kakamega region which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is a widow and supports eight people in her family.

She has a retail shop where she sells general goods. She has been doing this business for the last eight years and makes a monthly income of 5,000 KES. She is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase stock of sugar, bar soap and cooking oil for sale.

Her dream is to own a big shop and continue to support her family.

loans.use: to puchase sugar, cooking oil and tea leaves for sale

loans.name: Aljack

texts.en:
Aljack has been earning from her transport service business for more than four years. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying tires and accessories. She wants to maintain safety and enable better services to be served.

She took a new loan from GDMPC to repair her existing vehicle. She wants to improve the service based business as well as the general living of the family.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nieves is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a direct-selling Avon products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers through her direct-selling Avon products business.

Gloria has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell ready-to-wear.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 61 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Francisca has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, diapers, sanitary pads, juice, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business direct selling personal products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell to her customers for her business direct selling personal products.

Janeth has been in this business for three years. Janeth earns more income from buying and selling ready to wear.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.  Melanie has been in this business for 14 years. Melanie earns more income from fishing.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a twenty-seven-year-old married female with four children who has been selling fresh foods since 2013 in the market. Janet has a vision of expanding her business, however competition and lack of enough capital are challenges being faced. Janet is asking for a loan to buy tomatoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes for selling.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a twenty-seven-year old single female. She deals in a clothing business located in the market for two years so far.

Miriam hopes to have a boutique despite the fact she has less money to invest. Miriam is a hardworking woman and appreciates services being offered. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two school-going children. She owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past three years she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan she wants to purchase maize flour, bread, sweets and groundnuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, bread, sweets and groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with three children, two of whom attend school and one is an adult. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a shop kiosk business selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar for her business

loans.name: Hem's Group

texts.en: Hem is 27 years old and a rural villager from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is married and blessed with two children. She earns her living via rice cropping. To supplement her income, she works for others for a fee. She has been involved in current business for ten years and it earns her about 31,000 KHR per day. She is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid back her past loan with success and it has helped her to provide decent food for her kids. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for a plowing fee and to buy rice seed and fertilizer. She highly believes that she can gain a good yield with a good income in return.

loans.use: to pay for a plowing fee and to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en:
Somaly, 43, is a resident of Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has three kids who remain in school. She tackles her living through her rice farming and coconut selling business. She has been engaged in her current business for ages. 

With this new loan, she and her joint borrower are in the fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely, and it has uplifted her living condition progressively. She and her co-borrower are seeking 4,000,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, Somaly will spend her loan portion to pay for the plowing fee, and to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. Moreover, she will buy coconuts for resale. 

She highly believes that she can gain more income so she can renovate her house in a timely manner.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee, and to buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Ayitcheme 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AYITCHEME 5 est composé de dix neuf personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin.  C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Eugenie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Eugenie est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Martin. Eugenie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Eugenie et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Depuis près de dix ans, Eugenie vend des sacs de maïs et divers autres produits par le système de distribution. Eugenie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Eugenie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement AYITCHEME 5, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group AYITCHEME 5 is composed of nineteen persons who reside in the same district in Benin. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from Alidé to boost their businesses. The group representative, Eugenie, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 46 years old and married to a man named Martin. She did not go to school. The couple have four children, all in school and in their care. Eugenie and her husband jointly ensure that the different family expenses are covered. The children live together with their parents. 

For nearly ten years, Eugenie has been selling sacks of corn and other products via the distribution system. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Eugenie is requesting along with the other members of the group AYITCHEME 5 a second loan from Alidé. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of corn and more

loans.name: Vivogbe De Godomey Group

texts.fr: Le groupement VIVOGBE DE GODOMEY est composé de neuf personnes qui appartiennent à la même collectivité. La représentante  du groupement, du nom de Honorine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Honorine est âgée de 58 ans et vit au Bénin. Honorine est une veuve et mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et aucun à sa charge. Honorine vit seule et assure ses différents besoins grâce au revenu de son activité. Depuis une quinzaine d’année, Honorine vend des sacs de charbon de bois à son domicile. Honorine s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Honorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement VIVOGBE DE GODOMEY, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Vivogbe De Godomey Group is made up of nine women who belong to the same collective. The group representative, Honorine, has her hand raised in the photo. Honorine is 58 years old and she lives in Benin. Honorine is a widowed mother of four children, who are all receiving an education but who are not in her direct care. Honorine lives alone and maintains her household thanks to the revenue from her business. For the past 15 years, Honorine has sold sacks of wood coal out of her own home. Honorine gets her supplies throughout the region of Benin. In her quest to satisfy her customers and to increase her revenue, and thereby her profits, Honorine and the other members of the Vivogbe De Godomey Group have sought a fifth loan from Alidé. The previous loans have all been paid back in full.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of wood coal

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 45-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a person with integrity. 

She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a fertile land and her primary customers are large-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be climatic conditions. 

Esther will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her to increase production. Her business goal is to have a large-scale farm within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microffinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: St. Antoine De Padou 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement ST ANTOINE DE PADOU 2 est composé de sept personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Rose Pascaline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rose Pascaline est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Léopold. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur  charge. Rose Pascaline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Rose Pascaline vend des tissus et des assiettes en séries de façon secondaire par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Rose Pascaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Rose Pascaline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement ST ANTOINE DE PADOU 2, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group ST ANTOINE DE PADOU 2 is composed of seven persons who reside in the same district. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from Alidé. The group representative, Rose Pascaline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 46 years old and married to a man named Léopold. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. In addition to their children, the couple have another child to support. Rose Pascaline lives together with her husband and children. The couple share the different household expenses. 

To help meet the different needs of the family, Rose Pascaline sells fabrics and sets of dishes on the side via the distribution system. This business enables her to meet her needs without much difficulty. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Rose Pascaline is requesting along with the other members of the group ST ANTOINE DE PADOU 2 a second loan from Alidé. This loan will allow them to boost their businesses and grow their customer base and revenues. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and sets of dishes

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is 46 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are in school.

Zita and her family survived the super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Unfortunately, her business and family home were wiped out. 

Zita is taking out a housing loan of PHP 9,250 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2001. She plans to recover through her bicycle transport business.

With your help, Zita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to build another house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Lizeth Lorena

texts.es: Lizbeth habita en el municipio de Soledad y es la propietaria de una droguería desde el año 2013; este negocio lo emprendió aprovechando la experiencia de su esposo, quien trabajó en una farmacia. Decididos a provechar su conocimiento, emprendieron su aventura de negocios abriendo un punto comercial, que respondiera a las necesidades de su clientela. Sus ventas las realiza de contado comprando las medicinas a los mayoristas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento  que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará medicamentos y artículos variados de droguería, paños húmedos, cremas etc. Con esta inversión su negocio mejora porque hay un mejor surtido y con ello su servicio mejorará notablemente.
texts.en:
Lizbeth lives in the Soledad municipality and is the owner of a pharmacy since 2013; she started this business taking advantage of her husband's experience who worked at a pharmacy. Out to take advantage of his knowledge, they embarked on their business adventure opening a commercial post that responded to the necessities of their client base. She makes her sales in cash and purchases the medicines from wholesalers. 
She is currently applying for a credikiva, the first financing she receives from the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, with which she will purchase medicines and miscellaneous pharmacy items, wet wipes, creams etc. With this investment her business will improve because it will be better stocked and this will make service improve notably.

loans.use: purchase medications and miscellaneous pharmacy items, wet wipes, creams etc.

loans.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en:
Sokhoeurn is 36 years old and has three children, two under-age for schooling and one child in school.

Her main sources of income are from rice farming, cassava farming, and a fish selling business. She has been involved in her current business for 16 years. With this new loan, she is in her fourth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past three loans with success and it has enabled her to support her business timely.

Now she is seeking 4,000,000 KHR in order to renovate her house. She hopes that she can fix her house timely so that she does not need to worry about the upcoming rainy season.

loans.use: to renovate her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Ilxas

texts.en:
Ilxas is 32-year-old refugee. He is married and has two daughters. His wife is a housekeeper and the family lives in an IDP settlement. Ilxas has been working as a farmer for 11 years. He raises seasonal fruits (peaches, pears, plums, and cherry-plums) and vegetables (onions, potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumber). His monthly income is 180 AZN but he gets additional earnings working as a laborer or driver in his free time.
 
Fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand in Azerbaijan. They use fruits for tasty sweets, fruit salads, and juice and use vegetables for national dishes. Ilxas raises the fruit and sells it at the local bazaar or supplies different local cafes and restaurants.

The income from farming doesn’t cover his family’s needs. He wants to increase his income. He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy additional land and increase the harvest.

loans.use: to buy additional land and increase the harvest

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and dry goods

loans.name: Vivogbe De Godomey 2 Group

texts.fr: VIVOGBE DE GODOMEY 2 est un groupement de huit personnes, dont les membres vivent dans la même collectivité. La représentante du groupement, Rachelle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est une célibataire. Rachelle n’a pas d’enfant et vit seule. Rachelle a arrêté lécole au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Rachelle mène comme activité depuis cinq ans, la vente de produits de toilette de façon ambulante. Rachelle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Rachelle et les autres membres du groupe VIVOGBE DE GODOMEY 2 sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont  été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
VIVOGBE DE GODOMEY 2 is a group of eight persons. The group members live in the same collective. The group representative, Rachelle (with her hand raised in the photo), is 38 years old and unmarried. She has no children and lives by herself. Rachelle stopped going to school at the elementary level. To support herself, she has been running a business selling personal grooming products for five years by going door to door. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

This is the third time that Rachelle and the other members of the group VIVOGBE DE GODOMEY 2 have requested financial support from Alidé with the aim of bolstering their working capital and responding better to the requirements of their customers. The loans previously received were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase personal grooming products

loans.name: Abiut

texts.en: Abiut is a 24 year old single man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, soap, rice and other items. His primary customers are regular. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more sugar to sell. His business goal is to be the best within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will raise the living standards of his family. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.  He will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow for his family.

loans.use: buy more sugar to sell

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a 29 year old married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the poor road network. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to be the best within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will raise the living standards of his family. This is his third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.  He will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow for his family.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy and competitive place and her primary customers are walk-ins and permanent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as insecurity. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy fabric for dress making. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow her business and educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy fabric for dress making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Bevencia

texts.en:
Bevencia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal vending business.

Bevencia has been in this business for 5 years. Bevencia earns more income from weaving native products.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Bevencia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy high-quality seeds of potatoes, wheat and barley, and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Leab lives in the Lek Dek district of Kandal province. She is 54 years old, married and has 4 dependents in her family. She has supported her family by farming such as growing corn and rice for 13 years. She earns 25,000 KHR on average per day.
This is her first microloan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She expects that the income will help her expand her business for  fertilizer and seed purchasing and also improve her family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy, a 60-year-old resident from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, is a mother of nine. Her farming of rice and cassava is the main source of income to cover her family's needs. In this business for 14 years, she earns almost 40,000 KHR per day. 

Thy, a first-time borrower with Kiva partner VisionFund, is leading a group of  three in her loan request.  She and her fellow group members are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Thy will use her entire portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava. She strongly believes that she can earn a good yield and triple her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Khen

texts.en:
Khen lives in the Tbeng Meanchey District of Presh Vihea Province. She is 55 years old, married and has three dependent children. She earns her living by farming paddy rice. She can earn around 16,600 KHR per day. 

Khen has already completed four micro loans with VisionFund, and she is now requesting her fifth loan. She will use her loan to purchase fertilizer and seed for her paddy farm. She expects that the income will help her to expand her business and improve her living conditions, especially more nutritious food and better health care.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre muy trabajador, con mucho esfuerzo desde hace 4 años trabaja como agricultor, cultivando uva, con lo cual puede tener ingresos par poder solventar os gastos de su hogar y poder sacar adelante a su familia.

Pablo esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado e podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, insumos para la preparación de postes de cemento para que la planta de uva pueda crecer y tener un sostenimiento, entre otros; de esta manera podrá tener una plantación de uvas en buen estado y poder tener una buena cosecha; de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Pablo is a very hardworking man.  For the past 4 years he has worked hard as a farmer, growing grapes to earn money to cover household expenses and help his family get ahead.

Pablo is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with their help he will be able to purchase, among other things, fertilizer and supplies to prepare the cement posts that will support the grapevines as they grow.  This will allow him to have a well maintained vineyard and a good crop.  He will be able to increase his income and continue working to achieve his greatest dream, which is to complete construction on his home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, and supplies to build posts, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of drinks and other items to sell

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a married man who has seven children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells soft drinks. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of soft drinks. His business goal is to own a wholesale store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a depot. This is his second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. A previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 23-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows cassava. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a local area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be well. This is her first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a bakery where she cooks cakes for sale. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy wheat flour and other ingredients for preparing cakes. 

Her business goal is to own a big bakery within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and other ingredients for preparing cakes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman. She has three children ranging in age from three to fifteen years. She describes herself to be determined. 

Mary operates a farm where she grows maize, and she has been involved in this business for ten years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. 

Mary will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Cherry Ann works hard to support her family. She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Cherry Ann is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her vulcanizing shop business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cherry Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her vulcanizing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eggs, broiler chickens, vaccines, and chicken feed.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is a 33-year-old married woman with four children who all go to school. She has been in the fresh food business, located in the market, for two years. Safina hopes to expand her business, however, inadequate capital and lack of a storage facility affect her business productivity. Safina intends to use the loan to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Begimai

texts.ru: Бегимай 24 года, замужем, есть 2 детей дошкольного возраста. У Бегимай неоконченное высшее образование, она трудолюбивая, целеустремленная и разносторонне развитая личность. В качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Бегимай занимается животноводством. Начав в 2008 году с покупки 1 теленка, сегодня в хозяйстве содержатся 2 дойные коровы, что ей прибыль около 18,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бегимай обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков на откорм. Доходы Бегимай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и постройку большого дома для семьи.
texts.en: Begimai is 24 years old, married and has 2 children of preschool age. Begimai has an incomplete university education. She is a hardworking, driven and well-rounded person. To provide an additional source of income for her family, Begimai is involved in animal husbandry. Having started in 2008 with a purchase of 1 calf, today she has 2 dairy cows in her business, and a profit of about 18,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products. In order to further develop her business, Begimai requested a loan in the amount of 75,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy bulls for fattening up. Begimai plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock headcount and building a large house for her family.

loans.use: To buy steers

loans.name: Patricia Esperanza

texts.es:
Patricia de 20 años de edad,  ha estudiado bachillerato, esta acompañada, su compañero de vida   se dedica a vender CDs de música y películas, viven en casa familiar.


 Ella se dedica al negocio de  elaboración y venta de tortillas, lo aprendió de su madre quien le ayuda, lo inicio debido a la situación económica y para que su hijo tenga cada día lo necesario,el negocio lo tienen en casa,su hermana también le ayuda a repartir las 
tortillas.

 
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar mas maíz y  leña por carretadas, debido al inicio  del invierno es necesario tener todo lo que necesita para su negocio ayudarle un poco a su esposo para comprar CDs que tenga variedad y mejore sus ventas y que hayan mejores ingresos, de esa manera su vida mejorara.

El objetivo de la cliente es  que mejore sus ventas y tener mas clientela y darle lo mejor a su hijo y las ganancias las utilizara para ir ahorrando y pagar la cuota del crédito.
texts.en:
Patricia is 20 years old.  She completed high school, and has a life partner who sells music CDs and movies.  They live in the family home.  

She has a business making and selling tortillas.  She learned this from her mother, who helps her.  She started the business due to her financial situation and to help meet her son's daily needs.  The business is located in their house, and her sister helps her distribute the tortillas. 

This loan will be used to purchase more corn and carts of firewood. Since winter is coming she needs to have everything she needs for her business in order to help her husband out so he can purchase CDs and have a wider selection.  This will increase sales and earnings, and in this way improve their lives.

She wants to increase her sales and get more customers so that she can provide the best to her son.  She will use the income for savings and to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase more corn and carts of firewood.

loans.name: Duglas Javier

texts.es: Duglas tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 11 años de edad. Duglas se dedica a la prestación de servicios de transporte desde hace siete años y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Duglas desea terminar de construir dos paredes en su vivienda que por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar, además desea reparar el techo de la sala dado que se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, madera y lámina galvanizada.
texts.en: Duglas is 40 years old and lives in his own home along with his life partner and 11 year old daughter.  For the past 7 years, Douglas has had a transportation business which is how he supports his family.  Duglas wants to finish constructing two walls in his home that he has not been able to complete due to a lack of financial resources.  He also wants to repair the living room roof because it is in poor condition.  He will use the requested amount to purchase cement, sand, bricks, iron, wood, and galvanized metal sheets.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, wood, and galvanized metal sheets to build two walls and repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is a 32-year-old man from Sports Ground in Kisumu County which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Violet who is a business-lady, and he supports four people in the family; has two children who are ten and five years old respectively.

Gordon is an optician where he sells lenses and spectacle frames. He has been doing this for the last twelve years and makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. He has applied for his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more materials. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business.

Gordon's dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy stock of frames for lenses

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es: Maria Elizabeth junto a su esposo quien labora para una empresa de producción de capotes han establecido su propios negocio de Fotocopiadora  que esta a cargo de Maria Elizabeth siendo esta su principal fuente de Ingresos, ella tiene una niña en edad materna la que también cuida, si bien es cierto que cuenta con la ayuda del esposo pues sus gastos exceden y lo que realiza del negocio solo ajusta para cierta inversión del mismo, actualmente se le daño la Impresora por lo que necesita comprar otra para continuar con su negocio, para lo cual solicita este crédito.  su mayor objetivo es establecer Teypeo, Cyber entro otros servicios en su Fotocopiadora y así incrementar su Negocio y contar con mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria Elizabeth and her husband, who works at a cigar wrapper factory, have set up their own photocopying business.  Maria Elizabeth is in charge and this is her main source of income.  She has a young daughter who she also cares for.  Although her husband's income helps, their expenses exceed it, and what they make from their business only covers additional investments in the business itself.  Their business printer is broken so they need to purchase another one to continue and are therefore requesting a loan.  Her goal is to offer word processing and internet services at her photocopying business in order to grow the business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a printer for her business.

loans.name: Preseveranda

texts.en:
Preseveranda is an enterprising woman from Lopez Jaena. She is dedicated to her four children. She works daily in her field raising cattle to earn sustenance for her family, and to be able to guarantee a good future for her children. She works specifically in the labor of producing and raising mangos, work that she learned alongside her father.

She alternates this work with a sewing job that she has during the day to obtain more income. She wishes to expand her business. For this reason, she is applying for a loan to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides and increase her capital.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 23-year-old mother from Siaya region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports three people in her family.

She has a retail shop where she sells general goods. She has been doing this business for the last four years and makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase shop items, such as bar soap, milk, salt and sugar, in large quantity for sale.

Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of shop items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman who has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of fruit. She hopes that in the future, she will own a big hotel. This is her third loan with SMEP Micro finance bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business and her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruit.

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en:
Wilkister is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be courageous. 

She operates a farm where she grows maize. She has been involved in this business for fourteen years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. 

She hopes that in the future, she will open a grocery store. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lucila works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling bamboo split. Lucila is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 32 года, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. В 2000 году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Замира начала свой бизнес по разведению скота, стартовав с суммы 8,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря целеустремленности, настойчивости и трудолюбию, Замира сумела развить бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Замиры есть: 4 дойные коровы и 15 овец. В целях развития своего бизнеса Замира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы, часть средств будет потрачена на приобретение овец. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в расширение поголовья скота, а также накопить средства на приобретение легкового автомобиля.
texts.en: Zamira is 32 years old, married and raising 2 children.
