In search for an additional source of income for her family, Zamira started her own business of breeding livestock in 2000, having started with a sum of 8,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her drive, persistence and hard work, Zamira was able to grow her business to have a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). Today Zamira's business contains 4 dairy cows and 15 sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Zamira requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a cow and sheep. Zamira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock headcount and saving money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a cow and sheep

loans.name: Phoeurn's Group

texts.en: Pheourn, a father of five children, is a villager from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. The main sources of income for his family are from cassava farming and rubber planting, which has occupied him for a long time. Phoeun is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has fully repaid his first loan completely, a loan that enabled him to upgrade him lifestyle at a good pace. For this cycle, he leads a group of three to request a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for his crop. He hopes that he can improve his crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Reab

texts.en:
Reab is 35 and a widowed mother blessed with two children. She resides in thea rural village of Boribor district of Kompong Chhnang province. To deal with the daily cost of living she does rice cropping as a single source of income. It is this business that she has had for ages.

This is the fourth-cycled loan for Reab with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans completely and it has enabled her improve her lifestyle progressively. Now she is seeking a loan of 200,000 KHR.  She will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She strongly hopes that she can keep supporting her business seasonably so that she can earn more income to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase women's and men's undergarments, blouses, t-shirts, skirts, pants, etc. in order to offer varied merchandise

loans.name: José De La Cruz

texts.es:
José de 51 años de edad, no posee grado de estudio, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos actualmente estudio uno. El cliente se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura por muchos años, es un trabajo familiar. 

El crédito lo utilizara  para la compra de abono y fertilizantes. El cliente planea en un futuro poder enseñarle a trabajar  a sus hijos y que puedan seguir estudiando y dejarles un patrimonio.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old.  He did not attend school.  He has a life partner who is a homemaker.  They have two children, one of whom is in school.  Jose has worked in agriculture for many years.  It is a family business. 

He will use this loan to purchase fertilizers.  His plans for the future are to someday teach his children his work.  He wants them to continue their education, and to be able to leave them an inheritance.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 19-year-old single young lady from Deir Al-Balah city. She lives with her family in a small house. Her brother works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Alaa is a student at a local university where she studies Sociology. Alaa would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future so she can help her family.
 
Alaa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Alaa will be able to do her home works and write the reports.

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Asgar

texts.en:
Asgar, 35 years old, is married and has a daughter and a son. His wife is a housekeeper and they are refugees living in an IDP settlement. Asgar has been raising and selling vegetables for 13 years and has good skills in this area. His monthly income is 220 AZN.  Sometimes, in his free time, he earns additional money working as an artisan.

Raising vegetables is very common in Azerbaijan regions because vegetables are always in high demand. People buy vegetables in order to cook delicious national dishes.

Asgar is a very kind and responsible father. He wants to provide his children with a good education and bright future. To reach this aim, he has to increase his income and be able to pay for their education. He has applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN in order to buy good fertilizers and new garden tools.

loans.use: to buy good fertilizers and new garden tools

loans.name: Maria Ursula

texts.es: María tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus padres, tres hermanas, cuñada y sobrino. María es soltera y desde hace 20 años se dedica al cultivo y venta de verduras y hortalizas. María es una mujer muy comprometida quien siempre esta pendiente de las necesidades de su hogar. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un corredor en su vivienda dado que cuando llueve el agua se filtra dañando sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her parents, three sisters, her sister in law, and her nephew. Maria is single and she’s been growing and selling vegetables for the last 20 years. Maria is always committed to the needs of her household.

Maria is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a hallway in her house, because when it rains, water filters inside damaging her few belongings.

loans.use: to buy wood and galvanized sheets to build a hallway in the house.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: María tiene 28 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 8 años, 9 años y 3 años de edad en casa de su propiedad. María es pequeña comerciante de ropa nueva y además, presta servicios domésticos. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. María desea reparar el techo de su vivienda y hacer más grande el corredor de la vivienda ya que cuando llueve el agua se filtra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para para comprar el material necesario como: lámina galvanizada, madera y calvos.
texts.en: María is 28 yeas old and lives with her life companion and their three children ages 8, 9 and 3.  They own their home.  Maria is a small businesswoman.  She sells clothing and does domestic work.  This is how she earns a living and supports her household.  Maria wants to repair the roof of her home and expand the hallway.  When it rains, the water comes in.  For this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase the materials she needs such as galvanized metal panels, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal panels, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her home and to widen the hallway.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo es un  señor con una numerosa familia, sus hijos son estudiantes de primaria y secundaria, junto a su esposa e hijos se dedican a la actividad comercial de venta de frutas, verduras y chatarras, don Reynaldo sale todos los días a la calles con su camioneta para poder vender algo en el día, lo que le permite cubrir sus gastos principales. Solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en: Reynaldo is a man with a very large family.  His sons are students in primary and secondary school.  Together with his wife and children he works in the commercial activity of selling fruits, vegetables, and scrap metal.  Reynaldo goes out every day to the streets with his truck in order to sell something every day, which allows him to cover principle expenses.  He is asking for credit in order to invest in the business and continue moving forward.

loans.use: To invest in varied fruits, vegetables, scrap metal and recyclables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy metal roofing, purlins, bricks, cement and pay the labour costs.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en:
Sayora is 51 years old. She is married to a kind man named Zoir. They are bringing up four children and live happily together in the south of Tajikistan. 

Fifteen years ago, Sayora began a business selling children's clothes. She has a great experience in this field. Her experience and skills helped her to develop her business further. She manages her business alone. Sayora has a selling place in a local market. 

Every season Sayora renews the assortment of her goods. Now, she is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy children's clothes for the new summer season. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for the new summer season

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Touba 2 Group

texts.fr: Madame Khady est la présidente du groupement sope serigne fallou touba 2. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui habitent dans le même quartier et pratiquent la meme activité. Khady est une femme mariée et mère de famille qui évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes. Elle est reconnue sur la photo par la pochette rouge qu'elle tient dans sa main. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans et demande ce montant pour acheter et vendre des fruits et légumes commes les choux, aubergines, oranges, pommes etc.. dans le marché de sa commune. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l'avenir, elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus et développer son commerce afin de pouvoir épargner de l'argent et pérenniser son activité.
texts.en: Mrs. Khady is the leader of the Sope Serigne Fallou Touba 2 group. The group is composed of 10 women living in the same neighborhood and engaged in the same line of business. Khady is a married woman, with children, who works as a vendor of fruits and vegetables. She may be recognized on the photo thanks to the red pouch she is holding in her hand. She has over five years of business experience and is applying for this loan to buy fruits and vegetables for resale, such as cabbage, eggplant/aubergines, oranges, apples etc. at her local community market. She helps her husband manage everyday family expenses and the costs of their children’s schooling. She starts her working day at 8 AM and ends at 7 PM. In the future, she would like to increase her revenues and develop her business further in order to stabilize it and be able to put money away as savings.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran cinco socias exitosas, lo coordina la señora Ivania de 39 años, casada y madre de dos hijos que dependen de ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio desde hace 4 años y requiere el crédito para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, plátano verde, plátano maduro, remolachas, zanahorias, lechuga, etc., por medio de los créditos la socia ha logrado mantener el negocio y aumentar las ganancias. Otra de las socias es la señora Dora de 60 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, la señora Lissette de 31 años comerciante de calzado y prendas en su comunidad, la señora Marling de 42 años comerciante de refrescos y chiverías en su domicilio y la señora María de 66 años quien elabora y vende enchiladas en su domicilio y comunidad.
texts.en: This lending group is made up of five successful members.  Ivania is the coordinator.  She is 39 years old, married, and mother to two sons whom she supports.  For four years she has sold food from her home.  She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients such as rice, beans, cooking oil, green plantains, mature plantains, beets, carrots, lettuce, etc.  Through loans, she has been able to support her business and increase her earnings. Other members are: Dora, age 60, who has a grocery in her home, Lissette, age 31, who sells shoes and clothing in her neighborhood, Marling, age 42, who sells soft drinks and snacks from her home, and Maria, age 66, who makes and sells enchiladas in her home and in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Los Tres Lirios Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socios laboriosos y coordinado por el señor Edgar de 47 años de edad y casado, se dedica a la comercialización de pan y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de pan simple, pan dulce, empanadas, picos, pan de manjar, etc., por medio de los créditos anteriores ha logrado mantener el negocio y así darle el pan de cada día a su familia. Los otros socios son el señor Álvaro de 32 años propietario de una caponera, siendo éste el transporte más utilizado en su comunidad y el señor Alfonso de 63 años dedicado a la venta de CD`s en su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group has three hard-working members; it is run by 47-year-old Edgar, who is married and makes a living selling bread. Edgar needs this loan in order 
to buy sweet and savoury breads, snacks, pastries and breads filled with fudge. Edgar has used previous loans to keep his business going and support his family.

The other members of the group are: Álvaro, 32 years old, who owns a motorcycle, the most popular mode of transport in his community; and 63 year old Alfonso, who makes a living selling CDs.

loans.use: to buy sweet and savoury breads, snacks, pastries and breads filled with fudge.

loans.name: Bosque Del Lirio Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran cuatro socios laboriosos, lo coordina la señora María de 52 años casada y madre de dos hijos que dependen de ella se dedica a la venta de leche, hielo y helados en su domicilio y solicita el crédito para la compra de vainilla, frambuesa, bolsas, azúcar, leche, coco, maní, etc., la socia afirma que con el crédito anterior ella logro aumentar las ganancias. Otro socio es el señor Julio de 21 años comerciante de frutas y verduras en el mercado oriental, la señora Isabel de 64 años se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas en su domicilio y la señora Iluminada de 68 años comerciante de ropa usada en su domicilio y calles de su comunidad.
texts.en:
The community bank is made up of four hardworking members.  It is coordinated by María, who is 52 years old, married, and the mother of two children who depend on her.  She works selling milk, ice, and ice creams from her home.  She is requesting this loan to purchase vanilla, raspberries, bags, sugar, milk, coconut, and peanuts.  She says that she was able to increase her profits with her last loan.  

The other members are Julio, who is 21 years old and sells fruits and vegetables at the eastern market, Isabel, who is 64 years old and works making and selling tortillas from her home, and Illuminada, who is 68 years old and sells used clothing from her home and on the streets in her community.

loans.use: to purchase vanilla, raspberries, bags, sugar, milk, coconut, and peanuts.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias laboriosas y coordinado por la señora Josefa de 49 años, acompañada y madre de tres hijas de las cuales solamente una depende de ella, es comerciante de frutas y verduras en el Mayoreo, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 23 años lo que la ha motivado a seguir ofreciendo este servicio por ser uno de los sectores económicos que más ganancias genera, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de mango y tamarindo. Los otros socios son la señora María de 44, años comerciante de frutas y verduras, y el señor Henry de 26 años dedicado a la compra y venta de cosechas.
texts.en:
The community bank is made up of three hardworking members.  It is coordinated by Josefa, who is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three children, one of whom depends on her.  She works selling fruits and vegetables at wholesale. She has done this work for 23 years.  She has been motivated to continue offering this service because it is one of the most profitable areas of the economy.  She is requesting this loan to purchase mango and tamarind.

The other members are Maria, who is 44 years old and sells fruits and vegetables, and Henry, who is 26 years old and buys and sells crops.

loans.use: to purchase mango and tamarind.

loans.name: Ma.lalaine

texts.en: As a way of generating income, Ma.lalaine engages in selling beauty products, personal collection and frozen foods within the local community. She aims to make her business more profitable in order to help her husband in gaining income and sustaining their daily necessities. She wants to acquire more stock of the said products but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase more stock of the said products to sell. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that someday, she will become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of beauty products, personal collection and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase glass to make windows

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 60-year-old lady from Katito region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is a widow and supports four people in her family. She has grown-up children.

She sells soft drinks, a business she has been doing for the last five years, and generates a monthly income of KES 60,000. She has applied for her second loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to increase her working capital. She will use the anticipated profit to start a new business.

Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is a 42-year-old man from Sichirai in Kakamega county, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Catherine, who is a business-lady, and he supports four people in the family and has two children who are aged ten and five years old respectively.

He has a hardware shop where he sells household items. He has been doing this for the last 24 years and makes a monthly income of KES 90,000. He has applied for his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more materials. He will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.

His dream is to become a large scale dairy farmer and support his family.

loans.use: to add more stock of household items to sell

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben, who is 36 years old and married, is from Naivasha. They have three children who are in school.

Reuben has a motorbike business that he has been running for the past seven years. He has applied for his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to repair his motorbike and to pay school fees.

Reuben hopes to buy a taxi in the near future.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and pay for school fees

loans.name: Anora

texts.en:
Anora is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She  is married and has 4 children. Anora owns and operates a business selling fish, while her husband does the fishing. She has been engaged in her business for many years and earns well to sustain their living.

Anora joined GDMPC in 2008 and it helped to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets. Anora plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined . She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be operating the business in rented premises. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy stocks of fruits and vegetables to resell. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future hes life will be different. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. the previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy stocks of fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be industrious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a local area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, vegetables, spices, meat, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for eight years now.

Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, vegetables, spices, meat, etc. for her business

loans.name: Kathlene

texts.en: Kathlene is 32 years old and single. For the past year, she has been operating a business raising livestock in the Philippines. Kathlene has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock. She has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Kathlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Ruth works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income by buying and selling fish. 

Having repaid her previous loan, Ruth is now borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase gasoline, a  fishing net, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business. 

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, a  fishing net, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of four children, Juanita works hard to support her family. She has a tobacco vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from directly selling Tupperware products. Juanita is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase more tobacco to sell for her tobacco vending business.

Juanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to resell at her buy-and-sell firewood business.

Ma. Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to resell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mabel is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mabel has a general store business in the Philippines. Mabel requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to resell in her general store.

Mabel has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mabel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to resell in her general store.

loans.name: Madonna

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Madonna works hard to support her family.

Madonna has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy and sell fish business and general store. Madonna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Madonna successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Madonna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Meet Rebecca, who is a farmer and mother of two children. She lives in Nyamira area of South Nyanza, Kenya where she has been doing farming for the past 12 years. Her primary income source is milk, eggs, tea, and bananas. She also has put up a retail business in the local area. Her biggest challenge in farming is the lack of sufficient funds.

Rebecca took up this Kiva loan so that she can expand her poultry farm and increase the production of eggs, which will increase her income. This will enable her to take care of her children well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Joyline

texts.en: Joyline, 25 years old, is married and has three children, two of whom go to school. She has been in the tailoring business for two years, working seven days a week and eleven hours a day. Her business is located in the market. Joyline also does farming as a source of additional income. Joyline hopes to expand her business but is challenged by lack of enough capital. She is a hardworking woman and wants money to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Sulyman

texts.en: Sulyman is a 34-year-old, married man with two children, who resides in Bundibugyo-Uganda. His major business is cattle farming. He earns a side income from teaching in a school with the purpose of raising income for his family, and improving their standard of living. He sells cattle to the local community. Sulyman is hardworking, though affected by the dry season where water and grass for the cattle are hardly there. He dreams of building a permanent house, buying a car, and educating his children to a higher level of education. He needs a loan to buy more bulls to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bulls to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women, and also curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is 40 years old, married with six children and living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. He is dealing mainly in cocoa growing and he has diversified the business by selling tomatoes, cabbages and other fresh foods on a busy street. Godfrey does all this work with the aim of raising income to support his family. He also sells to the local community, and meets a difficulty of limited capital. Godfrey's dream is to build a permanent house and to further educate his children. He will use the loan to buy fresh foods for selling.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods for selling.

loans.name: Sonunbu

texts.ru: Сонунбу 54 года, вдова, мать 5 детей. У Сонунбу - средне-специальное образование, уже много лет работает в школе, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 1984 году. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Сонунбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров, 18 овец и 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сонунбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота и прибыли от реализации молока и молочной продукции. Доходы от кредита Сонунбу планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Sonunbu is 54 years old, a widow, and the mother of five. Sonunbu has finished technical college. For many years has been working at the local school. As an additional source of income for her family, Sonunbu raises livestock, having first started in 1984. Thanks to Sonunbu’s hard work and dedication, her farm now includes five cows, 18 sheep and one horse. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Sonunbu has applied to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to increase her livestock by buying a cow. This will allow her to increase her revenues from selling milk and dairy products. Sonunbu plans to use the resulting revenue for an additional increase of livestock. She would also like to save up for house renovations.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Edgar Alexander

texts.es:
Edgar, aprendió a comercializar diferentes artículos para el hogar como empleado, hace cinco años lo hace como negocio propio, está acompañado desde hace 13 años, no tiene hijos, vive con su compañera de vida y sus padres en casa alquilada. Por su experiencia y con la colaboración de su compañera de vida en el negocio se mantienen en el mercado.
El crédito  le ayudara a adquirir de manera inmediata la mercadería para abastecer su negocio y así presentar ante sus clientes una variedad de ofertas con las que espera que sus ventas e ingresos mejores, comprara reloj de paredes, set de camas, focos ahorrativos, vajillas de platos, linternas, etc.
Su visión es seguir esforzándose por fortalecer su negocio, instalar una oficina para contratar personal que le apoyen en las ventas, adquirir un vehículo que le facilite el traslado de la mercadería y comprar un lote para construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Edgar learned to sell items for the home working for another business. Five years ago, though, he started his own business selling these items. Edgar has been with his partner for 13 years. He lives with her and his parents in a rented house; the couple has no children. With his experience, and help from his partner, Edgar keeps his business going at the local market.

This loan will help Edgar to buy merchandise immediately in order to stock up his business and to offer his customers a variety of goods that will hopefully result in higher sales and profits. Edgar will use this loan to buy walk clocks, energy-saving lightbulbs, dishes, lamps, beds sheets and more.

Edgar's plan is to continue to strengthen his business and to have an office so that he can hire staff to support him with sales. He also wants to buy a vehicle for transporting stock, and to buy a plot of land on which to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy walk clocks, energy-saving lightbulbs, dishes, lamps, beds sheets and more.

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta  4to grado debido a las precarias condiciones económicas de sus padres ya no pudo seguir estudiando. 

Es casado, su esposa es sastre, actividad que le genera ingresos para los gastos de su hogar. Tienen cuatro hijos  el 1ro es policía, la 2da no estudia se dedica a los oficios domésticos, el 3ro estudia 1er año de bachillerato, la 4ta estudia educación básica.
   
Luciano,  se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas (siembra de granos básicos como maíz,  frijol y maicillo.) Tiene alrededor  de 25 años de experiencia en el área, desde muy pequeño sus padres lo llevaban al campo a trabajar  y cuando se casó ya trabajo propio para él y su familia. Siempre ha sido agricultor, el lugar donde trabaja le queda a 20 minutos y viaja a pie, su esposa y dos de sus  hijos son los que se involucran en las actividades.

   
Con el financiamiento comprara los insumos agrícolas como: 5 quintales de fórmula, 8 quintales de sulfato, dos litros de herbicidas y con el resto pagara la mano de obra para las  diferentes actividades que requieren los cultivos. Con el crédito tendrá la oportunidad de ampliar el área donde trabajaba.

El sueño de él, es que los hijos que actualmente están estudiando logren ingresar a la universidad, y que puedan obtener un título académico  que les permita encontrar una fuente de ingreso digna para tener una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Luciano is 54 years old. He only completed the fourth grade in school. He wasn't able to keep studying due to his parents’ difficult financial situation.
He is married. His wife is a tailor. This occupation generates the income to cover the household expenses. They have four children, the first one is a policeman; the second one doesn't go to school, she does the household chores; the third one is a freshman in high school; and the fourth one attends elementary school. 

Luciano is a farmer (the sowing of bulk grains like corn, beans, and sorghum) 
He’s been working in this field for about 25 years. Since he was very little, his parents took him to work in the fields, and when he got married he worked for himself and his family. He has always been a farmer. His workplace is 20 minutes away, and he walks there. His wife and two of his kids are then ones involved in this occupation.

He’ll buy farming supplies with this funding, such as 5 quintals of formula, 8 quintals of sulfate, two liters of weed-killer, and he’ll use the rest of the money to pay for the labor needed  in the crops.

 He’ll have the opportunity to expand his work area with this money. His dream is that his kids, the ones that are currently studying, will be able to enroll in college and get a degree that will allow them to find a decent source of income to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 5 quintals of formula, 8 quintals of sulfate, 2 liters of weed-killer, and  pay for the labor needed in the crops.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венере 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Венеры- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад с покупки скота. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Венеры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 дойных коров, 10 овец, 1 лошадь и 20 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Venera is 32 years old, married, and raising three children with her husband.  She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry, an activity which constitutes her family's main source of income.  She started in this business 13 years ago with the purchase of livestock.  Thanks to her hard work and perseverance, she now owns seven dairy cows, 10 sheep, one horse and 20 goats.  She makes a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" and requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy a horse to increase her cattle headcount.  Venera plans to invest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her number of domestic animals.  She would also like to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Naisan's Group

texts.en: Naisan is 43 years old and a villager from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Champ province. She has three children, two of whom are in school. She deals with her daily expenses via rice farming and a paid working job. She has been involved in this business for 25 years, earning almost 39,000 KHR per day. This is the first microloan for Naisan with VisionFund, (Kiva’s partner).  She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She highly hopes that she can gain a good income, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Residing in Takeo province, Tes is a married mother and farmer who grows rice as the main source of income. Nowadays, she needs to support her 9-year-old son, who remains in school. It is the business that she has had for ages.

Tes is in her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) with a successful repayment of her past loan. The positive impact of her original loan has enabled her to cover the needs of her family including purchasing school materials for her kid, buying daily food, and other necessary expenses for her entire household. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee. She highly hopes that she can gain double her income better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en:
Sreyleak, 30, is a citizen from the Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province. She is a mother of two children who are still too young for schooling. Sreyleak's entire family counts on her rice cropping business and her job working at a factory. She has been occupied in her current business for five years, earning about 18,900 KHR per day. 

This is Sreyleak's third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has improved her living conditions at a good pace. Sreyleak will spend her entire loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can gain a better income than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Soly

texts.en:
A female age 47, Soly lives in the Boribor district of Kompong Chnang province. She is married with four children. Two are living as dependents to her and her husband. Soly’s family has been farming for 30 years. It is the one and only business for her family. The farming makes an income for her whole family of only 325,000 Riel per month average.

Soly has been a borrower of Kiva’s partner VisionFund for the past three cycles. The successful repayment of her past loan has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 700,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer for her cash crop. She strongly hopes that she can boost her crop yield in a timely way so that she can earn more income to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cash crop

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea is a married woman currently living in the Boribor district of Kompong Chhnang province. Nowadays, she needs to support her children who are in school. To struggle for a living, rice cropping is the main business which has occupied her for thirty years. The monthly income for Chea’s family is only 275,000 Riel which is barely enough for the family expenses.

This is the second microloan for Chea with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has enabled her to stabilize her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, Chea is applying for a loan of 500,000 Riel. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her paddy rice. She strongly believes that she can double her yield so she can keep her dependent kids in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her paddy rice

loans.name: Al-Forsan Al- Khat Al- Jadid Group

texts.en:
Al-Forsan Al- Khat Al- Jadid is a group which comprises four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB.

Takwa is the leader of the group. She is a 59-year-old married woman, living with her spouse in their own house. Their house is very old and small. Takwa's husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. His income is very low and it is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Takwa says that her house lacks much home furniture and most of it is very old, and she can't afford it. Unfortunately, they didn't have enough money to furnish the house. For this reason, Takwa is requesting a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a bed for their home.

Takwa looks forward to improving the condition of her family. Her dreams in the future are to furnish her house with new furniture and home appliances. She hopes to open a saving account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase a bed for their home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and weed her coffee field.

loans.name: Hassana

texts.fr:
Mr Hassana est âgé de 41 ans et vit avec son  épouse et ses 5 enfants dans une famille polygame dans le quartier de Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako   avec sa famille. 
Mr Hassana a fréquenté l’école coranique, il a prématurément abandonné l’école et s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son enfance. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il s’est basé sur  la vente des bonbons, chocolats, sucres et lait en poudre, cigarettes, thé, biscuits,  qu’il apprit auprès de son oncle il y a 15ans. Pour pouvoir  augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décide de rejoindre  l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, est à son premier  prêt individuel. Avec ce financement, il se ravitaille à partir du Sénégal. Mr Hassana effectue sa vente au  Dibida  à une clientèle constituée  de femmes et d’hommes  au comptant et à crédit. Avec ce financement il compte  réaliser un profit de 150 000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera  pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire les besoins  de sa  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Hassana is 41 years old and he lives with his wife and five children in an extended polygamous family in the Djicoroni neighborhood of Bamako.  Hassana attended Koranic school but dropped out early, while he was still a child, in order to get involved in income-generating activities.  He tried several activities without much success, before focusing on selling candy, chocolates, sugar, powdered milk, cigarettes, tea and cookies.  He learned this activity 15 years ago from one of his uncles.

In order to boost his business and strengthen his sales capacity, Hassana has decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and this is his first individual loan.  This loan will allow him to buy new stocks of goods in Senegal.  Hassana resells his merchandise in Dibida to a customer base which consists of both men and women, and who pay him in cash or on credit.  Thanks to this loan, he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 150,000 CFA francs, which will be used to repay his loan's interest to Soro Yiriwaso, to meet his family's needs, and to reinvest the rest of the money in his activity.

loans.use: to buy various goods such as candy, chocolates, sugar, powdered milk, cigarettes, tea and cookies.

loans.name: Zarnigar

texts.en:
Zarnigar is a 30-year-old married woman and has three sons. The members of family are refugees and live in an IDP settlement. Her husband is a laborer, but the main source of family’s income is gardening. Zarnigar has been raising and selling wheat for eight years and has good skills in this area. Her monthly income is 350 AZN.

People have high demand in wheat because they use it to prepare flour and flour products. They bake pies, bread, lavash, cakes and so on.  

Family’s monthly income doesn't cover the demands and Zarnigar needs money for this. She applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers for wheat, and increase harvest and income. She wants to provide her children good education.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers for wheat and increase harvest.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 33-year-old married mother of two children, who works hard with her husband to provide her children with a better living. 

Samar runs a business from her house in Ain region to stay home with her children and take good care of them. Two years ago, she started selling used clothes, underwear, and housewares.

She used to work in a clothing store for five years which provided her with a lot of experience in this domain.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for the needed construction materials, since she is building an additional room to expand her business and increase her inventory.

As for the future, Samar intends to move her business outside her house when her children grow enough to take good care of themselves.

loans.use: to pay for the necessary construction materials to expand her business

loans.name: Flor De Angel Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias exitosas, coordinado por la señora Hilda de 34 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo se dedica a comercializar ropa nueva y recargas movistar y claro de manera ambulante y en su domicilio, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería como es camisetas, blusas, licras, talladores, brasieres, blúmer, bóxer, etc. Otra de las socias es la señora Karen de 32 años dedicada a la hecha y venta de tortillas en su domicilio y la señora Meyling de 25 años comerciante de ropa y cosméticos en su comunidad. Estas socias solicitan el crédito con el fin de aumentar las ventas y por ende las ganancias, y es su primer crédito que solicitan en la institución.
texts.en:
This support group is comprised of three successful members, coordinated by Hilda. She is 34, married, and the mother of a son. She works by selling new clothes and Movistar reload cards from home and by traveling.

She needs this loan to buy merchandise such as shirts, blouses, spandex, work clothes, bras, underwear, boxers, etc. Another member is Karen, 32, who makes a living making and selling tortillas in her home. Meyling, 25, is a clothing and cosmetics vendor in her community. These members are requesting a loan to increase sales and, in turn, income. It is the first loan they are requesting through this institution.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Iris Esmeralda

texts.es: Iris tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, su hijo de 8 años y su hija de 4 años de edad. Iris trabaja como vendedora en una empresa cercana a su localidad y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Iris solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar las chapas de las puestas de su vivienda y comprar dos puertas nuevas. Además, desea pintar las paredes de la vivienda así como reparar el servicio sanitario. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a las reparaciones lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Iris is 25 years old and lives in a house she owns together with her life partner, her eight year old son, and her four year old daughter.  Iris works as a saleswoman in a business in her town.  This is how she earns a living and supports her household.  

Iris is requesting a loan from FUSAI because she wants to repair the door knobs on the doors in her home and purchase two new doors.  She also wants to paint the walls of her home and repair the bathroom.  She hopes that she can count on this loan and start the repairs as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase two doors, three door knobs, paint, galvanized metal sheeting, and wood.

loans.name: Paul Angelo

texts.en:
Paul Angelo previously accessed an 18,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Paul Angelo dreams to expand his business and hopes to give his family a better future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Manchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Manchita works hard to support her family.

She has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. Manchita is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell in her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested a new loan to further build her business.

Manchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchae more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Dolores Concepcion

texts.es:
Dolores, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de carnes, pollo, arroz, bebidas, condimentos, verduras, embutidos, pastas, aceite, sal, azúcar, y otros ingredientes que necesita para preparar la comida que vende, así su venta de bebidas estará abastecida para revender.
EL financiamiento anterior le favoreció positivamente pues conto con la materia prima que le ha permitido seguir trabajando, sus ventas mejoraron, los clientes e ingresos son mayores, la familia se encuentra en perfectas condiciones.
texts.en:
Dolores decided to request a new loan to invest in the purchase of meat, chicken, rice, condiments, vegetables, cold cuts, pasta, oil, salt, sugar and other ingredients she needs to prepare the food she sells. By purchasing beverages as well, her beverage business will also be stocked for resale. 
The last credit worked in Dolores' favor, enabling her to have the primary material she needed to continue working. Her sales improved and she now has more clients and income. Her family is in perfect condition.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and beverages.

loans.name: Guliko

texts.en:
This is Guliko's second loan on Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support she is getting to make progress in life. She had expanded her agribusiness with the loan, and now requested another for building a greenhouse. 

Guliko is such hardworking person with great desire to ensure her large family with better style of living. She does everything and promises to pay her loan installments punctually. 

Guliko will grow different kinds of greens and vegetables and will sell them for a good price at the local market. To reach that goal, she needs a loan of 2,000 GEL to collect all merchandise and tools for the greenhouse. 

Guliko and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Juana Inocente

texts.es:
Juana, es casada su esposo trabaja en el ejército, pero en el área de pagaduría, tiene un hijo que estudia séptimo grado. Con ella solo vive su esposo, su hijo.
 
   La señora solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos. En ocasiones ayuda a su esposo en las actividades agrícolas ya que aprendió esta actividad porque cuando era pequeña iba al campo con sus padres, antes solo era doméstica,  y donde trabajan con su esposo le queda a 15 minutos de su casa y se conduce a pie porque es un lugar dónde no entran vehículos. Generalmente solo ella y su esposo trabajan. 

   El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semillas, abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra que ayude a la limpia del terreno y el resto lo ocupara para cubrir algunos gastos del hogar. Será satisfecha la  necesidad  de contar con un recurso como capital de trabajo.

   Su sueño es ayudar a su hijo dándole todo el apoyo para que él pueda estudiar y sea un profesional y que no viva en las condiciones que ellos se crecieron; sino que tenga una mejor calidad de vida, pueda valerse por sí mismo.
texts.en:
Juana is married. Her husband is the army, he works in the Payment Department. She has a son who attends 7th grade. She only lives with her husband and her son.

Juana just does the household chores. Sometimes she helps her husband with the farming. When she was a child  she learned this occupation because she used to go to the fields with her parents. In the past, she was just a housewife. Her workplace, where she works with her husband, is just 15 minutes from her house. She walks there because cars are not allowed in that area. Usually, just she and her husband work.

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, weed-killer, and to pay for the labor needed to help clean the ground. She’ll use the rest of the money to cover some household expenses. This will satisfy the need to have a source of working capital.

Her dream is to help her son, supporting him, so he can study and become a professional. That way, he won’t live in the same conditions they grew on. He’ll have a better quality of life and he’ll be able to provide for himself.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, weed-killer, and to pay for the labor to clean up the ground. She’ll use the rest of the money to cover some household expenses.

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es: Don José, tiene 58 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene cuatro hijos, vive en la comunidad de Colinas, santa Bárbara con su esposa y dos hijos. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando granos básicos. Hace tres años decidió dedicarse a la ganadería, cría de vacas, vende leche y carne y vaca en su comunidad. Ha solicitado el tercer préstamo que es por 25,000 lempiras para reparación de cerca del potrero, compra de vitaminas y desparasitantes para mantener con buena salud sus animales. Con las ganancias tiene planes de tener otra raza de animales para mejorar la calidad del ganado y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old and lives with his life partner with whom he has four children. He and his wife live in the community of Colinas, Santa Barbara with two of their children. He has always worked as a farmer, growing basic grains. Three years ago, José decided to get into ranching, raising cattle and selling milk, meat and cows to the community.
He has requested his third loan of 25,000 lempiras to repair the fence around the pasture; and to purchase vitamins and anti-parasitic drugs to keep the animals in good health. He plans to use the earnings to get his family ahead; and to get another breed of animals, which will improve the quality of his cattle.

loans.use: to repair the pasture fence and purchase vitamins and anti-parasitic drugs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and to buy more books

loans.name: Shirley Carla

texts.es: La Señorita Shirley  sigue  estudiando la carrera  de contaduría pública en un instituto muy reconocido de la ciudad de El Alto, la Señorita Shirley  para pagar sus estudios trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza, es promotora de productos, este es su segundo crédito que ha tomado con la institución,  la Señorita Shirley  va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como pago de matrícula y mensualidad de un año para este año, Shirley se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de kiva que le permiten mejorar su calidad de vida terminando su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Señorita Shirley continues to study to be a public accountant in a well-known institute in the city of El Alto.  She works as a promoter, selling beauty products to pay for her studies.  

This is the second loan that she has had with the institution.  Señorita Shirley is going to use the loan to cover different costs involved in studying, like tuition and monthly fees for the year.  Shirley is grateful to the Kiva lenders who allow her to improve her quality of life by finishing her schooling.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and monthly fees for a year.

loans.name: Love-Lie

texts.en:
Love-lie is married and has two children.  She operates a fishing business while her husband does fishing to earn a living. For three years, she has been selling fish in their village, to assist her husband to increase the income for the family. She has sustained her business and is able to meet their daily needs. 

Recently, she joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy fishing nets for fishing. 

In the future, Love-lie wants to own more fishing boats to expand her business and improve their income.  This will allow her to provide their family with a better future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Señorita Elizabeth tiene 26 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de licenciatura en Informática  en uno de las universidades más reconocidas  de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Elizabeth trabaja  para pagar sus estudios ella tiene su tienda de barrio donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad a su clientela, este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución,  la Señorita Elizabeth va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar cómo comprar una computadora y pagar unos libros para sus  estudios  Superiores,  la Señorita Elizabeth enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  viven en la zona de Munaypata  su deseo es poder titularse lo antes posible para poder trabajar y así de esta manera poder tener más ingresos económicos para ayudar a su familia y a sus hermanos a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 26, is single and is studying for a degree in Information Sciences at one of the most well-known universities in the city of La Paz. Elizabeth works to pay for school. She has a store in the neighborhood where she offers basic need products to her customers. This is her first loan with this institution. Elizabeth is going to use it for school expenses such as buying a computer and paying for books related to her higher education.

Elizabeth faces challenges with school such as a lack of economic support from her parents, and having to work and study, which makes things difficult. However, she has a desire to keep improving and finish her degree to work in her field living in the Munaypata area. Her dream is to graduate as soon as possible so she can work and, in this way, have more income to help her family and siblings move forward.

loans.use: to buy a computer and books for her education.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nida works hard to support her family.

Nida has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish and raising pigs. Nida is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a thirty-two year-old married female and has two children, both of which go to school. 

She has a business, selling food, located in the market.   Agnes works seven days a week, ten hours a day. 

Agnes hopes to build a house and expand her business into new markets. However, lack of enough capital and seasonal changes affect her business since she works from an open place. Agnes is a hardworking woman who needs a loan to buy tomatoes for selling.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes for selling

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a 43-year-old married female with five children, four of whom go to school, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been a teacher for 19 years in a primary school, plus farming as an additional income. 

Racheal needs a loan to pay school fees for her children, and hopes to improve her standards of living. However, the challenge of low and delayed salary payment affect her.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a very hardworking and enterprising woman, who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work. She sells fruits, such as mangoes and oranges, and operates a cereal business.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fruits, such as mangoes, oranges, and bananas, and more cereal for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and cereal for her business.

loans.name: Joseline Patricia

texts.es:
Joseline, comprará lociones, cremas corporales, blusas, faldas, aretes, pulseras, labiales, collares, dijes, anillo, con lo que tendrá abastecido su inventario y satisfacera las exigencias de sus clientes, espera tener buenos ingresos con los que cancelara su deuda, cubrirá gasto personales y apoyara a sus padres.
Con los financiamientos anteriores ha tenido los productos que sus clientes necesita y a incluido otro tipo de mercadería en su negocio con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Joseline will buy lotions, body creams, blouses, skirts, earrings, bracelets, lipsticks, necklaces, pendants, and rings with which she will have her inventory stocked up and will satisfy her customers’ requests. She hopes to have good earnings with which she will pay her debt, cover personal expenses and help her parents. 

With the previous loans she had the products that her customers needed and included other merchandise in her business with the aim of increasing her earnings.

loans.use: buy lotions, body creams, blouses, skirts, earrings, bracelets, lipsticks, necklaces, pendants, and rings

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera, tiene dos hijos,  vive en el municipio de Petoa, Santa Bárbara. Ella inicio su comercializando productos AVON y hace dos años vende ropa, desinfectantes, lociones, vasos, productos cosméticos por catalogo y calzado. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es por 21,000 Lempiras para comprar ropa, calzado, y productos de catalogo para tener surtido y vender mas. Su meta es lograr estabilidad en el negocio y con su familia.
texts.en: Norma is 41 years old. She is single and has two children. She lives in the municipality of Petoa, Santa Barbara. She began her business selling Avon products, and for two years she has been selling clothing, disinfectants, lotions, glasses, cosmetic products by catalog, and footwear. She does her work as an itinerant vendor. The loan that she is applying for is for 21,000 lempiras to buy clothing, footwear, and catalog products to stock her business and to sell more. Her goal is to achieve stability in her business and with her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, and cosmetic products by catalog to sell and to stock her business.

loans.name: Winby

texts.en:
Winby is 27 years old, married and has four young children. She is married to Gilberto, a farmer. 

Winby is raising hogs for future sale. She hopes to keep improving this small business; that is why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy piglets and feed for sustainability. Someday she hopes to keep gaining good profits in her business to save for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for sustainability

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a farmer, who grows and harvests rice in the Samnoy village in Preah Sdach district, Prey Veng province. Farming is the major source of her income and is the work that she has been involved in since she was a teenage girl. Her husband also works with her on their farm since it is the only way they have to move the family forward. Chan has four children, two of whom are her burdens while the other two are married and have independent lives.

By applying for this loan Chan will be able to buy a set of solar home systems to install on the top roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After being with Hattha Kaksekar, she can gain access to micro-finance services and solar energy, which she uses to support household appliances such as light, TV and radio, so everyone in her family can even work or study at night. She expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a set of solar home systems to install on the top roof of her house

loans.name: Kenia Lizeth

texts.es: Kenia, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara junto a su madre e hijos. Hace un año que vende comidas y golosinas como almuerzos, pollo con tajadas, tacos, refrescos, jugos, galletas, etc. ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Este negocio de comidas lo tiene en un local propio en su casa. El préstamo que solicita es por 20,000 lempiras para comprar carnes, verduras, condimentos, galletas, jugos y refrescos para poder tener surtido el negocio. Su plan es seguir creciendo en el negocio y seguir dándole el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Kenia, 30, is a single mother. She has two children. She lives in the city of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara, with her mother and children. She has sold food and sweets for a year including lunch, sliced chicken, tacos, drinks, juice, and cookies. She has always worked in sales. This food business is located in her home.

She is requesting this loan of 20,000 HNL to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, cookies, juice, and drinks to stock her business. Her plan is to keep growing in the business and to keep providing her children with an education.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, cookies, juice, and drinks to stock her business.

loans.name: Lun Eng

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Battambang district of Battambang province, Lun Eng is aged 34 years and married. She has nine children. To support the family, she and her husband have been in working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about $13 (USD) per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Lun Eng is just with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy soil to refill the front of her house. She hopes this loan will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soil to refill the front of her house

loans.name: Joneless

texts.en: Joneless is a forty-year-old married female with three children, all of whom attend school. She has been a senior account assistant for thirteen years in the Kasese local government, plus she has rentals for additional income. Joneless needs money to construct a house and hopes to improve her living standards, though high transport and high costs of living are hardships she must meet.

loans.use: to construct a house

loans.name: Sren's Group

texts.en: Sren, originally from Kampong Cham province, is a mother of three children, two are in school and one is too young for schooling. She struggles for a living via her half hectare of farmland and a joint-hand with her husband to catch fish for resale. She has been involved in the current business for 11 years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day. Sren has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and she also has a plan to raise pigs besides her rice farming. She hopes that she will gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Don Bernardo, tiene 59 años de edad, esta soltero vive con un hijo en la aldea de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. trabajo como jornalero por muchos años. ahora tiene sus propios cultivos de  maíz, frijol y café. la producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 6,000 lempiras para comprar abono, semillas, y pago de mano de obra para fertilizar y cultivar café, maíz y frijol y asegurar la cosecha. Su meta es ampliar sus cultivos, crecer como caficultor y darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Bernardo is 59 years old. He is single and lives with his son in the small town of San Marcos, Santa Bárbara. He has been working as a day laborer for many years. Now, he has his own corn, bean, and coffee crops. He sells what he produces at the local market. He is requesting this loan of 6,000 Honduran lempiras to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labor so he can fertilize and grow coffee, corn, and beans and thus ensure a good harvest. His goals are to increase his crops, to grow as a coffee farmer, and to give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and to pay for labor to maintain his coffee, corn, and bean crops.

loans.name: Gladis Ester

texts.es:
Gladis, es propietaria de una tienda en la que tiene a la disposición de sus clientes productos de la canasta básica, es con ella que ha podido cubrir los gastos de su familia todo esté tiempo, es madre soltera, ya sus hijos son independientes. Su negocio tiene 15 años de funcionar.
Efectuara la compra de pan, galletas, aceite, jugos, boquitas, jabón, detergentes, pastas, granos básicos, espera surtir la tienda con lo necesario para atraer a nuevos clientes y resarcir su deuda lo más pronto posible.
Su deseo es cancelar el préstamo con buen record crediticio para sí poco a poco ir fortaleciendo más el negocio por medio de créditos.
texts.en:
Gladis is the proprietor of a store in which she has products for the basic family food basket available for her customers. It is with this that she has been able to cover the expenses of her family for all this time. She is a single mother, and her children are already independent. Her business has functioned for 15 years.

She will make the purchase of bread, crackers, oil, juices, snacks, soap, detergents, pasta, and basic grains. She hopes to stock her store with the necessary items to attract new customers and repay her debt as soon as possible.

Her wish is to pay off the loan with a good credit record so that little by little she can continue strengthening her business more through the loans.

loans.use: to buy bread, crackers, oil, juices, snacks, soap, detergents, pastas, and basic grains.

loans.name: Cesar Teddy

texts.es:
Cesar proviene de un hogar de padres separados, actualmente vive con su madre y su hermanito menor y no cuentan con ningún tipo de apoyo por parte de su padre. Su madre labora en limpieza publica en el municipio donde vive y su sueldo apenas alcanza para cubrir los gastos de alimentación en el hogar, por lo que Cesar no podría estudiar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Cesar seria el primero de su familia en cursar estudios superiores, por lo que hacerlo seria un gran logro para el y toda su familia. El desea ser un gran profesional y laborar para poder ayudar a su familia, siendo un ejemplo a seguir para su hermano menor y ayudarlo a que pueda seguir sus pasos en el futuro.
Cesar agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por todo el apoyo que le brindan para que pueda realizar su sueño de estudiar y ser pronto un profesional de éxito.
El considera que el apoyo que realiza cada prestamista de Kiva es una gran muestra de desprendimiento y de amor al prójimo del ser humano y que causa un efecto multiplicador positivo en el desarrollo de los mas necesitados
texts.en:
Cesar’s parents are separated.  He currently lives with his mother and his younger brother.  They do not have any type of support from their father.  His mother works in the area of public cleaning in the municipality where she lives.  Her salary barely covers the household food expenses.  Therefore, Cesar would not be able to go to school without the support of the Kiva lenders.

Cesar would be the first in his family to take higher education courses.  Doing so would be a great achievement for him and for his whole family.  He wishes to be a great professional and to work in order to be able to help his family.  He will be an example for his younger brother, and he will help him to be able to follow his footsteps in the future.

Cesar is grateful to the Kiva lenders for all of the support they provide him with so that he is able to fulfill his dream of going to school and to soon become a successful professional.

He believes that the support that each Kiva lender provides is a great show of generosity and of love for their fellow man.  It causes a large, positive ripple effect in the development of those most in need.

loans.use: to pay for his technical education as a maintenance mechanic.

loans.name: Señor Del Rimac Group

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 29 años de edad es soltera con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica al tejido de diversos modelos de prendas chompas chalecos para centros educativos y para el público en general. Años atrás trabajaba como domestica. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de tejido lana hilos agujas. Su mayor deseo es adquirir un stand donde pueda exhibir sus tejidos. Ella en el grupo “SEÑOR DEL RIMAC” cumple la función de presidenta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Elizabeth es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 29 years old, single with 2 dependent children. She works knitting various styles of garments, jackets and vests for schools and the general public. Years ago, she worked as a maid. She will invest the loan to purchase knitting materials: yarn, thread and needles. Her greatest wish is to acquire a stand where she can exhibit her knitting. In the "SEÑOR DEL RIMAC" group, she serves as president. The group is thankful to the KIVA investors for the credit extended. Elizabeth is the first from the left.

loans.use: To purchase yarn, needles and thread.

loans.name: Norlan Antonio

texts.es: El señor Norlan es un hombre exitoso de 40 años de edad, casado y padre de tres hijos, es propietario de un taller de reparación de motos, este negocio lo  heredo de su papá y cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa, el crédito lo solita para la compra de repuestos para motos como es  aceite, neumático, parches, cables para frenos, barillas, etc. El socio espera que con este crédito el aumento de las ganancias para en un futuro aumentar su negocio en una vulcanizadora completa.
texts.en: Señor Norlan is a successful man of 40. He is married and is the father or three children. He is the proprietor of a workshop for repairing motorcycles. He inherited this business from his father, and he has the help of his wife. The loan he is applying for is for the purchase of spare parts for motorcycles, such as oil, tires, patches, brake cables, spokes, etc. This communal bank member hopes that with this loan he will increase his earnings so that in the future he can increase his business with a complete tire repair shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora María, es una mujer exitosa de 32 años de edad, soltera, comercializa sandalias en zona franca y mercado de Masaya, se ha dedicado por más de diez años a la venta de sandalias en el mercado de la municipalidad, la socia ha trabajado en con esta institución financiera por más de 10 ciclos y ha visto mejorías tanto en su vida personal como en su negocio, es por este motivo que desea seguir prestando para obtener mayores beneficios. Con este crédito piensa invertir en el mismo negocio como son sandalias para damas, zapatos para damas, zapatos para niños, sandalias para niñas, etc.
texts.en: Señora Maria is a successful woman of 32. She is single. She sells sandals in the free trade zone and market of Masaya. She has sold sandals for more than 10 years in the municipal market. This communal bank member has worked with this financial institution for more than 10 loan cycles and has seen improvements in her personal life as well as in her business. It is for this reason that she wants to continue with the loans to obtain greater earnings. With this loan, she is thinking of investing in the same business, selling sandals for women, shoes for women, shoes for children, sandals for children, etc.

loans.use: to purchase sandals for women, school shoes, sandals for children, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 57-year-old mother from Vihiga region which is located in the western part of Kenya.  She is married to Elliam who is a businessman and supports the family by providing income.  She supports seven people in their family and has seven children who are ages: 35, 30, 26, 22, 18, 14 and 8.

She has a food kiosk that she has been operating for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES 4,000.  She is taking her third loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more tables and plastic seats. 

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.  Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more tables and plastic seats.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and pay for land preparation for her rice farming business. Cecilia has been in this business for 23 years. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business. Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for land preparation

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Marina has been in this business for 16 years. Marina earns more income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.
