Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Crisales

texts.en:
Crisales is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Crisales has been in this business for five years. Crisales earns more income from buying and selling charcoal and farming vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Crisales has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Phalla is 34-years-old and a mother of three children. Her main sources of income are from rice farming and her paid job that she works. She has been involved in her current business for ages and it generates her about 40,000 KHR. Phalla is a former borrower who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for ages with a successful repayment of the past loan. The past loans have enabled her to provide decent meals for her family. Now, she and her joint borrower are applying for 1,200,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing the field. She highly hopes that she can gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing the field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bicycle and educational equipment

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es: Vicentina es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche y otras cosas más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y fideos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Vicentina is a hardworking and enterprising person who gets her family ahead through the effort she puts into her work.  She sells primary needs products such as rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and other things.  She is a responsible person so she was asked to participate in the “Tres Cruces de Oro” communal bank.  She needs this loan to buy sacks of rice, sugar, and noodles and is grateful for and values this loan.  She is committed to making her monthly payments in a responsible manner.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: Faustina vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos. Ella vive en la ciudad de La Paz. En una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de propiedad de su familia. Faustina es artesana y bordadora, ella necesita un credito para comprar de materiales de bordado y de artesanía. Con eso ella sera capaz de indpendizarse ya que actualmente  solo ofrece sus servicios como si fuese mano de obra. Aunque su pareja es chofer de transporte publico y colabora con los gastos familiares, Faustina necesita ayuda
texts.en: Faustina is in a common law marriage and has three children.  She lives in a family home in La Paz and the house is made of brick and cement.  Faustina is an artist and embroiderer and needs this loan to buy some embroidery and artist supplies.  This will allow her to work on her own because at the moment she gets hired to provide her services.  Even though her husband it a public transportation driver and helps with expensed, Faustina needs help.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: El Mondonguito Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por cinco socias esforzadas en sus labores cotidianos, coordinado por la señora Juana, de 40 años de edad acompañada y con dos hijos, vende sopas en el domicilio con 10 años de experiencia en este negocio, y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de carne de res, mondongo, chiltoma, cebolla, ajo, ayote, chayote, etc. El grupo también lo integran la señora Nidia 55 años de edad comerciante de frutas y perecederos en el mercado municipal; señora Marling de 23 años de edad vende cosa de horno a diario y nacatamales los fines de semana; la señora Fátima comercializa cosméticas a domicilio y la señora Theyling con 22 años de edad se dedica a la venta de fritanga en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is made up of five hardworking members and is coordinated by Juana.  She is 40 years old, married and has two children.  She has been selling soups out of her home for 10 years and is asking for this loan to buy beef, tripe, peppers, onions, garlic, squash, chayote, etc.  Nildia, age 55, is also part of the group and sells fruits and perishables in the city market.  Marling is 23 and sells baked goods and nacatamales on the weekends.  Fatima sells cosmetics out of her home.  Theyling is 22 and sells fried foods out of her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Candida Natalia

texts.es: Señora Cándida, soltera de 63 años se dedica al destace de cerdo en su domicilio además vende derivados del mismo como es chicharrón y frito de carne, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 20 años y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cerdo por pies, de esta manera la socia obtendrá mayores beneficios para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Candida is 63 years old, single, and butchers pigs.  She also sells derivatives, such as fried pork rinds, and fried pork out of her home.  She’s been doing this for 20 years and is asking for this loan to buy pigs on the hoof.  This way she will be able to increase the benefit to herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gilly

texts.en:
Gilly's husband works as a hired stenographer and she supports him by taking responsibility with all household chores. She gets up early and has to prepare everything for the family and oversee the tenants of the piggery they own.

Gilly is requesting this loan to finance her children's education.  In the future, she wants to provide a better living for her children.  She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to finance her children's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her pub.

loans.name: Rosinie

texts.en:
Rosinie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Rosinie has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Rosinie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, abastecerá el negocio para la época de invierno, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar leña por mayoreo y concentrado para los pollos, que luego revenderá a sus clientes, con las ganancias fortalecerá un poco más el negocio y cumplirá con sus compromisos económicos.
El financiamiento anterior le proporciono los recursos económicos con los que incremento su negocio y tuvo el alimento que necesitaba para sus aves de corral. En la familia todo marcha positivamente.
texts.en:
Maria is stocking her business for the winter and is asking for a new loan to buy firewood in quantity and feed for her chickens, which she will later sell to her customers.  She will use her profits to strengthen her business a bit and meet her financial commitments.

The previous loan provided her with financial resources with which she grew her business and she had the feed she needed for her birds.  Everything is well with her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood and feed.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
María, opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar plátano verde y leña por mayoreo también cemento, ahorrándose un poco en la compra sus ganancias serán mejores y mantendrá a sus clientes muy satisfechos, hará algunas reparaciones a su vivienda.
El efecto que ha tenido del crédito anterior es positivo pues su negocio ha crecido, aunque en sus ingresos hubo variaciones logro cancelar de buena manera su deuda y cubrir las necesidades básicas de la familia.
texts.en:
María is seeking a new loan to buy green plantains and firewood wholesale, and also cement. If she saves a little on the purchase, her profits will improve and she will keep her customers happy. She will make some repairs to her home. 

The effects of the previous loan have been positive. Her business has grown, and even though there were some ups and downs in her income, she managed to pay off her previous loan well and cover the basic necessities of the family.

loans.use: To buy green plantains and firewood wholesale, and also cement.

loans.name: Diego Segundo

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre muy diligente y activo. Padre de dos hijos menores y con visión emprendedora.
El trabaja todos los días alternando su oficio de agricultor con el manejo de un café internet que ha logrado consolidar con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. 
El solicita un préstamo para comprar un equipo de computo y comprar insumos para la preparación de la tierra como abonos y riegos con los que podrá aumentar sus 
Su esposa es ama de casa y en ocasiones le ayuda en sus labores.
El sueña con tener un local propio para tener más utilidades y desea también tener la posibilidad de tener unos grandes lotes de tierra con distintos cultivos.
texts.en:
Diego is a very diligent and active man.  He is the father of two young children and has an entrepreneurial vision.  He alternates his daily activities between farming and managing an internet café that he managed to set up with great effort and dedication.

He is asking for this loan to buy computer equipment and farming supplies, such as compost, to prepare the land, and irrigation so he can increase his crops.

His wife is a housewife and sometimes helps with his work.

He dreams of having a shop and also some large plots of land with different types of crops.

loans.use: to buy computers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase video game devices and accessories and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, fungicides to assist in growing coffee crops.

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta 7° grado,  sus padres no podían darle los estudios como él quería así que se dedicó a trabajar en la agricultura, actualmente está casado y con su esposa no ha procreado ningún hijo, ella se dedica a realizar los oficios del hogar mientras él trabaja en el campo, aprendió el oficio de la agricultura de sus padres desde que él era un niño y de un tío aprendió el trabajo de carpintería pero no lo ejerce debido a que este oficio no es muy reconocido en la zona en donde habita.
	
Él se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez,  ya que sus padres le enseñaron este oficio, también trabaja como carpintero pero eventualmente,  este rubro no lo ejerce con regularidad. Lo que más trabaja es la agricultura, ya que vio que este rubro le daba los ingresos necesarios para darle el sustento a su familia, su trabajo le queda a 20 minutos a pie desde su casa hasta el terreno donde cultiva el maíz y frijol los cuales le sirven para que su familia tenga el alimento a tiempo todos los días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono, herbicidas, pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultiva,  ya que no posee un inmueble propio para hacerlo cancelara la mano de obra de las personas que le ayudan a cultivar, para tener el grano a tiempo en su hogar.

Él tendrá un margen de ganancia ya que comprando todo de una sola vez le saldrá más barato y el traslado a su vivienda será más barato que comprándolo por partes sale más caro, teniendo el producto en su casa podrá cultivar y aplicar los fertilizantes a tiempo a su cultivo y así tener una buena producción de granos para el sustento de su familia.

Él quiere para su futuro construir su propia vivienda para darle a su familia una mejor condición de vida, desea procrear con su esposa hijos y verlos crecer, enseñarles a ellos a realizar los trabajos de la agricultura para que ellos puedan conocer este oficio y darles el estudio que a él le fue negado por la falta de recursos económicos de sus padres.  Desea tener una producción de maíz y frijol muy buena y así darle a su familia los granos para su consumo, además de su cosecha  desea vender una parte para ir realizando sus sueños poco a poco que es construir su casa.
texts.en:
Pedro is 22 years old and has a 7th grade education.  His parents were not able to provide him with an education like he wanted so he decided to work in agriculture.  He is currently married and he and his wife don’t have any children.  She is a housewife and he works in the fields.  He learned to farm from his parents when he was a boy and he learned to do carpentry work from one of his uncles, but he does not do this kind of work because it’s not very well known in the area where he lives.

He has been farming since he was a child and his parents taught him this trade.  He also works as a carpenter but not steadily.  He mainly farms because this trade provides him with the income he needs to support his family.  He is a 20 minute walk from his fields, where he raises corn and beans which provide daily food for his family.

He is asking for this loan, through CREDICAMPO, to buy compost, herbicide, and pay rent on the farmland since he doesn’t own it.  He will pay for labor to help gather the harvest so he can have the grains home in time.

He will have a profit margin because it will be less expensive for him to buy everything at once and transporting the goods to his home will also be less expensive than doing it a little at a time.  By having the supplies at his home, he will be able to apply the fertilizers on time and have a good production of grains to support his family.

In the future he wants to build a home of his own so that he can provide better living conditions for his family.  He wants to have children and watch them grow, teach them to farm so that they can know this trade, and provide them the education that he was denied due to a lack of financial resources from his parents.  He wants to have a good production of corn and beans and provide grains with which to feed his family and sell some so that he can achieve his dream of building a house a little at a time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: La señora Olivia tiene 29 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 5,9 y 10 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa  al por mayor y menor ella tiene su puesto de venta en una  populosa feria de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Olivia,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa al por mayor como se acerca la temporada de invierno comprara chamarras y chompas su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Olivia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la feria muchas personas se dedican a la venta de ropa y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Olivia is 29 years old, has three children ages 5, 9, and 10 years old. She sells clothing at wholesale and retail. She has a stand in a popular market in Santa Cruz city.  This loan is her first with the institution. Olivia is going to use the loan to buy winter clothing at wholesale as winter is approaching, she will buy jackets and sweaters. Her reason to ask for a loan is to increase her merchandise. Olivia's challenge in her business is the competition because in the market many people sell clothing and she is going to use the benefits in continuing to buy merchandise and in this way generate more income. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity to grow her business, improve her income and subsequently her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing such as jackets and sweaters.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa tiene 41 años de edad y reside en casa propia junto a su hijo de 13 años de edad dado que su esposo hace algunos años emigro al extranjero en busca de mejores condiciones de vida. Rosa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien cada día busca como sacar adelante a su hijo puesto que lo que recibe de su esposo no logra cubrir los gastos del hogar. Rosa desea reparar el techo de la cocina ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo de la cocina lo antes posible.
texts.en: Rosa is 41 years old and lives in a home of her own with her 13 year old son.  Her husband emigrated a few years ago, in search of a better life.  Rosa has been making and selling pupusas for a long time.  She is an enterprising woman who looks for ways to get her son ahead each day, because what she gets from her husband is not enough to cover the household expenses.  Rosa wants to repair the roof over the kitchen because it has deteriorated, so she is asking for a loan, through FUSAI, to buy galvanized metal, lumber, and nails to repair the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to repair her roof.

loans.name: Serfina

texts.en:
Serfina is a 55-year-old lady from the Kisumu region which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is a widow, and she supports three people in her family. She has three children who are ages six, four and 15 years old respectively.

She sells fish. Her business has been operating for the last 15 years, and she makes a monthly income of KE 20,000. She is taking her fifth loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more cereals. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more assorted cereals

loans.name: Jose Rodolfo

texts.es:
José, solicita más capital para invertirlo en la compra de abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mozos, prepara el terreno para realizar el cultivo de granos básicos.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar la producción y tener la cosecha de granos básicos en el tiempo justo para abastecer a su familia y ponerlo a la venta lo más pronto posible, le ha dado los ingresos que necesita para que su familia tenga un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: José seeks a loan to buy manure, pesticides, herbicides, and hire labor to prepare the land where he will grow his basic grains. The previous loan permitted him to increase his production and harvest his grains in a timely fashion to support his family and sell the product as soon as possible, giving him the income he needs so that his family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticides, herbicides, and hire labor.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa, ha tenido buenos resultados de la inversión anterior en su negocio las ventas e ingresos aumentaron, pues ha seguido trabajando sin dificultades porque ha tenido la materia prima necesaria para hacerlo, su familia tiene una vida más confortable y ha incorporado la venta de comida.
EL capital que solicita le servirá para comprar mariscos, verduras, frutas, carnes, pollo, arroz, frijoles, leña, gas propano, maíz y aceite, de esa manera el negocio se mantendrá funcionando y dándole las ganancias esperadas.
texts.en: Rosa has had good results with her previous loan. Her sales and income have increased. She has continue working without difficulty because she has had the ingredients necessary to make her products. Her family is living a more comfortable life and has incorporated selling food. The loan will be used to buy seafood, vegetables, fruit, meat, chicken, rice, beans, firewood, propane gas, corn, and oil, and in this way her business will continue functioning and providing her the expected income.

loans.use: to buy seafood, vegetables, fruit, meat, chicken, rice, beans, firewood, propane gas, corn, and oil.

loans.name: Geyling De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Son las siete de la mañana, un ambiente fresco y cálido envuelve la pequeña pulpería de Geyling, varios clientes están en la entrada a punto de realizar sus compras matutinas, siempre regresan puesto que confían en la calidad de los productos y la excelente atención que reciben. Ella tiene la edad de 32 años, está soltera y es madre de dos niños. Hace cuatro años inicio su negocio, en el que ha pasado situaciones tanto gratas como difíciles, sin embargo siempre se presenta optimista ante la vida, asegura que su familia es su principal soporte.
Ella solicita el segundo crédito para invertir en la producción de su capital, una de sus metas es formar una distribuidora por lo que requiere comprar productos básicos, así como arroz y frijoles; condimentos, productos lácteos y productos de aseo personal. Geyling está muy agradecida con el primer financiamiento, asegura que ha logrado aumentar su clientela y al mismo tiempo sus ingresos. Es una mujer emprendedora y madre responsable, lucha por el bienestar de sus hijos, su objetivo principal es brindarle un futuro con muchas oportunidades.
texts.en:
It’s 7:00 am and a cool and friendly environment surrounds Geyling’s store.  Several customers are at the entrance, ready to make their purchases.  They always return because they trust in the quality of the products and the excellent customer service they receive.  She is 32 years old, single, and mother of two.  She started her business four years ago and has gone through easy and difficult times, however she has always been optimistic about life and knows that her family is her main support.

She is asking for a second loan to buy basic products such as rice and beans, condiments, dairy products, and toiletries.  One of her goals is to set up a distributorship.  Geyling is very grateful for the first loan and assures us that she has been able to increase her number of customers and income.  She is an enterprising and responsible mother who strives for her children’s wellbeing.  Her main goal is to provide them a future full of opportunities.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: German

texts.es: German, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 8 hijos, reside en un aldea de Protección Santa Bárbara junto a su familia. El lleva 15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, cultiva café, maíz, frijol y en ocasiones cultiva hortalizas. Vende el café en grano al igual que el maíz y frijol. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra y poderle dar buena asistencia a sus cultivos y mejorar la cosecha. Su plan es seguir creciendo con el cultivo y darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: German is 40 years old, married, has 8 children and lives in Protección Santa Bárbara village with his family. He has been farming for 15 years, growing coffee, corn and beans plus occasionally other crops. He sells coffee beans, the same as corn and bean. He is seeking a loan of 25,000 Lempiras  to buy manure, fertilizers, pay labor for growing coffee, corn, and beans to assist with his crops and improve his harvest. His plan is to continue growing his farming and provide the best to his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, pay labor for growing coffee, corn, and beans.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 23-year-old engaged lady, who has worked as a tutor for six years. She also works as a supervisor in a private school during the morning, in order to cover her three other family members' living expenses, since she is their sole breadwinner.

Iman is preparing herself for her wedding; she is working hard to support her beloved fiance in supporting him in everything he pays for their future house. For this reason, and since her income barely covers her family's increasing needs, she is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary housewares, and help her fiance pay for their kitchen's wood work.

This is Iman's second loan from Al Majmoua, her previous loan was requested to pay for her university tuition fees. She hopes to finish her education and graduate to benefit from a better job in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary housewares, and help her fiance pay for their kitchen's wood work

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel, 46 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 22 years. 

She earns a net income of PHP 3,000 daily, and her net is income usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to insufficient fund for their business, she would like to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, milk, diapers, and breads to sell. 

She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, biscuits, milk, diapers, and breads to sell.

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Mme Minata est âgée de 29 ans, 3 enfants et vit avec son époux dans une famille polygame dans le quartier  de Djicoroni à Bamako dans la famille de son mari. 
Du a des problèmes de famille, elle a prématurément abandonné l’école et s’intéresser aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son enfance. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle s’est basée sur  la vente de nourritures qu’elle a  apprise auprès de sa mère il y a 15 ans. Sa notoriété est bonne, car sa  nourriture est la plus prisée au quartier du fleuve. Pour pouvoir  augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, elle  décide de rejoindre  l‘institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier  prêt. Avec ce financement, elle compte s’approvisionner au marché en achetant (1sac de pomme de terre, 3 paquets de spaghetti, 1corbeille de tomate)  auprès des  vendeuses de condiments. Mme Minata  effectue sa vente de nourritures au  Dibida à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes  au comptant et à crédit. Avec ce financement elle compte  réaliser un profit de 40 000FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera  pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire les besoins  de sa  famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Minata is 29 years old.  She has three children and lives with her husband in his polygamous family in the Djicoroni neighborhood of Bamako.  Because of unfortunate family circumstances, she dropped out of school when she was still very young and she has been involved in income-generating activities ever since.  She tried several activities without much success before starting to sell food, an activity she learned 15 years ago from her mother.  Minata is well known because she cooks the best food in her neighborhood.  In order to increase her business and boost her sales capacity, she has decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and this is her first loan.  She is planning to use this loan to buy new stocks of merchandise (one bag of potatoes, three packets of spaghetti and one basket of tomatoes) from condiments sellers at the market.  Minata resells her food in Dibida.  Her customer base consists of both men and women and they pay her in cash or on credit. Thanks to this loan, she is expecting to make a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs which will be used to repay the loan's interest to Soro Yiriwaso, meet her family's needs and reinvest the rest of the money in her business.

loans.use: to buy food (potatoes, spaghetti, tomatoes) for the preparation of dishes.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene 45 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 5, 9 y 10 años,  el se dedica a la venta  de comida y almuerzo este negocio lo realiza junto a su esposa tiene su puesto de venta en la zona de Plan 3000 de la ciudad de santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución,  El señor Juan va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para  su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  El señor Juan necesita esto para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes que en ocasiones comen parados, El señor Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que  tiene que levantarse muy temprano cuando hace  frio para ayudar a su esposa preparar su comida,  que es propensa a agarrar reumatismo el cual es muy frecuente en personas con esa actividad,  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar insumos y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio su deseo  para su negocio es el de tener una pensión de comida variada más grande donde pueda vender más y mejor y poder superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old and has three children ages 5, 9 and 10. His occupation is the sale of food and lunches. He works with his wife and has a stall in the Plan 3000 area of the city of Santa Cruz. This is his first loan with this institution. Juan will use the loan to buy tables and chairs for his business. His reason for requesting the loan is that he needs these items to provide a more comfortable setting to his customers, as sometimes they eat while standing. 

Juan faces several challenges in his business, such as having to get up very early when it is cold to help his wife prepare the food. His wife has propensity to develop rheumatism, which is very frequent among people in similar occupations. He will use his profits to buy supplies and to offer his customers a good service. His desire for his business is to have a larger place with more varied food, where he could sell more and in that way get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosalia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fermented duck eggs. Rosalia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, canned goods, sugar, soap, shampoo, noodles and other groceries for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Danila

texts.en: Danila has been 12 years in helping her husband with their service-based business providing repairs and maintenance. Her perseverance grows stronger for the sake of her growing children. For that, she applied for a loan at GDMPC microcredit for additional working capital to obtain a vulcanizing machine needed in her shop. In the future, she aims to expand her business.

loans.use: to obtain a vulcanizing machine for her business

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of eight children, Solidad works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rootcrops. Solidad is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Solidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Dy is a 40-year-old married mother of four children. Fishing has been the main source of her family’s income for 11 years and to better support the family and help to earn more income, her husband works as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 25,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs, and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Dy has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fishing materials for supporting her business. She hopes to catch more fish so as to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Unidos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es: Irma tiene 65 años de edad  es viuda con hijos independientes. Ella  se dedica a la venta de queso y al tejido hace muchos años. Pertenecer al grupo “UNIDOS POR EL PROGRESO” le ha permitido obtener su capital de trabajo.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más queso y lanas para realizar sus tejidos. Ella se siente muy satisfecha de poder generar sus ingresos económicos a sus 65 años de edad. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Irma es la primera persona sentada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Irma is a 65-year-old widow with grown children. She has been selling cheese and fabric for many years.

Belonging to the group "UNITED FOR PROGRESS" has allowed her to obtain working capital. The loan will be used to buy more cheese and wool to make her fabrics.

She is very pleased to be able to generate income at 65 years old. The group thanks the KIVA investors for the loan. Irma is the first person sitting on the left side.

loans.use: to buy more cheese and wool for fabric.

loans.name: Alasgar

texts.en:
Alasgar and his wife have been married for 26 years and have two children. Both of them graduated from university and their daughter is married.  His family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their home, which was in Lachin city and now live in the Abseron region. Alasgar’s wife is a housewife, therefore Alasgar provides all the needs of the family. 

Alasgar is a master: he sticks wallpaper, makes putty, plaster, etc. He has been in this business for over 10 years and the quality of the work is good, therefore he has a lot of customers. Today he wants additional support for his business. Alasgar has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,300 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) to repair his construction apparatus. 

Alasgar gives great thanks to Kiva and all the lenders for their help. In the future he wants to hire an assistant to increase his business.

loans.use: to repair his construction apparatus.

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es:
Antolina es una mujer muy carismática y trabajadora, con mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de venta de frutas, ella trabaja alrededor de 9  horas a día ya que con los ingresos que obtiene  puede salir salir adelante y sobre todo poder solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Antolina esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar comprar mas mercadería para su negocio de fruta y implemento para su negocio como bolsas, balanza, entre otros y de esta manera seguir esforzándose y luchando por hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Antolina is a charismatic and hardworking woman who set up her fruit business with great effort.  She works about nine hours a day because it provides her the income she needs to get ahead and cover the household expenses.

Antolina is grateful to the Kiva lenders because she was able to buy more merchandise for her fruit business, thanks to their help.  She also started selling bags, scales, and other things.  This allows her to continue working toward achieving her dream of having a larger business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Loren

texts.en:
Loren is 45 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Loren runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Loren has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, body soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, rice, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in the Nyamira area of South Rift Kenya with her child. She has taken up farming for the past 3 years and her primary source of income is milk, eggs,  and a variety of crops, She has also a retail business. She stated that in farming, she loves poultry and dairy farming the most, but her major challenge is diseases affecting livestock.

Lilian chose this KIVA loan because she wants to boost her dairy farm by buying a dairy cow which will produce milk and this will increase her income and thus improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa, necesita un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones zippers, broches e insumos agrícolas para la milpa, ya que se acerca la temporada indicada para sembrar y equipara su sastrería con accesorios que necesita para finalizar sus trabajos.
Con el crédito anterior se mantuvo trabajando sin tener que hacer compras extras del material de costura, su cosecha estuvo libre de plagas, fue abundante y su situación económica le permite salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa needs a new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, snaps and farming supplies, now that the planting season is approaching.  She also wants to equip her tailor shop with the accessories she needs to finalize her jobs.

The previous loan allowed her to work without making additional purchases.  Her crops were free from disease and her financial situation was enough to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy tailoring and farming supplies.

loans.name: Enn's Group

texts.en:
Enn is 60 years old and widowed. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has no kid. She has been farming rice for 11 years. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs but she can save about 40,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

This is the third micro loan for Enn with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Saraem will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition and buy a new bicycle for her son.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of toys and other products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of toys and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Celia still dreams of gaining more profit from her business and hopes to always provide her family's everyday needs. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy different products, such as toys and gift items, to sell in her gift shop.

loans.name: Wilber Geovany

texts.es:
Wilber, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos, tiene 31 años de edad, su estado civil es acompañado, todos dependen económicamente de él, su actividad económica es la agricultura y la ganadería, cultiva granos básicos (maíz y frijol) para consumo familiar y para vender, también vende leña, es un oficio que aprendió desde niño a lado de su padre.
Invertirá en la compra de una vaca parida, está acción le permitirá tener lácteos para  mejorar la alimentación de su familia y comercializarlos. Espera incrementar poco a poco el ganado que posee y así tener ingresos extras.
Su sueño es fortalecer el negocio, cancelar la deuda adquirida y ofrecer un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilber lives with his wife and three children.  He is 31 years of age, married, and his family is financially dependent on him.

His livelihood is agriculture and livestock.  He grows basic grains (corn and beans) for his family to eat and to sell.  He also sells firewood.  This is a trade he learned as a child alongside her father.

Investing in a calving cow is an action that will allow him to improve feeding his family and his business. He expects to increase gradually his herd and thus have extra income.

His dream is to strengthen the business, pay back the loan and provide a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy a calving cow.

loans.name: Om –Mostafa Group

texts.en:
Om-Mostafa is a group which consists of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They requested a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB.

Dawla is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old married woman, living with her family in their own house. Their house is very small and it needs to expand. Dawla works as a dressmaker inside her house. The income of this business is very low and most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family. Unfortunately, the house where she lives is very small. For this reason, Dawla applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials like cement and bricks in order to expand the house.

Dawla hopes to build the second floor and rent out the first. She hopes to provide her family with a lot of money. Also, she hopes to expand her business more.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like cement and bricks in order to expand the house.

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en:
Pashke’s husband, Nikoll, has been having health problems for a long time now. He’s been suffering from stomach and pancreas issues. Nikoll has planned to go for a thorough health checkup soon. Both have been photographed with their youngest grandchild, Denis. They are parents of six children.

Agriculture and animal husbandry have been the activities that they have pursued for so long. They plant and sell corn and wheat and have pigs and chickens and sell piglets and hens and also fresh organic eggs in the market. In addition to all of these, they own five dynyms of agricultural land planted with olives, thus, they sell organic olive oil as well.

Almost every household in their village works with agriculture and livestock and this is their only source of income.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's health checkups.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe SABALY sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles à MANCOURANI NATIEN un des quartiers populaire dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame AWA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes SABALY, fait la vente d’orange. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  des chargements de charrettes en orange au grand marché,  pour les revendre au détail sur place et à MANCOURANI NATIEN à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Sabaly group are married women who on average are 42 years old with five children. They live in traditional families in Mancourani Natien, one of the populous neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their fifth group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, to meet the needs of their customers.

Mrs. AWA, standing first from left to right in this photo of women in the Sabaly group, sells oranges. She intends to use her loan to buy cartloads of oranges at the grand market, to be sold retail on-site and in Mancourani Natien, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 27,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay the loan and its interest, and the rest put into savings.

loans.use: buy oranges

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is managing a clothing business in their public market. She sells various types of clothes like blouses, shirts, and pants. Through her income, she is able to provide for her children's daily expenditures in school. With her aspiration of taking all her children through college and them becoming employed, Marites works hard and is willing to adopt and improve her dealings to gain more regular customers. 

Marites wants to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy different clothes to sell in her stall. She is doing her best so that her business will grow and not sink.

loans.use: to buy different clothes to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes for all ages, male and female. She sells clothes, all size for all ages. She will buy 12 bales of clothes and pay her aunt during the month to take care of the business.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a married woman with four kids, three whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kabibi operates a stall selling vegetables, which she runs at the market selling to town dwellers and neighbors. One of the main challenges she faces is the high cost of transportation to the market. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shillings loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Fougnegue 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   FOUGNEGUE 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à ZIANGOLODOUGOU un village dans le cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le sorgho  avec  FATOUMATA debout au milieu.sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de 50 kg d’engrais et 25 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, et à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  85 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members in the Fougnegue 1 group are married women who on average are 42 years old with five children, for the most part living in traditional families in Ziangolodougou in the Kadiolo circle, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and all past loans have been fully repaid.

The crop grown by the group is sorghum. Fatoumata, who is standing in the middle in this group photo of women, will use her ​​loan to buy a 50-kilo bag of fertilizer and 25 kilos of fertilizer, one can of herbicide, and pay labor costs to maintain 0.75 hectares (approximately 2 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold in the village and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit .

She hopes to attain average profits of 85,000 CFA francs per growing season. These profits will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenditures.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, soil amendments and seeds, and pay tillage costs

loans.name: Fougnegue 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  FOUGNEGUE 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à ZIANGOLODOUGOU un village dans le cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame AFOU assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter un sac de 50 kg d’engrais et 25 kg d’engrais, 1 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  85 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members in the Fougnegue 2 group are married women who on average are 37 years old with five children. For the most part they live in traditional families in the village of Ziangolodougou in the Kadiolo area, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and all past loans have been fully repaid.

The crop grown by the group is groundnuts. Afou, who is the first person sitting from right to left in this group photo of women, will use her ​​loan to buy a 50-kilo bag of fertilizer and 25 kilos of fertilizer, one can of herbicide, and pay for labor costs to maintain 0.5 hectares (approximately 1.25 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold in the village and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She hopes to attain average profits of 85,000 CFA francs per growing season. These profits will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenditures.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide and seeds, and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Fougnegue 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  FOUGNEGUE 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à ZIANGOLODOUGOU un village dans le cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec madame MINATA AMADOU débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, et SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  108 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members in the Fougnegue 3 group are married women who on average are 37 years old with five children. For the most part they live in traditional families in the village of Ziangolodougou in the Kadiolo area, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and all past loans have been fully repaid.

The crop grown by the group is millet. Minata Amadou, who is standing in the second position from right to left in this group photo of women, will use her ​​loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, two cans of herbicide, and pay labor costs to maintain 0.75 hectares (approximately 2 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold in the village and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit .

She hopes to attain average profits of 108,000 CFA francs per growing season. These profits will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and also help her husband with the family's daily expenditures.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide and seeds, and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 44 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are studying. She is a vegetable vendor and her spouse makes cabinets, tables and chairs. 

Milagros would like to develop their furniture making business and that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy more wood for furniture.

Milagros and her husband want to increase good output and satisfy all their customers' needs for high quality furniture. This will help to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy wood for a furniture making business

loans.name: Femmes Leaders Ix Group

texts.fr: le groupement femmes leaders IX est composé de 7 femmes et 3 hommes qui habitent tous dans le même quartier et qui font tous la meme activité. Il se regroupement chaque fin de mois et organisent des tontines pour mieux s'organiser et tenir leur destin en main. La présidente s'appelle FAMA, c'est la deuxième personne de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des fruits et légumes et demande ce montant pour acheter et vendre des fruits et légumes comme les oranges, bananes, les choux, carottes etc..Elle a une expérience de plus de 6ans et aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle souhaite ouvrir une boutique dans son quartier et y pratiquer la vente de l'alimentation générale. Ainsi elle pourra diversifier ses produits et augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l'argent à coté.
texts.en:
The Women Leaders IX group consists of seven women and three men who all live in the same neighborhood and all perform similar activities. The group meets at the end of every month and organizes tontines (savings group) to better organize and take charge of their destiny.

Fama is the group president, and  is the second person  from right to left in the photo. She is active in trading fruit and vegetables and is requesting the loan to buy fruit and vegetables for resale, like oranges, bananas, cabbages, carrots, etc.

She has over six years' experience and helps her husband in managing family expenses and her children's tuition fees. She wants to open a general grocery store in the neighborhood, so she can diversify her products, increase revenues, and put money into savings.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables and general merchandise for resale

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Thim is a 33-year-old married woman who resides in the region of Bakan district, Pursat province. She has worked in the fields with her parents since she was a very young age. Thim now has more than 1.5 hectare of farmland where she produces rice in the rainy season. Thim wants to own additional land for farming, so she needs to save enough money to buy in the next few years. This will enable her to increase her production rate and improve their income.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Thim is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school, and one is still young. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Elizabeth dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings), she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Amefil

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Amefil works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling personal products business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Amefil is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional personal products to sell.

Amefil has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional personal products to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita wants to use this loan to buy posts for her vineyards. 
Margarita is married and is a 47-year-old mother of five children with the youngest one being 9 years old.  Growing grapes, apples, cherries, peaches and pears is where she generates most of her family’s income. About two years back, Margarita broke her leg; although, she had three surgeries, the leg did not heal well and she still has difficulty walking and is in constant pain.
The village where Margarita and her family reside was a swamp a long time ago; during communist times, volunteers turned it into a fertile farming area where villagers mostly plant orchards and grapevines; but they plant seasonal veggies as well and keep all kind of animals such as cows, sheep and goats.

loans.use: to buy posts for her vineyards

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in the fertile area of the Nyamira area of South Rift, Kenya, with her husband and three children, all of school-going age. She has been doing farming for the past eight years, with her primary source of income being milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She stated what she enjoys the most from farming is the income she gets from dairy farming.

She says that this Kiva loan will help her construct a dairy unit, which will cater for her dairy cows by giving them a better environment for feeding so that they can be more productive, and hence, lead to more income. This will enable her to sustain her family better.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy unit.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en: Tojiniso is a repeat client of IMON. She has been running a clothing sales business for more than 20 years. Tojiniso sells women clothes. She began her business with a small amount of capital 20 years ago and little by little grew her business. Now, she is an experienced businesswoman. Tojiniso is divorced and is now a single mother of one child. She needs a loan because she is going to renew the assortment of her goods for the new summer season. She is asking for a loan of 7000 Somoni to buy women clothes. She hopes that this loan will help her to develop her business and maximize profits. She awaits your contribution to her loan.

loans.use: To buy women clothes to sell in the new summer season

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud, pictured in the photo, is a 22-year-old single young man from a little village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.

Mahmoud is a student at a local university where he is studying Finance. He would like to get a BA degree and find a good job in the future so he can help his family. Therefore he has taken out a USD 1,000 loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking out this loan, Mahmoud will be able to do his homework and write reports.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 32-year-old mother from Siaya County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is a widow and she supports three people in the family with three children aged 20, 12 and 10.

She has a retail shop which she has been operating for the last four years, and she makes a monthly income of KES 9,000. She is taking out her 3rd loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and soap for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to increase her stock.

Her dream is to educate her children and to increase stock.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, bars of soap and other shop items for sale.

loans.name: An-An

texts.en:
An-an is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. An-an is 27 years old and has two children who are in school.

An-an has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

An-an has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, An-an would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has five children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, the family lives in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fresh water selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours. she faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during rainy season the business is slow. 

With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase a water tank and install a water tap at her workplace. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and install a water tap at her workplace

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha greatly appreciates the Kiva lenders for supporting her financially. Besides her fruits and vegetable selling business, Mwanasha operates a shop kiosk.

She is requesting a loan to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, and beans for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, cooking oil, and beans for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: Ambrocio

texts.en:
Ambrocio previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Ambrocio still dreams of having more jeepneys and hopes to have an established business that will support his children until they finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Gulnoz

texts.en:
Gulnoz is 30 years old and a hardworking woman.  She is married and brings up three children. They live in the house she has succeeded in building thanks to her great dedication.

She is one of the successful businesswomen of her town. For more than seven years, she has been busy selling women's underwear. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop the business and in this way, improve her living condition. She wants to develop her business further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to buy women's underwear to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy women's underwear to sell

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 46-year-old married father of four children, three of whom are enrolled in a public school while his precious-seven-year-old daughter is registered in a private school.

Youssef has been employed in a water distribution company for nine years. His income isn't enough to cover his increasing living needs. For this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his daughter's increasing tuition fees.

Youssef hopes to establish his own business in the future to make sure he can provide his family with a brighter future.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's school tuition fees

loans.name: Junneve

texts.en: Junneve is a 35-year-old mom with one child. For a living, she helps her husband manages a farm, planting and harvesting rice to sell and for the family's consumption. In order to buy seedlings and manure fertilizer, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit of which she became a member recently. She hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to generate additional income to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and manure fertilizer

loans.name: Eligio

texts.en:
Eligio previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help with the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their Jeepney. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Eligio dreams of having and sustaining a better living to provide his family and hopes his business progresses. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. It's where he can draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and maintain his jeep.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, desea seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura y opta por un nuevo crédito que con el comprara abono, pesticidas, herbicidas, semilla y pago de mozos, limpiara el terreno, protegerá el cultivo de plagas, cubrirá las necesidades de su familia y sus clientes tendrán sus encargos justo a tiempo.
Con el préstamo anterior su cosecha fue abundante, sin problemas de plagas, sus ventas han tenido un leve aumento lo que le da más ganancias con las que cancelo las cuotas del préstamo y mejorado las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Carlos hopes to continue investing in agriculture and has requested a new loan with which he will purchase compost, pesticides, herbicides and seeds; and with which he will hire field laborers. They will clear the land and protect the crops from pests. This will cover his family's needs and ensure that his clients have their products on time. 

With the last loan, the harvest was abundant and free of any problems with pests. His sales have gone slightly up, which has given him greater earnings with which he made the payments on the loan and improved his family's circumstances.

loans.use: to purchase compost, pesticides, herbicides, seeds and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Taish Al-Hayona Group

texts.en:
This group is called Taish Al-Hayona. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 220,000 YER from AMB. 

Asia is a 30-year-old married woman living with her spouse in their own house. She is the leader of the group. She is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. She is very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Their house is without windows and doors. This makes the rain and winds enter the house easily. This brings sickness to the family. Also, the house needs renovation on the inside. As a result, Asia is requesting a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase windows and doors for her house.

Asia's dream in the future is building more floors and renovating them.

loans.use: to purchase windows and doors for her house.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Beatriz es cliente antigua de la institución, sigue la misma actividad de la Venta de ropa y calzados, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de mercadería, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados al por mayor,  ya que creció en su actividad,   se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Beatriz is an old client of the institution and she continues to sell clothing and shoes.  She says her previous loan went very well and was used to buy merchandise.

On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy shoes wholesale because business has increased.  She is content and grateful for the support Kiva lenders are giving her.

loans.use: To buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Jeronimo

texts.es: Jeronimo se dedica a la crianza de pollos, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimentos como concentrados y vitaminas, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Jeronimo raises chickens for a living.  He is a responsible person who was invited to join the "Tres Cruces de Oro" communal bank.  On this occasion, he needs a loan to buy animal feed and vitamins.  He is grateful for the loan which he truly values and is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jose Eliud

texts.es: José tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos, reside en el municipio de Protección, Santa Bárbara con su familia. hace 10 años tiene sus propios cultivos de café, maíz y frijol, esta producción la vende en grano en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que ha solicitado es el segundo ciclo y es por 15,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar abonos, fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café y cultivo de granos básicos. Su plan es mejorar la producción y seguir trabajando día a día para ver a su familia con salud y tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Jose, 32, lives with his wife and three children in the town of Protección, Santa Bárbara.  He has been cultivating coffee, corn and beans for ten years.  He sells his produce at the local market in the area.

This loan, in the amount of 15,000 HNL, is his second and it will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for maintenance of his coffee plantation and to grow basic grains.  His plan is to improve production and continue working day to day for his family's health and to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: To buy compost and fertilizers for coffee crop maintenance and to grow basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase ceiling wooden support poles.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a 70-years-old lady from Katito region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is a married woman who supports three people in the family and has three children who are six, four and one years old, respectively.

She sells cereals, a business she has been operating for the last four years. She makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking her third loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more cereals. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with three children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso De La Zona B Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso De La Zona B” y está conformada por 05 mujeres entusiastas decididas  a comenzar a trabajar. Jenny de 35 años de edad  es soltera. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de repostería así como tortas para cumpleaños. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Jenny ha logrado brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hogar. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de harina, azúcar y mantequilla. El deseo de Jenny es contar con una tienda fuente de soda. El nuevo grupo “Esperanza Y Progreso De La Zona B” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Jenny se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la tercera del lado derecho y viste polo marrón.
texts.en:
This is the new communal bank "Esperanza y Progreso de la Zona B" and it is comprised of five enthusiastic women who are determined to begin working.  Jenny is 35 and single.  She makes and sells bakery products such as birthday cakes.  With much effort and dedication Jenny has been able to improve her household's quality of life.  She will use the loan to buy flour, sugar and butter.  Her dream is to open a soda fountain.  

The "Esperanza y Progreso de la Zona B" Group is grateful to all the people who have made this loan possible.  Jenny is standing in the back in a brown top.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and butter.

loans.name: Jose Ursulo

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa, no tiene hijos, su negocio es la comercialización de ganado y la agricultura, lo realiza desde hace 20 años, trabaja todos los días de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, esté oficio se lo enseño su padre.
El financiamiento será de mucha utilidad para fortalecer su negocio y mejorar su situación económica, comprara una vaquilla, abono, plaguicidas, fertilizantes, insecticidas, protegerá su cultivo y mejorara la producción de granos básicos.
Su deseo es seguir trabajando para lograr tener una mejor vida junto a su compañera de vida.
texts.en:
Jose lives with his wife and they have no children.  He is in the cattle and agriculture business and has worked in this sector for 20 years.  He works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and he learned the trade from his father.

The loan will be very help in strengthening his business and improving his economic situation.  He will buy a calf, compost, insecticides and fertilizers.  These will protect his crop and improve basic grain production.

His goal is to continue to work and enjoy a better lifestyle with his wife.

loans.use: To buy a calf, compost, insecticide, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fougnegue 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe  FOUGNEGUE 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à ZIANGOLODOUGOU un village dans le cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali.
