Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame NABINTOU assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The FOUGNEGUE 4 group consists of seven married women who are, on average, 28 years old with two children each.  Most of these women live in traditional families in Ziangolodougou, a village located in the cercle of Kadiolo, Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

The members of the group have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to bring their farming activities to a successful conclusion during the rainy season.

This is the group's fourth loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and all previous loans have been duly repaid.

Nabintou, a member of the group, is a groundnut farmer.  In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the left.  She is planning to use her loan to buy a 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one can of herbicide, and to pay for the cost of labor to cultivate 0.25 hectare of land.

After the harvest, Nabintou sells her crop in her village and at the Sikasso markets.  She sells for cash or on credit to both men and women.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA francs per farming season.  This profit will allow her, in part, to repay her loan and the interest, and also to help her husband with the family day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicide, seeds, and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Fougnegue 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe  FOUGNEGUE 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 22 ans et ont en moyenne 1 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à ZIANGOLODOUGOU un village dans le cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec madame  CHITAN  débout à la troisième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais et 25 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, et SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  85 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Fougnegue 5 Group are all married women who are, on average, 22 years old and have one child.  Most of them live in traditional families in the village of Ziangolodougou, Kadiolo district of the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

The women want to improve their agricultural businesses during the rainy season, so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their fourth group loan, the previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Chitan (standing third from the left in the photo) grows peanuts.  She plans to use her loan to buy 75 kg of fertilizer, a drum of herbicide and pay for the labour needed to work half a hectare of land.  After harvesting, the peanuts are sold in the village and in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash or on credit.

Chitan expects to earn an average of 85,000 francs CFA each growing season, which will be used to repay her loan and interest, and to help her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, seeds and pay for agricultural labour.

loans.name: Soutoura 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   SOUTOURA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à SIEKOURANI  un village dans la commune rurale de LOULOUNI  cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs  avec madame ROKIA  débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SIEKOURANI I. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  108 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Soutoura 1 Group are all married women who are, on average 44 years old and have three children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the village of Siekourani, in the rural commune of Loulouni, Kadiolo district in the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

The women would like to improve their agricultural businesses during the rainy season, so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their eighth loan, the previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Rokia (standing on the far right of the photo) grows maize.  She plans to use her loan to buy two 50 kg sacks of fertilizer, two drums of herbicide and pay the labour costs to work half a hectare of land.  After harvesting, the maize is sold in the village and also at markets in Sikasso, to men and women, for cash or on credit.

Rokia expects to earn an average profit of 108,000 francs CFA over the growing season, which will be used to repay her loan and interest, and help her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, seeds and pay for agricultural labour.

loans.name: Soutoura 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   SOUTOURA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à SIEKOURANI  un village dans la commune rurale de LOULOUNI  cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur ¨huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs  avec madame ZERMENE débout à la dexième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg, 2 bidons d’herbicide et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  108 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d'autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Soutoura 2 Group are all married women who are, on average 37 years old and have three children.  Most of them live in traditional families in the village of Siekourani in the rural commune of Loulouni, Kadiolo district of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

The women want to improve their agricultural businesses during the rainy season, so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their eighth group loan, all the previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.

Zermene (standing second from the right in the photo) grows maize.  She plans to use her loan to buy two 50 kg sacks of fertilizer, two drums of herbicide and pay for the labour to work half a hectare of land.  After harvesting, the maize is sold in the village and at markets in Sikasso, to both men and women, for cash and on credit.

Zermene expects to earn an average profit of 108,000 francs CFA over the growing season, which will be used to repay her loan and interest, and help her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, seeds and pay for agricultural labour costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as zinc sheeting, cement, and more.

loans.name: Angela Veronica

texts.es:
Ángela, compro cerdos con el capital que se le facilito anteriormente, los vendió a un mejor precio, con las ganancias ha mejorado la alimentación, vestuario y salud de su familia, también ha cancelado su deuda.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, será de mucha ayuda está para fortalecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela bought pigs with the capital that was facilitated for her the last time. She sold them at a better price and with the profits has improved her family's food, clothing and health. She also has paid off the debt. 

At this time, she is asking for a new loan to buy pigs and concentrate to feed them. This will be a big help in fortifying her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrate to feed them.

loans.name: Nacira

texts.es: La Señora Nacira sigue con la misma actividad de la confección de ropa, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de una máquina de coser,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de tela por rollo ya que está incrementando su producción ya que entrega a distintas ferias de la ciudad de Santa Cruz  y así seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de kiva ya que con el apoyo que le brindan mejoro su negocio.
texts.en: Nacira continues to do the same activity, making clothes. She says that the previous loan went very well for her, since she used it to buy a sewing machine. At this time, she is asking for the loan to buy rolls of fabric because production is increasing. She is delivering to different markets in the city of  Santa Cruz and this way she can keep improving her business and therefore her income. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their support she improved her business.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina es la venta de productos nutricionales y medicinales nutricionales, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar hierbas y alcohol, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Sabina sells nutritional products and nutritional medicines. She is a responsible person and for this reason she was invited to join the “Tres Cruces de Oro” communal bank. At this time she requires a loan to buy herbs and alcohol. She is grateful for and values the loan and promises to honor the monthly installments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy herbs and alcohol.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es: Fausta tiene 64 años de edad y habita junto a su hija y sus pequeña nieta en casa  de su propiedad. Fausta es una mujer emprendedora quien nos se cansa de trabajar y luchar por sacar adelante a su familia. Fausta se dedica a la venta ropa y venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante dese hace 20 años y  gracias a su carisma y buenos precios que ofrece muchas personas la prefieren cada día más. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de ropa y productos de belleza y poder así satisfacer una mayor demanda que le permita aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Fausta is 64 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter and little granddaughter. Fausta is an enterprising woman who doesn't tire of working and fighting to keep her family moving forward. Fausta works in clothing sales and in catalog sales of beauty products. She has carried out the sales on the street for 20 years and thanks to her charisma and the good prices that she offers, more and more people prefer her every day. 

With the motive of improving her and her family's living conditions, she has decided to apply to FUSAI for this loan in order to invest in her business by buying a variety of clothing and beauty products. This will allow her to satisfy a bigger demand and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing and beauty products  (skirts, blouses, trousers, lotions, make-up, creams, etc.)

loans.name: Las Entusiastas De La 3Ra Etapa De La Era Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía dinámica y responsables es “Las Entusiastas De La 3era Etapa De La Era” conformada por 06 mujeres trabajadoras que pasan a su 9no ciclo.  Olga de 46 años de edad es separada y tiene 01 hijo dependiente. Olga se dedica a la elaboración y venta personalizada de bisutería así como collares.  Se siente feliz pues cada vez aumentan sus clientes. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de agujas, hilos, crochet y palillos. Su mayor deseo es de instalar un espacio donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. El grupo está agradecido con el crédito facilitado  y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Olga es la tercera del lado derecho y viste chompa plomo y pantalón negro.
texts.en: This is the dynamic and responsible bank called “Las Entusiastas De La 3era Etapa De La Era”. It is made up of 6 hardworking women who are in their ninth cycle. Olga is 46 years old. She is separated and has 1 dependent child. Olga works making and selling personalized jewelry, such as necklaces. She is happy because her customers increase every day. Her latest loan will be used to buy needles, thread, and crochet and knitting needles. Her biggest wish is to set up a space where she can offer her products. The group is grateful for the loan and committed to continue working well. Olga is third from the right and is wearing a grey sweater and black pants.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, crochet and knitting needles.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario se dedica a la elaboración de casas y obras de construcción, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como cemento, clavos, yeso y pinturas, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Mario works building houses and doing construction work. He is a responsible person and that is why he was invited to participate in the “Tres Cruces de Oro” communal bank. At this time, he needs the loan to buy work materials such as cement, nails, plaster and paint. He is grateful for and values the loan and is committed to making his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy work materials such as cement, nails, plaster and paint.

loans.name: Edys Matilde

texts.es:
Edys, es propietaria de una mini panadería que nace por la necesidad  de tener más ingresos que cubrieran las necesidades básicas de su familia, trabaja todos los días y lo vende en el mercado, es casada, si esposo tiene 40 años de edad y es mecánico.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de latas, harina, azúcar, aceite, manteca, levadura, bolsas entre otros materiales que son necesarios para elaborar la venta, espera mejorar la producción, vender más producto y mejorar sus ganancias.
Su visión es tener una panadería más grande, mejorar su estilo de vida y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Edys is the owner of a small bread bakery. It was born out of necessity of having more income to cover the basic needs of her family. She works every day and sells in the market. She is married and her husband is a 40 year old mechanic. 

The loan she is asking for will be invested in buying cans, flour, sugar, oil, lard, yeast, bags and other materials necessary for selling. She hopes to improve production, sell more product and improve her profits. Her vision is to have a bigger bakery, improve her life style, and pay off the debt.

loans.use: to buy cans, flour, sugar, oil, lard, yeast, and bags.

loans.name: Luchando Por Un Sueño Group

texts.es: El grupo “LUCHANDO POR UN SUEÑO” es grupo conformado por socias trabajadoras y ansiosas por mejorar su economía familiar. Raída tiene 50 años de edad es casada con  un hijo de 10 años educando. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas alfalfas cereales. Es de esa manera que puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas frutas cereales alfalfas y cereales. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Raída es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
The “LUCHANDO POR UN SUEÑO” group is made up of hard-working members who are anxious to improve their families' economic situation. Raída is 50 years old and married with a 10-year-old son, who is at school. She works selling alfalfa and cereal crops. In this way she is able to support her husband with the family expenses.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of more alfalfa and cereal crops. The group thanks KIVA investors for the offered loan. Raída is the third from the right, dressed in a blue top.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa and cereal crops.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
She is a 21-year-old lady from Siaya region which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports three people in her family.

She sells new clothes, a business she has been doing for the last three years and generates a monthly income of KES 12,000. She has applied for her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya. She will use it to purchase more clothes to sell and will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to have a wholesale shop for clothes and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia se dedica al alquilar de carros y sus trabajadores brinden servicio de transportes, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de los carros, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Florencia works renting cars and her workers offer transportation services. She is a responsible person and that is why she was invited to participate in the  “Tres Cruces de Oro” communal bank. At this time, she needs the loan to do maintenance on the cars. She is grateful for and values the loan and is committed to making her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to do car maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more hair products, weaves and cream to expand her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married and has three kids. Two of her kids still attend school which is the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For the past four years, Juliet has been cooking home-made food which she sells passersby and neighbours. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase two bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase two bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de leche, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento como por ejemplo pastos y concentrados, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Juliana is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is improving her family's situation with her hard work selling milk. Because she is a very responsible person, she was invited to participate in the communal bank "Tres Cruces de Oro". 

She is seeking a loan to buy food such as fodder and concentrated feed for her dairy cows. She is most appreciative and grateful for the loan and promises to be responsible about meeting her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy food such as fodder and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Yeat

texts.en:
Yeat is 34 years old, married and has three dependent children. Yeat works selling fish in a small market of the province, earning enough income for the daily household expenses. Her husband helps share the family’s costs by providing a motor-transportation service locally. 

As of now, Yeat is seeking for a loan of a sum of USD 1,000 to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, and other required materials for farming. This will allow her to generate a satisfactory level of output from her harvest so that she can earn more income. This is the second loan that she is requesting from Hattha Kaksekar and she is very grateful for the opportunity they have given her.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, and other required materials for farming.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro se dedica a la agricultura entonces cultivas verduras como habas, zanahoria, arvejas, papa, repollos, brócoli y otras cosas más, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Leandro makes a living in farming - he grows vegetables such as peas, carrots, chick peas, potatoes, cabbages, broccoli and more. Leandro is a responsible person, which is why he was invited to join the "Tres Cruces de Oro" communal bank. On this occasion Leandro needs a loan in order to buy seeds and manure. Leandro is grateful for a knows the value of this loan. He promises to be responsible as he makes his monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Celia Virginia

texts.es: Virginia es la venta de verduras, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo papas, lechuga, zanahorias, tomates y otras cosas más, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Virginia makes a living selling vegetables. She is very responsible, which is why she was invited to join the "Tres Cruces de Oro" communal bank. On this occasion Virginia needs a loan in order to buy more merchandise, such as potatoes, lettuce, carrots, tomatoes and more. Virginia is grateful for and knows the value of this loan. She promises to be responsible as she makes her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as potatoes, lettuce, carrots, tomatoes and other items.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta se dedica a la agricultura y cultivo de trigo y cebada, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Benedicta makes a living in farming; she grows wheat and barley. Benedicta is very responsible, which is why she was invited to join the "Tres Cruces de Oro" communal bank. On this occasion Benedicta needs a loan in order to buy seeds and manure. Benedicta is grateful for and knows the value of this loan. She promises to be responsible as she makes her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en: Heyam is 19 years old. She is a single lady living with her parents and three siblings in an area of Jordan called Irbid. Heyam is a university student majoring in music. She dreams of being a musician in the future and of making her dream a source of income for her family so she can support them financially. But she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products, such as creams and body treatments.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Erick, a resilient, big, 28-year-old, Kenyan, Business Development Officer at Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organisation serving Kenyan rural smallholder farmers. He has spent all his life in Nasianda which is a very small village in the foothills of Mt. Elgon in Trans-zoia County. For a year now, he has been training and helping small-scale rural farmers find loans to acquire income-generating assets such as dairy animals, poultry and farm equipment. 

Eric is soliciting a loan to take a Strategic Management Degree Course at Mount Kenya University. 

The reason Erick is seeking an education loan is because the high cost of going to a quality university is quite prohibitive. Besides, Erick and his family are going through a series of misfortunes. His family lost the land they grew up on and in which they had invested 20 years of blood, sweat and tears, following the post-election feuds in 2007. His father lost all his retirement savings trying to seek justice. This incident deprived Erick off his opportunity to go to college. Moreover, Erick’s mother has been diagnosed with Arthritis, a condition which had paralyzed her for 12 years. She underwent a 10-hour operation at the start of the year which led the hospital bill to go through the roof. To date, the family is struggling to take care of the KES 900,000 hospital bill. 

After high school, Erick was forced to get a paying job to support his family and worked as an untrained teacher. The meagre salary only afford him a Business Administration diploma course from an institution that had long lost government funding. He later moved to a private college where he completed the diploma course in 2010. 

His first official job was with a suitcase manufacturing company in Mombasa. He later joined National Bank as an intern. After six months, he started working with Trans Kenya Sacco. It was here that he made up his mind never to be a corporate sellout by only working for social enterprises. Erick later learned about Juhudi Kilimo’s impact on his community and decided to apply for a job. 

“I believe so much in investing time and other resources in lives of people. When I saw an advert for Juhudi Kilimo Company, I couldn't resist jumping on the opportunity. After going through their website, learning about their core values, mission and vision, I decided this is the company I want to work with. Acquiring the knowledge from degree course in strategic management, will help me adapt to the changes in internal and external environment of my company. Building my capacity and fully exploiting my talents, skills, expertise and passion will not only help me have more impact on smallholder farmers but also take bigger challenges in my career.”

Hopeful and undeterred, Erick is focused on a better tomorrow filled with dreams, accomplishments and opportunities. Holding it together when everyone else would understand if he falls apart is Erick’s sign of true strength. 

Erick's favourite quote is from Nelson Mandela: "Education is the engine of personal development, it is through education that the daughter of a peasant can become a doctor, that the son of a mineworker can become the head of the mine, that the child of a farm worker can become the president of a great nation".

loans.use: To pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies such as pesticides, manure and fungicides in order to have a greater variety of crops.

loans.name: Rosa Abigail

texts.es:
Rosa de 53 años de edad, el grado de educación es de 3ª año de bachillerato,  el esposo trabaja de corralero desde hace 20 años con ese trabajo también ha aportado para  crecer a los hijos y ofrecerles educación. De esos 4 hijos, 2 están muertos murieron cuando eran niños y las dos que viven, una es enfermera y la otra estudia 2º año en la universidad.

Tiene experiencia desde que tenía 12 años de vida y la adquirió con el papá y la mamá de ella a vender lácteos. De la casa al mercado hace 15 minutos de camino a pie en las calles adoquinadas del caserío. Para obtener la mercadería ella compra la leche y la procesa. 

El crédito cera invertido en la compra de una vaca parida para tener parte de la materia prima. Con ello cubrirá la necesidad de adquirir una vaca más y por ende venderá y tendrá mejores ganancias.     

A futuro le gustaría trabajar  muy fuerte para alcanzar los objetivos propuestos.
Las ganancias las utilizaría en darle estudio a la hija que está haciendo 2º año en la universidad. El sueño de la vida de ella es ver a sus dos hijas realizada casadas y preparadas académicamente.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old and studied until the third year of her bachillerato (high school qualification). Her husband has worked with livestock for 20 years, and with this work has contributed to bringing up their children and offering them education. Of these 4 children, two died when they were young, and of the two that are living, one is a nurse and the other is studying her second year of university.

Rosa has experience of selling dairy products since she was 12, which she acquired from her mother and father. From her house to the market she walks 15 minutes along the cobbled streets of the village. To obtain her goods she buys the milk and processes it. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of a calved cow in order to make use of the raw material. With this she will cover the necessary amount to acquire another cow which she will consequently sell and therefore have better earnings.     

In the future she would like to work hard in order to achieve her objectives. She would use her earnings to pay for her daughter, who is in her second year of university, to study. Her life's dream is to see her two daughters married and academically prepared.

loans.use: to buy a calved cow in order to make use of the raw material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for looking after crops.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en:
Nigina is a young and smart woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. Nigina has two sisters. They are five people in her family. 

Nigina is a student in third course at the National State University of Tajikistan. She studies in the Faculty of Law. She studies well and takes part in many competitions. She often goes to the library. Nigina dreams of being a good lawyer in the future. Nigina’s parents do not have enough money to pay for her tuition. She is asking for a loan of 1,700 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia se dedica a la venta de verduras, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Tres Cruces de Oro” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo papas, cebollas, zanahorias y tomates, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Eusebia makes a living selling vegetables. She is a very responsible woman, which is why she was invited to join the "Tres Cruces de Oro" communal bank. On this occasion Eusebia needs a loan in order to buy more merchandise, such as potatoes, onions, carrots and tomatoes. Eusebia is grateful for and knows the value of this loan. She promises to be responsible as she makes her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as potatoes, onions, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a widowed woman who has been blessed with five children, two of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mejumaa runs a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale.She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a 31-year-old married man. He settled to earn his living in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines together with his two children. For many years, Wilfredo has been able to manage his farm so that it absolutely meets the needs of his family. Up to now, the farm has been doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. With his generated revenue, he has been able to save for their future needs. 

Recently he took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides to improve his farm. He expects an increase of harvest in order to help him improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items for fishing, such as a driftnet and blanket.

loans.name: Ana Adilia

texts.es: Doña Ana Adilia, lucha día a día por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, en conjunto a su esposo trabajan muy duro para ir comprando materiales de construcción y terminar su casita, ella labora como domestica para una casa privada y su esposo es mensajero para una empresa privada, entre los dos se dividen los gastos del hogar, este crédito lo solicita para comprar Cemento, Arena, Perlines para repellar la casa y realizar un pequeño porche y evitar así el sol. muy agradecida se muestra doña Ana Adilia por el apoyo que ha recibido de Afodenic y Kiva.
texts.en: Ana Adilia fights day by day to improve her quality of live. Along with her husband, she works very hard to continue buying construction materials to finish their little house. She works as a domestic in a private house and her husband is a messenger for a private business. Between the two of them, they split the household expenses. She requests this loan to buy cement, sand, and purlins to whitewash the house and make a small porch, so they can avoid the sun. Ana Adilia is very grateful for the help she has received from Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Oneyda Vanessa

texts.es:
Al pasar por el pequeño puesto de comida de Oneyda, no hay persona que se resista al exquisito olor del vigoron, comida tradicional nicaragüense, preparada a base de yuca, chicharrones y ensalada; su clientela siempre queda satisfecha y con ansias de volver. Ella tiene 29 años de edad, está soltera y tiene tres hijos. Inició su pequeño negocio hace tres años, en el que su familia ha sido su mayor soporte. La razón por la que trabajar cada día con ánimo y esfuerzo, son sus hijos, a quienes desea brindarle buena educación.
Ella solicita su segundo crédito para aumentar la producción de su pequeño negocio de comida, requiere comprar yuca, chicharrones, tomates, gaseosas, refresco, entre otros productos. Oneyda está agradecida por el primer financiamiento, con el que logró mejorar sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo aumentar su clientela, lo que le permitido mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Es una mujer soñadora con grandes metas, una de ella es establecer un local más amplio en el que pueda ofrecer la calidad de su comida.
texts.en:
When passing Oneyda's little food stall, there is no one who can resist the exquisite aroma of vigoron, a traditional Nicaraguan food. It is prepared with yucca, cracklings, and vegetables. Her customers are always satisfied and anxious to return. She is 29 years old, single and has three children. She started her little business three years ago and her family has been her biggest support. The reason why she works hard every day with enthusiasm is her children. She wants to give them a good education. 

She is asking for her second loan to increase production in her small food business. She needs to buy yucca, cracklings, soda, beverages, and other products. Oneyda is grateful for the first loan, with which she was able to improve her income while increasing her customers. This has allowed her to improve her living conditions. She is a dreamer with big goals. One of them is to establish a bigger locale where she can offer her quality food.

loans.use: to buy yucca, crackling, tomatoes, sodas, beverages and other products.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James lives in the rich Kisii area of South Nyanza, Kenya, with his wife and two children. He has been farming for the past 4 years and manages to produce and sell milk, eggs, and a variety of crops. His greatest challenge in farming is the cost of transporting his farm produce to the market is high. James chose Juhudi Kilimo for this Kiva loan because they have well trained and friendly loan officers. This loan will enable James to purchase a dairy cow, which will produce milk that will increase his milk supply to the market. This will lead to him have more income that will help him cater for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, pure water, sugar and cigarettes to expand her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married to a farmer and lives in the Philippines. She operates her own bakery, making and selling bread in town to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years, and she earns good income from this work. She has requested a loan to buy more ingredients to prepare bread and pastries for sale.

Zenaida is a new member of Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). In the future, she hopes to help her children finish their studies and contribute to the improvement of her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare bread and pastries for sale

loans.name: Adonis Adalberto

texts.es: El señor Adonis, casado padre de un niño pequeño, trabaja como contratista Albañil, su esposa por su parte es comerciante de frutas y verduras entre los dos se dividen los gastos del hogar, pero una de sus prioridades en su vivienda la cual necesitan mejorar ya que ellos quieren darle a su hijo mejores condiciones, este crédito lo esta solicitando para comprar Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Hierro. así podrá avanzar en gran parte su casita. Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le esta brindado con este financiamiento.
texts.en: Adonis, married and father of a little child, works as a construction contractor. His wife sells fruit and vegetables and they divide the household costs between them. But, one of their priorities is their home which they need to improve because they want to give their child better conditions. He asks for this loan to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, and metal so he can make significant improvements on his house. He is thankful for the help that Kiva and Afodenic are offering him with this funding.

loans.use: Compra de Materiales de Construccion

loans.name: Mindalina

texts.en:
Mindalina is a married woman with nine children. She is 47 years old and has four children who are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mindalina has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. Mindalina requested a 29,500 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase more materials and tools for her business. In the future, Mindalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and tools for her blacksmith business

loans.name: El Batán  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito El Batan está formado por 10 mujeres y 1 hombre quienes laboran en diferentes actividades que les permite ayudar en la economía de sus hogares, son personas muy luchadoras y siempre ven cada día con mucho optimismo y una sonrisa en sus labios. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, se caracteriza por el bello centro histórico, los 4 ríos que la bañan, su gastronomía y su cultura.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Silvia, tiene 33 años de edad, es viuda pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 15, 12, 8 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y  tres en la escuela, la casa en la que vive es propia. 
La Señora. Silvia se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y en los días de feria se dedica a la venta de una gran variedad de ropa. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa para ampliar su negocio. Su meta tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
The credit group El Batan is made up of 10 women and a man who work in a variety of jobs that allow them to help in their household economies.  They are very determined people and always greet each day with a lot of optimism and a smile on their lips. They live in the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate and is known for its beautiful historical center, the 4 rivers that run through it, its food and its culture.

One of the members of this group is Silvia, 33 years old, who is a widow but in her marriage had 4 children, ages 15, 12, 8, and 6. Her oldest child is studying at the secondary school, three are in the primary school, and she lives in her own home.

Silvia is dedicated to the care of her children and on market days, she sells a great variety of clothing. The money from her loan will be invested in purchasing clothing to expand her business. Her goal is to have her own vehicle.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 39-year-old father of two children; he works hard to provide them with the best education and living. 

Husein has been employed in a sawmill for twenty-four years. He was only fifteen years old when he had to quit school and work to support his parents. He is a hard worker who puts much effort into developing and proving himself through his special working talents.

Today, Husein is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children's increasing tuition fees. He hopes that one day in the future  he can establish his own business and develop his family's living situation.

loans.use: To pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, married with two children, operates a general store to make a living. For years in this business, she has been earning well to support her children and sustain her business. She has to improve her business for it is her only way of helping her husband to provide for the family.

Analiza borrowed money from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve her business to ensure a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.en:
Jefferson previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their Tricycle. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would now like to apply for an 11,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their Tricycle. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jefferson hopes to become successful in his business and dreams of providing all the needs of his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and the mother of one child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past five years, Janet has operated a fish-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of a high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

Janet is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase fish and cooking oil for frying the fish. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish and cooking oil for frying the fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, Pure Water and cigarettes to expand her business.

loans.name: Drane

texts.en:
Drane is a villager and has been a private farmer since 1990 with the collapse of the communist regime. Prior to the 90s, villagers worked in cooperatives and as such the government had contributed to their pensions, yet, since 1990 farmers should contribute to their own pensions. This is why Drane is requesting this loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek to pay for her pension contribution.  

Vineyard is the type of activity that she has been practicing now for very long time and in addition to it she plants seasonal veggies and other crops and has one dairy cow; the latter produce is only used for her family’s needs.

In the village where Drane lives, during the communist era,  a super-phosphate plant was built and functioned that made it impossible for agriculture to grow; however, nowadays this village is covered in greens.

loans.use: to pay for her farmer's voluntary pension contribution

loans.name: Rowaida

texts.en: Rowaida was born in 1968. She is married and has one son and one daughter. Her husband is a retired man who is currently running his own restaurant that he recently launched. Rowaida's daughter is a university student majoring in Social Services, and she is planning to work in her study field after graduation to support her family financially. As Rowaida and her husband are currently facing a financial crisis that is not helping them to pay their daughter's upcoming semester fees, Rowaida has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her daughters's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 34-year-old married mother of four children. She and her husband work hard to provide them with the best living.

Manal has been employed in a dental clinic for two years. She used to work as a salesperson in a clothes selling shop, but her current business has a better income.

Manal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car necessary for her family's transportation. She also wants to buy a new living room.

She is working hard so that in the future she might establish her own clothes selling business and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Verónica Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora Verónica forma parte del grupo de crédito El Arenal, ha sido invitada por una amiga a este grupo en el cual espera los crédito para salir en adelante, también desea estrechar los lasos de amistad con todas las socias. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda su historia y mantienen intacta su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía es variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora Verónica tiene26 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido un hijo de 5 años que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
Doña Verónica labora como empleada privada desde hace 2 años las 8 horas diarias y de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana se dedica a su negocio el cual es un puesto de comida ya que le gusta cocinar. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres y vajilla. Su meta es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Verónica is part of the El Arenal loan group. She was invited by a friend to this group, in which she hopes for loans to help her move ahead. She also wants to strengthen the bonds of friendship with all the members. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city preserves its history and maintains its colonial architecture intact. Its gastronomy is varied and captivates the palates of its visitors. Its people are kind and courteous and maintain the traditions of their peoples.

Verónica is 26 years old. She is married, and from this union she has a 5-year-old son, who is studying in a little school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not have their own house, so they live in the house of a family member.

Verónica has worked as a private employee for 2 years, 8 hours a day from Monday to Friday. On the weekends she works at her business, which is a food stand, since she likes to cook. She will use the money from her loan to buy supplies and silverware. Her goal is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies and silverware

loans.name: Myla

texts.en: Myla is 40 and blessed with four children. She owns and manages a small retail store within her community. She has been in the business for almost five years. Due to the high cost of school fees, she aims to improve her store and increase her income in order to support the education of her children. She plans to increase her product offering but has not enough capital. For this reason, she would like to obtain a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more stocks of rice, eggs, seasonings, noodles, laundry soaps and beverages to sell. She is hoping that she will obtain her loan request to be able for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, eggs, seasonings, noodles, laundry soaps and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Gulsun

texts.en: Gulsun is a kind and good-natured woman from a village in Tajikistan. She has a big family. Her family is friendly. The only family income is from her agriculture business. For more than 12 years, Gulsun has been busy with growing onions and wheat. She has 1.8 hectares of sowing land. She manages the business alone. She works hard from early morning until late evening. She is going to buy mineral fertilizers for her land but she does not have money. Gulsun is asking for a loan of 6,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Roberlita

texts.en:
Roberlita is single and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Roberlita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Roberlita has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Roberlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lousi

texts.en: Because Lousi is a conservative lady, she asked her son, Raed, to take her place in the picture. Lousi was born in 1958. She is a retired, married woman and has 1 son and 1 daughter. Her husband is also a retired man who currently works as a driver. Lousi's son is a university student majoring in Hotel Administration. His aim is to find a good job in his study field after graduation in order to support his family. They are now facing a financial crisis that is not enabling them to pay for his study fees. Because of this, Lousi has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman. She has three children, all of whom attend school. Together, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Salama has operated a kerosene selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase one tank of kerosene for her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase one tank of kerosene for her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 20-year-old married woman with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in cocoa and rice selling in her home area. She is so hardworking that the only problem is that capital to fund her business is not enough. She has been in business for six years. Janet is requesting a loan to buy cocoa and rice for selling to yield more profits.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and rice for selling.

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Oun is aged 54 years and married with four children. To make a living and support her family, Oun and her husband have been farming rice as a primary business for 15 years. She supplements their income by working for others for a fee. 

This is the first microloan for Oun with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Oun wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 65-year-old lady from Katito in Kisumu county, which is found in Nyanza Province in the western part of Kenya. She is a widow and supports two  children who are 17 and 12 years old, respectively. 

She sells sheep and has a shop which has been operating for the last three years. She generates a monthly income of KES 15,000. She has applied for her second loan with Visionfund Kenya, which she will use to purchase sheep and shop items in bulk. She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business.

Her dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and shop items in bulk.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, a mother of eight, manages her own general store to make a living. For seven years in this field of business, she has earned good income that supports the needs of her children and sustains the business. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Dana

texts.en:
Dana is 19-year-old-single lady living with her parents and seven siblings in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. She is a university student majoring in Historical Sources Repair, and she is in her first year. 

Now she is planning to find a job in her study field so that she will support her family financially, and she is seeking a loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 58 years old and married with four children who are attending school. San lives with her husband and children in Kaoh Koun Satv village, a rural area of Preah Sdach district, Prey Veng province. For the past 30 years, San has grown rice on a few parcels of land and has the support from her husband and children. Normally she is able to earn approximately USD $10 per day, which she uses for daily household expenses.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, San is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family. She will also use a portion of her loan to buy a solar home system set in order to allow her family to gain access to solar energy.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.en:
Ozoda is 37 years old. She is a kind and hardworking woman. Ozoda is married and brings up four children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Ozoda has her own business deal. She feeds cattle. Ozoda feeds sheep. She feeds sheep at her house, where she has a cowshed. Ozoda feeds them for some months and sells them in a local market. Ozoda has been in this field more than two years. 

She is going to develop her business and maximize profit. From the profit, she is going to improve her living conditions. Ozoda is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy sheep. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy sheep to sell

loans.name: María Belen

texts.es:
La Señora. María forma parte del grupo de crédito El Arenal, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad guarda su historia y mantienen intacta su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía es variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La Señora. María tiene 25 años de edad, es viuda y en su vida conyugal ha concebido una hija de 9 años de edad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar
Doña María se dedica varias actividades, labora como empleada privada,vende ropa por catalogo, tiene una tienda que es patrimonio de la familia y también se dedica a estudiar en la universidad, todas estas actividades le dan la oportunidad de salir adelante para brindarle a su familia un mejor porvenir. 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtio en la compra de ropa. Esta repitiendo el crédito para comprar víveres para su tienda y así continuar creciendo.
texts.en:
María is part of the El Arenal group. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city preserves its history and maintains its colonial architecture intact. Its gastronomy is varied and captivates the palates of its visitors. Its people are kind and courteous and maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

María is 25 years old. She is a widow, and from her married life she has a 9-year-old daughter. She does not have her own house, so she lives in her parents' house and shares the household expenses with them.

María does several kinds of work. She works as a private employee, she sells clothing through a catalog, she has a store, which is a family asset, and she also studies at the university. All of this work gives her the opportunity to move ahead in order to give her family a better future.

She used her previous loan to buy clothing. She is taking out another loan in order to buy supplies for her store and in this way continue growing.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 23-year-old married lady from Kisumu region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She supports three people in their family and has three children who are 6, 4 and 1 year old.

Ruth has been selling cereals for the last four years and she makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She is taking her third loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more cereals. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals.

loans.name: Lilian Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. Lilian forma parte del grupo de crédito El Arenal, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta guarda su historia y mantienen intacta su arquitectura colonial, su gastronomía es variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la unión y solidaridad de todas sus integrantes.
La Señora. Lilian tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos es casado vive en su casa y comparte los gastos de la casa, otro trabaja le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y también estudia en la Universidad, su último hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo labora como empleado público, la casa en la que viven es propia
Doña Lilian se dedica a su familia, labora diariamente en su tienda y también tiene un salón de belleza, estas actividades y en especial el salón de belleza le ha permitido salir adelante y ayudarles a sus hijos a que se superen.
El dinero de su crédito anterior lo ha invertido en la compra de productos para su salón de belleza y su nuevo crédito es para comprar cosméticos y víveres para su tienda.
texts.en:
Lilian is part of the El Arenal group. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city preserves its history and maintains its colonial architecture intact. Its gastronomy is varied and captivates the palates of its visitors. Its people are kind and courteous and maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples. She likes her group because of the unity and solidarity of all its members.

Lilian is 49 years old. She is married, and from this union she has 3 grown children. One of them is married, lives in her house, and shares the household expenses. Another works and helps her with the household expenses and also studies at the university. Her last son studies at a little school in the city. Her husband works as a public employee. The house in which they live is their own.

Lilian is dedicated to her family. She works every day in her store and also has a beauty salon. These activities, especially the beauty salon, have allowed her to move ahead and help her children to better themselves.

She used the money from the previous loan to buy products for her beauty salon, and her new loan is to buy cosmetics and supplies for her store.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 31-year-old married female with three children; all go to school. She has been a teacher for eight years and works eight hours a day at a primary school in Kasese, Uganda. She complains of low and delayed salary payments. Agnes wants money to pay school fees for her children, and hopes to educate them to attain degrees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Samnang is 28 years old and married. She has three children and lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, which they have been doing for six years. The current business earns them about 53,000 KHR per day and enables them to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Samnang has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Samnang wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to cultivate her rice on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna es empleada administrativa   y a la vez estudia, es una persona con ganas de superarse,  es muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia.
Comenta que aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas, es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de Auditoria, que le permitirá abrirse camino y seguir luchando por sus objetivos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su curso de especialización, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando.
texts.en:
Mirna is an administrative employee and, at the same time, she is a student.  She is a person who really wants to improve herself.  She is very responsible and is dedicated to her studies and her family.

She says that she aspires to be a good professional, to keep studying and serving people.  It is because of this that she is studying for a degree in Auditing.  This will allow her to pave her own way and keep fighting for her goals.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay for her specialization course and, in that way, to be able to keep pushing ahead.

loans.use: to pay for a specialization course.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela es de la ciudad de Luque, estudiante de la carrera de Ciencias de la Educación, actualmente se desempeña como  maestra de grado, y comenta que con esta carrera podrá tener mayores oportunidades de poder crecer y tener también mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Al terminar su carrera desea ser Directora del colegio en donde enseña, y así demostrar que si uno se esmera logra lo que quiere.
Daniela pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder estar más cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Daniela is from the city of Luque.  She is a student in the Education Sciences degree program.  Currently she works as a school teacher. She says that with this degree she will be able to have better opportunities to be able to grow, and she will also have a better income.  In this way she will be able to help her loved ones.

Upon finishing her degree, she wants to be the Principal of the school where she teaches, and in this way show that if you put forth great effort, you can achieve whatever you want.

Daniela is asking for this loan to be able to invest in paying the university fees.  In this way, she can be closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell puppies.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo tiene 26 años y está en el 4to año de Criminalística, termino sus estudios en el Colegio del colegio con mucho sacrificio. Su mayor aspiración es trabajar en el Laboratorio forense de la policía, y de esa forma poder ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Siempre quiso poder ayudar en los casos que la policía tiene, y es por medio de sus estudios que ese sueño lo podrá hacer posible. Esta agradecido por esta oportunidad que recibe, y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, ya que tiene muchos gastos y espera poder cubrirlos.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 26 years old and is in the 4th year of Criminology. With a great deal of sacrifice, he finished his studies at the school. His greatest aspiration is to work in the police forensic laboratory, and in this way be able to be a professional useful to society.

He always wanted to be able to help with the cases the police have, and it is through his studies that he will be able to make that dream possible. He is grateful for this opportunity he is receiving. He says that he is asking for this loan in order to be able to pay his degree expenses, since he has a lot of them and he hopes to be able to cover them.

loans.use: to pay degree expenses

loans.name: Khurshida

texts.en:
Khurshida is a farmer who has a plantation. She has been in the agricultural business since 2014. She sells her agriculture products at the local market. She has a lot of clients who prefer her goods because she grows vegetables with good quality. 

She is a well-bred person and has good knowledge.  

Khurshida has acquired a loan of 3,500 Somoni to buy mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support and believes that your support will help make her living conditions better.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers
